Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, venta de centros de polleras, venta de ropa, venta de artefactos, venta de comida.

La señora Ruth,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de de garrafa para cocinar) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración de sus productos los comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el seguro de vida.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Graciela ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Droplets of Gold” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Los Andes central office. It is made up of seven members and is led by a board of directors, headed by Ruth. There are many businesses that the members of the association help get started, including grocery stores, selling traditional skirts in malls, selling clothes, selling artifacts, and selling food. 

Ruth says that she has been working for Pro Mujer for two years and that she became a member of the institution at the invitation of a loan officer. Right now she has a business selling food, which she has been doing for years. 

The loan which she is taking out now is to increase her capital (purchase of carafes for cooking) that she will get from the bank and later for the making of her products, which she will sell at her place of work. This type of job allows her to make money to support her family. She lives in a shared living space and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan and the life insurance. 

Graciela is not in the photograph because she had a doctors appointment.

loans.use: to purchase carafes.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra en nuestra maravillosa selva y en la cual alberga a flora y fauna muy hermosa, es una ciudad en la cual se puede ver todo el esplendor de la naturaleza y donde podemos desconectarnos del ruido. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre Maria sale a pasear por las calles de su ciudad para despejarse y relajarse un poco y en ocasiones aprovecha para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo con papa a la huancaína”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora de arte.

Día a día Maria sale a trabajar en su negocio de elaboración y venta de cigarro mapacho, el cual está hecho a base de tabaco molido y canela  y lo usan las personas que viven en la selva como medicina o también para espantar a los zancudos y mosquitos de la zona, asimismo se puede masticar y sirve como una especie de laxante;  ella cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que es amable con los clientes.

Maria agradece el apoyo brindado por los prestatarios Kiva ya es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y su confianza y gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales como calaminas, madera, clavos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá reparar el techo de su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá seguir luchando  para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:    ” Tener una mejor calidad de vida”.

loans.use: Para compra de materiales para arreglo de techo

loans.name: Fabien

texts.fr: Fabien est un homme de 33 ans fiancé et père d'un enfant d'un an. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir sa boutique de vêtements.
texts.en:
Fabien is a 33-year-old man who is engaged and the father of a one-year-old child. He has been a retail merchant in a local market for the past ten years, where he sells second-hand clothes for young men and women (depending on the season and the contents of the bales).

Because of his limited working capital, he is forced to go to the unpacking of bales every weekend to buy retail clothing he then displays in his stall. This does not really bring him much profit, and explains the importance of a loan for his business, since he will then be able to buy a whole mixed bale.

He will save the extra profits generated by this loan to expand his clothing store.

loans.use: buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Felishina

texts.en: Mercy is 40 years old, married with 6 children. Two of her children are already married and have their homes whereas the rest are still in secondary and primary schools. Mercy has been the Treasurer of Kagaa Witeithie Women Group a position she has held since January 2005. She is trustworthy, a dedicated and hard working member of the group. Mercy has a retail shop at Ngurweini trading center. She sells maize flour, rice, sugar, and other household items. She also has a small farmland where she grows maize, beans and vegetables for home consumption and some for selling. In addition, she has a dairy cow and this gives her milk for sell as we as for home consumption. Most of her income comes from her retail shop and others supplement. Her monthly net income is about $73 and this is very low to support her family in future.

loans.use: Mercy wants to stock maize flour, wheat flour, rice, Soap, salt, Maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand tailoring business

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich T. and his wife (pictured here) own a small rice and Khmer food restaurant in Phnom Penh.  He has 6 children that all work with him at the restaurant--1 as the chef and the other 5 as servers and busboys.  With this loan, he will buy more food supplies, as well as decorations to make his restaurant more pleasant.  In the future, Pich T. would like to buy a clothes store at the market for his children to work at after they graduate from university.

loans.use: To buy food for his business

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocenta M. wishes to take a loan in order to purchase more raw materials. She will purchase water and other basic ingredients, such as cooking oil. Aside from selling “drinking” water, she also does raffles with the cooking oil (in one gallon units) at RD$10 per ticket. She also does “bottle washing” as a (major) complementary job to aid her in getting food to the table of six people.

Inocenta, a mother of 5, lives in a community called “Casabe” (comes from “Casava”, an ancient Taino Indian substitute for bread). One of their children lives with her sister, so as to alleviate the "load," but along with her husband, she has to to feed their other children.

loans.use: To buy water and ice

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is a hardworking mother of 2. She was born in Ayacucho, Peru, where she now lives in a modest home with her husband. Monday through Friday she sells Avon cosmetics, from her home and door-to-door. On the weekends, Rosal wakes up early and heads to the center of town to purchase “pescado y mariscos,” fish and seafood. The fresh fish comes in every Saturday, and so she only sells the fish through Sunday when it is the freshest.

Rosal's clients are “el pueblo” or the people of her neighborhood. She sells fish at a small market, but is one of the only vendors and does very well. Her most popular product is “jurel,” which is also her cheapest fish. It is silver in color and sells for about $1 U.S. She began this business 9 years ago, and has been steadily growing the business ever since. Recently she hired an employee to help her transport the fish, so that she can buy and sell larger amounts. She hopes to continue to grow her business with the help of a $300 loan.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of fish for resale

loans.name: Issatu

texts.en:
Issatu is 33 years old and married with two children. She started her business three years ago on a small scale in Yataya village in Sierra Leone. She changes her inventory according to the season to offer seasonal items when they will bring the highest price.

Issatu sells rice, oil, dried beans, and sometimes clothes. Issatu diversified her business to some extent with her previous loans. She needs an additional loan to expand her business further for more profit.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of her inventory for her general store

loans.name: Kumuhoy

texts.en: Kumushoy is a happy mother of 3 children. She loves them very much and tries to do all she can to see their happy faces. Her business is to sell perfumes and other cosmetic products, and she likes her activity. She says that she helps her clients to choose perfumes with great pleasure. Every day she has many customers near her stall. She has only high quality goods from different cosmetics firms such as Dove, Oriflame, Avon, and so on. At present she wants to purchase a big batch of goods as she hopes to have a profitable New Year.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and other cosmetic products to prepare presents for the New Year.

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Ms Hoa is 23, she is married and has 1 daughter. Everyday she goes to the market near her house to sell vegetables and fruits. She also raises pigs at home. Her husband is a cabinet maker. Ms Hoa has never applied for a loan before. When she learned that BinhMinh fund (SEDA) opened a branch in her town, she had applied for a loan because the conditions are easy to meet. She would use the loan to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva vonlunteer.

Chị Hoa 23 tuổi, chi đã có 1 con gái. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ bán hoa quả tại chợgần nhà. Ngoài ra chị con chăn nuôi tại nhà một đàn lợn thịt. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc chuyên đóng hàng nội thất. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu. Khi biết đến chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh về đến tận nơi chị sinh sống và hình thức cho vay rất tiện lợi và phù hợp, chị đã tham gia ngay để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ cho việc kinh doanh của chị.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits

loans.name: Elburus

texts.en: Elburus A. is 30 years old, married and has one son. He lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small food market in the village. He started his business five years ago. He is  applying to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $950 to purchase more types of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en: Idrissa sells used shoes in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. He would like to increase his stock with the latest models to attract more customers. Idrissa is therefore requesting another loan of $350 for this purpose.  Idrissa is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children.

loans.use: Idrissa wants his business to remain competetive and would use the loan to purchase shoes in all the latest styles that would satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth is 32 years old and is married with three children, ages 1-10. Aneth sells cosmetics, which she started doing in 1998. She works every day from 8.30 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Paor

texts.en:
Paor C. is a 48-year-old entrepreneur who helps support her family by running two businesses with her husband. She makes about $3 a day producing Khmer (or rice) wine, one of the most popular beverages in her province. People serve it at parties because it is very cheap and does not harm their health. Her husband, Chou Vy, age 50, is a taxi driver and normally makes around $12 a day . They have three children, all of whom are students.

To increase her family's income, Paor has applied for a loan from Kiva to replace her husband's old taxi, which is unreliable and use a lot of gas -- a major problem now that gas prices are so high. (Picture: Paor and her husband Chou)

loans.use: To buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiev K. R., 41, is a mother of four single children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as teachers at Ta Koak High School since 1998, making collectively about $4 each day. Now the income she and her husband make is barely enough to supplement her entire family. Because of the inflation, the prices of goods like gasoline and other commodities in Cambodia are very expensive.

In order to generate more income to cover her daily expenses, Khiev K. R. would like to run a new business making and selling dessert near the school where there are a lot of students passing by. To do this, Khiev K. R. has requested a loan to help her get started. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Khiev K. R. was not available).

loans.use: To open a new business making and selling dessert

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch K. H. is 36 years old, and since 2000 she has sold groceries in her village. There are not many sellers who sell the same products as she does, so her stall is one of the main suppliers in the village. On average, she makes $7.50 in revenue each day. Her husband is a wedding chef and per day he can earn $3.30. This couple has five dependents. Three are her children who are at school, plus their mother and their brother.

To meet customer demand, which is increasing every day, she would like to take out a loan from Kiva to purchase more groceries to sell. (This picture was taken at one of CREDIT's offices.)

loans.use: To buy more groceries to increase inventory.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita started her small business selling cosmetics and beauty products, to help pay for family expenses and schooling for her children. She got into the business in order to assure that her children are able to receive an education. Since starting her business she also began selling sweet both to individual customers and wholesale. These days her business is going well, thanks to her good customers.

Margarita is asking for a loan of US $1,000, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase merchandise, market her business and increase her sales. She trusts that with Kiva’s help, she will get the loan she needs to improve her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita inicio el negocio de la venta de cosméticos y artículos de belleza, para ayudar en los gastos económicos de su hogar ya que tenían los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, por tal motivo inicio ese negocio. Posteriormente empezó con la venta de dulces a mayoreo y menudeo, hasta hoy en día le ha ido bien gracias a sus clientes.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito por US $1,000 que pagara en 3 meses, para la compra de mercancía, para ampliar el negocio, y darle publicidad y a la vez para poder incrementar sus ventas, Ella confía que con el apoyo Kiva obtendrá el financiamiento.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is 28-years-old, is married with two children, ages 7 and 2. Since 2007, she has owned a small charcoal store. She works from 6AM to 6PM each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales. Tatu  would like a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kinméfondo

texts.fr:
Monsieur V. Kinméfondo est né en 1960 à Anyronkopé et vit dans la ville d’Aného. Chauffeur de profession, il est marié et père de huit enfants. Très dynamique, il exerce aussi le maraîchage ; ce qui lui permet de combler quelques vides financiers.

Il rend service dans le domaine des transports avec son ancien véhicule. Aussi est il celui qu’on sollicite le plus pour les déménagements. Aujourd’hui les pannes répétées de son véhicule ne lui permettent plus de réaliser ses revenus habituels sinon, des pertes.

Ainsi, il veut le changer. Mais en manque d’argent, il sollicite un crédit  pour compléter son avoir afin d’acheter un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Mr. Kinméfondo V. was born in 1960 in Anyronkopé and lives in the town of Aného. He is a driver by trade, married and the father of eight children. Very energetic, he also practices market gardening ; this allows him to fill in some financial gaps.

He provides services in the transportation business with his old vehicle. He is also the one most called upon for moving jobs. Today with his vehicle's repeated breakdowns, he is not only not able to bring in his usual income, he has losses. So he wants to change it, but he is lacking the funds. He is requesting a loan to complete his down payment so he can buy another vehicle.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Née à Afagnan en 1985, A. Ablavi est une jeune femme célibataire. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a cessé l’école pour apprendre la couture. Aujourd’hui elle n'arrive pas à exercer cette activité mais s'est lancée dans le commerce de céréales qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle achète le maïs en période d’abondance et le revend dans le temps de soudure. Les bénéfices de cette activité très rentable lui serviront à augmenter ses revenus et à mieux subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Afagnan, Ms. Ablavi A. is a young unmarried woman. Educated through primary school, she dropped out to learn how to sew. As the manager of a seamstress shop today, she wants to reconcile this aptitude, which she inherited from her mother, with commerce. She wants to buy corn while it is abundant now and to resell it when it is scare. This being a very gainful business, the profits will let her provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking and selling corn

loans.name: Impecables Group

texts.es:
El grupo impecables esta representado por Leyda Livian,  existen dos hermanas entre las socias la señora Sonia y Rosmeri, cada una tiene ingresos y negocios totalmente independientes ya que una se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y la otra a la compra y venta de vehículos a medio uso, el resto de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, de comestibles, verduras, animales, electrodomésticos y productos de la temporada en las ferias de nuestra ciudad.
Son gente con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que algunas eran integrantes de otros grupos que se fueron disolviendo y se acoplaron en uno nuevo.
El financiamiento esta destinado al incremento de insumos para la venta y al crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Impecables" (The Impeccables) are represented by Leyda Livian. There are two sisters among the members, Mrs. Sonia and Rosmeri, each has her own income and business; one works making pastries and the other buys and sells second-hand vehicles. The remaining members sell cosmetics, foodstuffs, vegetables, animals, electronics and seasonal products at the markets in our city. They are experienced in solidarity groups as some of them have previously been members of discontinued groups so they joined a new one. The financing is targeted for increasing materials for selling and growing their small businesses to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales, viven con ella 3 de ellos. Desde muy joven trabajó en la chacra, para poder mantener y educar a sus hijos  conjuntamente con su esposo, en esos tiempos negociaban las frutas que cosechaban en su misma chacra. Pero hace 10 años se propuso comprar fruta y junto a sus productos, enviar por grandes cantidades al mercado mayorista de la capital. A Elena le agrada mucho la venta y sobre todo ahora que tiene un mercado estable al cual abastecer, está feliz, y lo importante es que le genera ganancias considerables que le permiten llevar una vida decorosa, por el momento no tiene dificultades en su negocio, solo que de vez en cuando el precio cotizado baja, y esto afectan sus ganancias. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y no tiene problemas en pagar todas sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el dinero solicitado se abastecerá de más frutos cítricos, ya que en la capital es tiempo de verano, por ello quiere invertir en la compra de más frutas.
texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children, of whom 3 still live at home. Since she was very young she has worked on the farm in order to support and educate her children along with her husband. Today they have a fruit business using fruit they have grown on their farm. 10 years ago she proposed selling fruit and fruit products, sending large quantities to the wholesale market in the capital. Elena enjoys sales very much and above all now that she has a stable market to supply to, she is happy, and what is important is that this business generates considerable income which enables her to have a respectable life. For the moment she does not have any difficulties with her business, only every now and then when the prices lower does this affect her earnings. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Primsa, and she doesn’t have any problems paying her payments punctually. With the money she will stock citrus fruits, as in the capital it is summer, so she wants to invest in buying more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fruits to sell

loans.name: Herminia Margarita

texts.es:
Herminia es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro 
Herminia es casada tiene 59 años cinco hijos   de 37, 33, 32, 30 y 25 años, cuatro de sus hijos están casados y el último está soltero.
Tiene  una pequeña tienda en su casa, empezó hace dos años, y  por las tardes en su tienda se dedica a vender comida  y   tiene una combi que la trabaja su esposo. 
Desde  que ella  recibe los préstamos, ha podido invertir en su negocio y comprar llantas para su combi y productos para su tienda.
Herminia necesita  un préstamo  de 800 soles, que los va a invertir en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y en la compra de abarrotes para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future). She is a 59-year-old married mother of five children, aged 37, 33, 32, 30 and 25 years old, all married themselves, except the youngest. She runs a small shop out of her home, which she started two years ago. She sells food from her shop in the afternoons and she has a small van, which her husband works for her. Since she began receiving loans she has been able to invest in her business, buying tires for the van and products for her shop. Herminia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sodas, beers, and provisions to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Herminia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sodas, beers, and provisions to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George K., twenty-five, is single and independant. George lives alone in a rented apartment in Bawjiase community near Accra. Most of the inhabitants of Bawjiase are either in farming or buy and sell in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses. George is a merchant and sells in soft drinks. He sells varieties of drinks and mineral water in both bottles and cans, such as Coca Cola, Fanta, pineapple juice, Sprite, etc.

George orders the drinks directly from the manufacturers in Accra where the cost is economical. He believes he can scale up his business with additional working capital so he wants a loan to order more drinks and mineral water so that he can distribute to a larger number of customers. He is a member of "Maranatha Trust Bank" group. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 55-years old and married with three children. Titilayo sells provisions, bottle water, and drinks, a business she's been doing for many years. Titilayo is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. This will improve her income and help her better provide for her family. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria F. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el cercado del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales (quinua, cebada, cañigua, etc.) en los mercados de Arequipa y Puno, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de Quinua para llevar a la ciudad de Arequipa.  
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra de mercaderías para su negocio (chuño, habas, quinua, etc.) para poder venderlo en las ferias y mercados de la ciudad de Arequipa, donde viaja permanentemente su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Tacna o Arequipa, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y es por ello que viene trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Gregoria F. M. is a member of Unión 28 de Julio Communal Bank in the nearby district Yunguyo, province Yunguyo, departament de Puno, Peru; she is forty-nine years old, and the single mother of six. She completed the fifth grade in primary school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for twelve years. Gregoria buys and sells grains (quinua, barley, cañigua, etc.) at markets in Arequipa and Puno. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to buy Quinua to sell in the city Arequipa. Gregoria is requesting a loan of S/. 2000.00, which she will repay in three monthly installments. She will use the loan to buy merchandise (potato flour, beans, quinua, etc.) to sell at fairs and street markets in Arequipa, where she goes constantly; she yearns to buy a house in the city of Tacna or Arequipa. She also dreams that her children will become professionals, which is why she works with such dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise: potato flour, beans, quinua, etc.

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en:
Rosane P. has spent her whole life on the farm. Her parents are farmers, and she has understood the process of growing rice and producing a good harvest ever since she was a child. Now, she is 37 years old and has two children. She wants to expand her farm in order to support her children's education. Schooling is quite expensive, so she needs to double her yield to pay tuition and other school fees.

Rosane is requesting a loan of 12 000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and foliar pesticides for her farm. The loan will really help Rosane attain maximum crop yields.

More about CEVI
CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and run their own business. It gives its clients credit, training and insurance to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anita Elizabeth

texts.es:
ANITA ELIZABETH S. S. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, vive en el distrito de Callería, ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 44 años de edad, trabaja como consultora de productos de belleza, su esposo trabaja como transportista y tienen 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para invertir en la venta de abarrotes al por menor en las afueras de su casa. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará prendas de vestir y productos de belleza para venderlas al contado y a corto plazo.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la ayuda a tener un capital con el que puede trabajar, beneficiando directamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
ANITA ELIZABETH S. S. A., is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”. She lives in the district of Callería, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 44 years old and works as a beauty product consultant. Her husband works as a carrier and they have 3 children. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years, and the first loan that she received was for the sum of 300 Nuevo S. (Peruvian Currency). She used it to invest in retail grocery sales in the outskirts of her home. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevo S., she will purchase articles of clothing and beauty products to sell for cash in the short term. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because she helps her to have capital with which she can work, directly benefiting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.  Purchase of articles of clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is a trader, selling charcoal. She sells the charcoal on a tabletop in her community. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby communities.Victoria also sells onions. She distributes to retailers and food vendors. 
Victoria is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children have completed school and learned trades. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central region of Ghana. 
Victoria works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in this business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. Victoria is hoping to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jeannot

texts.fr: Il a son atelier dans le quartier Gadapara de kolda. Il fabrique des lits, des chaises, des armoires et autres objets d'art en bois d'ébéne principalement. Il est célibataire mais soutien de famille et participe à toutes les dépenses grace à son métier. Il voudrait disposer de plus de stock de bois afin de faire face aux éventueeles commandes et ainsi augmenter se revenus.
texts.en:
His workshop is in the Gadapara district of Kolda. He makes beds, chairs, armoires, and art objects, principally out of ebony. He is unmarried but supports his family and helps cover the expenses, thanks to his work in this trade. He would like to have more wood in his inventory in order to address possible work orders and thus to increase his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his carpenter's wood-working shop

loans.name: Li

texts.en: The strict-face person shown in the picture is S., age 34, who lives in Phnom Penh. She usually buys fish in bulk on credit at the cheapest price from her wholesale supplier and then sells at retail in the local market to gain a profit. She normally uses a motorbike to supply her investment. From her business, she typically makes around $4 income each day to manage her family's daily expenses more sufficiently. To help meet the family's demands a little more, her husband works in construction. This couple resides with their three young children who are of school-age. S.'s investment has also been interrupted because her motorbike often breaks down. Because of this problem, S. has decided to seek a loan to repair her old motorbike and to use as capital in her selling-fish business.

loans.use: To repair her motorbike and to use as capital

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 43 years old. She is divorced and blessed with four children. Currently, the children are in school. She has been sewing for seventeen years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are classy. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers new look, kids' school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc.

Magdalene wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education. She claims all family responsibility rests on her shoulders as a single mother.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She sells yams wholesale and retail. She is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto de 38 años de edad, casado y con residencia en los Laureles Sur, en la capital de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa y condos hijos de 11 y12 años que cursan la primaria, sus planes es  poder terminar de construir su casa para una mejor seguridad de su familia, el se dedica ala mecánica textil desde hace nueve años. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual se siente contento de poder trabajar con la institución por que ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda mediante los prestamos. Con este crédito va  comprar dos puertas ya que las que tiene están en mal estado, a si como hace un alero en la casa para cubrirse más de las lluvias. Su meta es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto is 38 years old. He is married and lives in Laureles Sur, capital of Managua. His spouse is a housewife and they have two children of 11 and 12 years of age, who are students. His plan is to be able to finish the construction of their house in order to provide security to the family. Roberto has worked as a textile technician for nine years. This is his third cycle with Afodenic. Dealing with them, has allowed him to make improvements to their home, through loans. With this loan, he will purchase two doors, since the ones he has now are in poor condition. He will also build an awning on the house for better protection from rain. His goal is to be able to help his sons become respectable people.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two doors and construction of an awning

loans.name: Sorry For Me Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata F., Mariatu B., Idrissa K. and Mahawa C.. They named their group Sorry For Me II. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from Kiva through SMT and they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each. Such a loan can create a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers. They will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits, thereby improving their standards of living.

Aminata F. (second from left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty years of age and was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged five and seven.

Aminata sells ready-to-wear-clothes both for adults and children. She has been in this business for more than ten years now. With this new loan, she will expand her business.

To Aminata and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as putting some money aside for emergencies.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 52 years old and married to Virgilio. They have two children who are both married and living with their own families. Despite her age, Emelita is still very determined to continue in business and save money for times of emergency. 

Emelita runs a crochet business. She also sells native cakes and different snacks in their village in Calao East, Santiago City. Her crochet products include cell phone cases, refrigerator and television top dresses, curtains, and women's clothing. She is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 from Kiva lenders to further develop her business. She will use the loan to purchase the materials she needs for crochet making.

loans.use: To purchase crochet materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is married and has one child. She has been through senior high school.  Josephine sells already made dresses, shoes and local fabrics at castle near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 1989. Her husband is a driver.  Josephine uses her income to support the husband in the payment of utility bills.  Josephine will use the loan to purchase more local fabrics and clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to save to invest into her childrens education.

loans.use: Josephine will use the loan to purchase more local fabrics and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Kouyaté est mariée, elle a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problèmes. Elle veut renforcer sa cantine qui se trouve au marché central de son quartier en marchandises. Les bénéfices escomptés lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady Kouyaté is married and cares for three children. She has been a member of the village bank "Boucotte Place Gao" for seven years and got 14 loans which she repaid all without difficulty. She wants to stock up her canteen, which is located at the central market of her neighborhood. The expected profit will enable her to contribute to a higher standard of living for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her canteen

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda C., 52 years old, is married to Danilo C. who is the same age. They have four children: Julius Bryan, 27; Dennis, 26; April Abegail, 25; and Sarah Jane, 23. Melinda and Danilo are proud parents because poverty has never been a hindrance for their children to finish their studies. All of their children are college graduates, which is the happy result of their hardship. However, it never ends, because what they want now is to make their fishing business continue to grow. This is important to them because this business has been providing for their family for 26 years.

Danilo is a fisherman and he manages the fishing business. Melinda helps him by selling the fish that he catches in the sea to the market or to their neighborhood. Their dilemma is that their fishing boat that her husband uses in catching fish in the sea was damaged by Typhoon Ondoy (Ketsana) that entered into the area of the Philippines. Now, instead of buying a new boat, they want to build their own boat so that they can be sure that it is more durable. They will use the loan that Melinda will receive through the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), to buy materials for building a fishing boat.

What Melinda hopes right now is that their business will continue to run, because this has been their life. They love what they do in making the business grow.

loans.use: To build a fishing boat for her fishing business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok P. is taking out her first loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location on which she will grow different kinds of crop. In addition, she will rent her land out to other farmers for a fee. She is 45 years old and married. She and her husband are local cultivators. They have three children: two are married and one is still young. Two of the children are employed in various occupations. This couple currently generates an income of approximately $5 per day from their business.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen C., 45, is married with four children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business selling balloons, earning collectively an income of US $8 per day. Her husband always helps his wife in the business. The family is also assisted by three of her children who are able to earn an income of US $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a car to operate a new business, selling kitchen utensils. This car will enable C. and her husband to transport those utensils easily for sale in her province. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a used car

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una socia trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 59 años y es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
Juana se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza, actividad que realiza diariamente, por lo que da crédito y cobra diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace ocho años y està en el movimiento Manuela Ramos el cual le ha permitido generar ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de artículos de belleza.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 2100.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de prendas de vestir. La meta de Juana es tener un local propio para construir su boutique.
texts.en:
Juana is a hard working, enthusiastic woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three adult children. Juana sells clothing and beauty supplies to her customers for cash and credit. She has been part of the communal bank, “Las Libertadoras” for the past eight years and is part of the " Manuela Ramos" movement (an organization in Peru that works to improve opportunities for women), which has allowed her to generate income so that she could help her husband pay for their children's educations. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100) which she invested in beauty supplies. Now she is requesting a loan of 2100 PEN ($750) which she will invest in clothing for resale. Juana's goal is to someday own a location where she can build her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor Román tiene 48 años de edad vive con su esposa la señora Olga Luisa Jordán que tiene 40 años, tienen tres hijos, uno en edad escolar y otro cursando la secundaria, el señor Victor es propietario de la casa donde viven, donde tiene una despensa, la que pudo montar gracias a la ayuda de su señora quien es de profesión docente.
Se inicio como comerciante en el año 1990, y eligió este rubro ya que entonces no había mucho negocio y no iba a tener mucha competencia en la zona donde está ubicada desde entonces ha podido llevar adelante su negocio.
Desde el año 2002 empezó a trabajar con la  Fundación Paraguaya y con los préstamos recibidos  va creciendo su negocio 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de más mercaderías ya que se están aproximando las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Victor Román is 48 years of age and lives with his wife, Olga Luisa Jordán, who is 40 years old. They have three children, one who is school age and another who is in high school. Victor is the owner of the house where they live and where they have a grocery store, which they were able to start thanks to the help of his wife who is a teacher. He started as a trader in 1990 and he elected this career since at that time there were not a lot of businesses and he wouldn't have a lot of competition in the area where he's located. Since then, he has been able to get ahead with his business. Since the year 2002, he began to work with Fundación Paraguaya and with the loans received his business has been growing. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase more merchandise since the end of the year festivities are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: Sugar, rice, noodles, oil, milk and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia A. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión del negocio, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así tener variedad de inventario. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias, ya que es madre soltera y tiene una hija adolescente bajo su responsabilidad y quiere darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia A. has sold used clothing for over three years now. She lacks enough stock and doesn't have the funds to invest in more varied inventory, thus the need to seek funding. She plans to repay using part of her profits because she is a single mother of a teen-age daughter and she wants to provide her with the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Byambatsetseg

texts.en:
Byambatsetseg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son, aged 16, is in secondary school while the youngest has not reached school age yet. Besides helping with the family business, her husband takes care of their children and does all the housecleaning.

Byambatsetseg manages a meat-trading business in her town with the help of her husband, selling a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 1999 after working as a teacher for five years and has built a successful operation over the years.

Byambatsetseg received her first loan from Xacbank in 2008. Since then she has been a very trustworthy recipient and has made good progress with the loan. Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. This is her second Kiva loan and she wants to use the money in order to expand her business. She says, “All I want is to have happy and nice life.”

Byambatsetseg is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat to sell during upcoming national holiday.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling children's clothing and women's accessories

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Emilia es casada tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Emilia tiene un taller D. confecciones D. ropa típica, productos que venD. en los mercados y ferias D. la región.
Emilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas.
Los sueños D. Emilia son construir su casa con material noble e implementar su taller con maquinas modernas.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the communal bank "Milenio." She is married, 49 years old, and has 4 children. Emilia has a workshop where she makes traditional Peruvian clothing, which she sells in the markets and fairs in the region. Emilia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of fabric. Emilia dreams of building her own home with quality materials, and equipping her workshop with modern sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jujeth

texts.en:
Jujeth S. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Jujeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jujeth owns & operates a business venture selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jujeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jujeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jujeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jujeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the village of Marilucao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old and married with two small children. To make a living, she runs a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. N. is a mid-wife professionally, and she has run this business in her local village since 2005. She lives in Nambale, Busia District. She is 33 years old, married and blessed with 6 children. 

She would like a loan of KShs. 20,000 which she will use to equip her business in terms of medicines and a stethoscope, and process her referal points for her clients. Her future plan is to further her education and expand her business to ensure her children are guaranteed education.

loans.use: Equip her mid-wife services

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Samaké est âgée de 39 ans, veuve et   mère  de 5 enfants. Elle  vit avec ses enfants  dans le quartier Médina coura de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso ). 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école,  pour des raisons sociales, elle embrassa  tôt les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge, auprès de sa maman. 
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour  l’achat et la vente du bois de chauffe il y a 2 ans.  
Pour  combattre ses ruptures et satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps à rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 5 ans.  
Après  5 prêts solidaires tous payés correctement, elle est à son 4eme prêt individuel dont les trois précédents ont été payés sans difficulté.  
Madame Fatoumata compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat, d’un chargement de camion remorque en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des villages  environnants  Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte.   
Madame Fatoumata  compte réaliser un   bénéfice  de 75 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, satisfaire le besoin  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité..
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Samaké is 39 years old, a widow and mother to five children. She lives with her children in the Médina Coura district of the prefecture (administrative region) of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso). Since she left school rapidly, for social reasons, she began her income-generating activities at an early age, with her mother. Having tried out several activities without success, she finished by opting for the purchase and sale of firewood two years ago. In order to overcome ruptures of stock and to satisfy customer needs, she did not waste any time joining the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After five group loans, all of which were repaid in full, she is now on her fourth individual loan, the three preivous loans having been repaid without difficulty. Fatoumata is planning on using this loan for the purchase of a lorry trailer load of firewood from peasants in the surrounding villages of Koutiala and she sells it in front of her door. She is planning on making a profit of 75,000FCFA a month which she will use for the repayment of interest and to satisfy her family's needs; the balance will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad P. is from the village of San Isidro. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Natividad owns and operates a habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Natividad's husband is the driver of the habal-habal. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena L., 35, has been managing her own variety store and loading station for quite some time now. She is married to Orlando L., a factory worker, and they are blessed with a child in their marriage. She is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Rowena has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, Rowena would like to apply for a 20,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy groceries to replenish her current product inventory. She will also invest some of the loan amount in the purchase of cellular phone load for different networks. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and cellular phone load for different networks

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold C. Jr. is a 22-year-old, single man from the village of Port Area Iligan City. To earn a living, Arnold owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. More specifically, his primary source of business income is derived from providing computer services (games and internet acces) to local community members. Arnold has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Arnold joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, he was able to to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his standard of living. Notably, Arnold has already successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. Arnold is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide his services. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Arnold from HSPFI. He plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its mission is to reach out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante L. is from the village of Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renante owns and operates a business buying and selling different kind of fruits in the local community. Renante has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Renante joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

location.town: Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos Mauricio P. Z. de 52 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, el cual se dedica a la elaboración de desayunos, almuerzos, pupusas, tortillas, así como también a la venta de jugos, batidos de frutas y sodas. Carlos reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 13 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. El negocio esta ubicado en Antiguo Cuscatlán, cerca de La Universidad José Simeón Cañas, lo cual es un enorme beneficio para él ya que la mayoría de estudiantes, prefieren este tipo de negocios, ya que brindan los alimentos a menor precio, así mismo Carlos cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales son empleados de diferentes oficinas las cuales se encuentran alrededor de su negocio,  a pesar que él cuenta con una gran competencia, el trata de elaborar lo mejor posible su trabajo para poder contar siempre con sus clientes frecuentes y así mismo que estos lo recomienden con otras personas, Carlos es un hombre muy responsable, amable y dedicado a su trabajo. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda cotar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de más comida y de esta forma ampliar su menú, y así mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y con un gran deseo de seguir consumiendo los productos de Carlos, lo cual es de mucha importancia para él y su familia, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Carlos Mauricio P. Z., 52, is a hardworking man whose business is making breakfasts, lunches, pupusas (typical Central American food-cornmeal filled with cheese, or pork or beans) tortillas, and he also sells juices, fruit shakes and sodas. Carlos lives in Antiguo Cuscatlán with his wife, their three children: 12, 13 and 7 - all students. The business is located in Antiguo Cuscatlán near the José Simeón Cañas University. The location is a great benefit because the majority of students like this type of business since food is offered at a lower price. Also Carlos has many customers who are workers in different offices that are found nearby. Despite the fact that there is a lot of competition, he tries to make the best possible food so that he can always count on regular customers and that they will recommend him to others. Carlos is a very responsible and friendly man who is dedicated to his work. He is asking for the loan to have money to be able to buy a greater quantity of the necessary ingredients so that he can make more food, broaden his menu, and thus keep his customers satisfied and continue eating what he sells. This is very important to him and to his family since the business is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients to prepare food

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en:
Ilyas N. is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. For the last four years Ilyas has been working as a market vendor. He sells food products which are always in demand among the population. His monthly income is about 500 Azerbaijani manat (AZN).

The love for his child is the biggest reason for Ilyas to make an effort to provide what his family needs. Ilyas is planning to enlarge the range of his goods and is requesting 1000 AZN to do so.

loans.use: purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: 18.7.058 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thuỳ Hồ Thị (29) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thuỳ is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 058 - Quảng Hưng (18.7.058 Quảng Hưng ).

Thuỳ is single and has an adult-aged child. To make a living, Thuỳ raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Thuỳ has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2010, Thuỳ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuỳ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 4248000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuỳ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Liên (33) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

2. Hành (28) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

3.  Tình (32) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

4. Nhung (31) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

5.  Cúc (30) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

6.  Hạnh (27) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuỳ Hồ Thị (29) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thuỳ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 058 - Quảng Hưng (18.7.058 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Thuỳ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuỳ kiếm được khoảng 500000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thuỳ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuỳ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Liên (33) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Nhung (31) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya A. is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and fence, owned by her parents-in-law, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, 8, attends an elementary school while her youngest daughter stays at home.
Oyuntuya operates a clothing retail trading business in the local community. She started her private business in 2002 by selling a variety of fancy articles and accessories and has been engaged in her current business since 2010. She has gained many years' experience in her trading business. Oyuntuya is a very open-minded, intelligent and resourceful person. In the future, she wants to expand her business and save money. She says "My husband and I are planning to have our own land for my family from using business earnings." Oyuntuya is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT to expand her business by increasing her product lines in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda, who is 40 years old and married, lives with her three adult children in a rural neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. For the last ten years Hermelinda has sold chicken in the Mercado Modelo, one of the major markets in the city of Chiclayo. She purchases chickens from wholesalers and then processes the meat into appropriate sizes and cuts to sell to her customers at retail prices. In the photo, the chickens that are smaller and slightly darker come from the small farms of local individuals, while the ones that are larger and slightly lighter in color come from large scale factory farms. The small farm-raised chickens sell for a higher price due to their stronger flavor and more natural meat.

Hermelinda has already worked with our institution a number of times in the past, always making punctual payments and completing the requirements of the loan. Her previous loans have been for values between $200.00 and $250.00. This will be the largest loan she has yet undertaken, and she will use it to purchase a larger quantity of chicken from the wholesalers in order to receive a greater bulk discount. She expects to be able to increase her profit margin significantly by completing the bulk purchase, and hopes to be able to continue to improve her business and expand her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of chicken

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Josephine is a widowed mother of four school-aged children who all attend school. She has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for eight years. Her mixed farm produces vegetables, milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. She solely depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenges have been lack of enough animal feeds and diseases, which are too costly to treat. She plans to expand her farming in the future and acquire high-breed dairy cows that will increase her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been practicing mixed farming in Murang'a town, central Kenya for thirty years. He has employed one farmhand. His farm produces coffee and milk which he sells locally. His biggest challenge in farming has been fluctuations in the market prices of products.

Francis is 56 years old and is married with 7 children who are all adults.

He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him improve the living standards of his family. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming by acquiring quality dairy cows that will increase his milk production and earn him more income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es: José Humberto G. A. de 35 años de edad, reside en Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo junto a sus dos hijos, el mayor de 8 años de edad y el menor de 6 meses de vida. José es un padre de familiar muy responsable, quien trabaja comercializando ropa para hombres como: pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, estas la vende de forma ambulante, y así mismo con clientes ya establecidos. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más pantalones, camisetas alusivas a equipos de fútbol, calcetines y otros más. Esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de aumentar sus ventas y así mismo aprovechar las ventas navideñas y de esta forma poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos y su esposa, para que ellos puedan contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
José Humberto G. A. is 35 years old.  He lives in Colón, in La Libertad department, together with his wife, who takes care of the housework, and his two children.  His oldest child is 8 years old and the youngest is 6 months old.  José is a very responsible family man who works selling men's clothes such as pants, shirts and underwear.  He sells them as a street trader and he also sells to established customers.

José is requesting a loan so that he can buy more pants, soccer shirts, socks and other garments.  He is doing this as he really wants to increase his sales and take advantage of the Christmas period.  In this way he hopes to be able to provide the best for his wife and children so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sohib

texts.en:
A. Sohib is 22 years old. He is married and has one little child. For more than 5 years Sohib has been running a joiner’s shop manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. The business of Sohib is quite profitable and generates a stable income allowing him to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Sohib is respected as a good master in his neighborhood. Now he needs to purchase input materials for his manufacturing shop. With this purpose he requests 6000 Somoni as his third loan loan. Sohib promises to repay his loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for their support.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of necessary materials for his manufacturing needs

loans.name: Namaganga Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: 53 year old David K. belongs to Namaganga Women's group-Jinja. For the last 6 years he has been a retailer in the Namaganga trading center-Jinja. To start his retail business, David used his savings from his old sugar cane business. Due to his ambition, he decided he wanted to enter into another business and his preference was retail. David, who is happily married with 7 kids, says his retail business generates 150,000 shillings per month. With this loan, David says he is going to purchase more retail general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise retail stock for resale.

loans.name: Um Vy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Um V., 52 years old, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Maen Tha, 50 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice with her husband’s help. This couple has eight children: two are farmers, two are laborers, and the others are students and help their parents on the farm. They live in Stueng village in Kandal province.

Thirteen members are taking on a village bank loan and have selected Um as the village’s bank president. The members of this village hope that they will increase their incomes and so improve their families’ living conditions through these loans.

Mr. Um V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for laborers to plow the farm for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for laborers to plow the farm

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Tamaraneh” Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each in the group (or SLL 3,000,000 in total). With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, earn more revenue and profit and thereby improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Saffie J.. Saffie was born in Makeni fifty-five years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a town crier.
