She has one child in college, and the rest no longer attend school. Saffie has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce as sweet taste), salt, and sugar among other goods. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, margi, salt, sugar and other goods in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Mi Progreso Group

texts.es:
Lidia, es soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Zona de Villa Esperanza, distrito de Carabayllo. Es presidenta del grupo “Mi Progreso”.
Hace dos años trabaja como cocinera, empezó en un Proyecto Estudiantil, en la iglesia Bautista Valle del Jordán, lugar donde asiste ella, cocinaba con un grupo de hermanas para los niños, luego el Pastor decidió alquilar un local por Canta, desde entonces Lidia trabaja ahí, ella es la encargada del local.
Gracias a ese negocio tiene estabilidad económica, ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. 
Su meta más importante es tener su propio restaurante, eso le permita tener más ingresos e invertirlo en lo más importante para ella y sus padres.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir para comprar mercadería para el local de comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, 42, is single and lives in the Villa Esperanza area of the Carabayollo district.  She is the president of the group "Mi Progreso."  

For two years she has worked as a cook; she started in a Student Project in the Bautista Valle del Jordán church, where she attended services.  She used to cook with a group of sisters for the children.  Later the Pastor decided to rent a place in Canta, and ever since Lidia has worked there.  She is in charge of the place.  Thanks to this business she has economic stability, and she is able to help her parents with the household expenses.  

Her most important goal is to have her own restaurant.  This would allow her to have more income and invest in what is most important for her and her parents.  With the loan requested she wants to purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un  groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de  BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe SABALI se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un font de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de salades, de céréales, d’article divers et par Fanta B.  pour faire le commerce de condiments.  Elles sont à leur huitième prêt et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Fanta B., compte acheter, 5 paniers de tomate, 4 sacs d’oignons, 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel et 4 paquets de cube maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de BOUGOUNI au niveau des grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’activité, et le reste pour rembourser le prêt et payé les frais de santé.
texts.en:
Sabali Group is composed of four married women, who on average are 50 years old and have six children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They need the loans to finance their activities, namely selling salad, cereals and various articles; Fanta B. sells food condiments. This is their eighth loan. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. 

Mrs Fanta B. intends to use her new loan to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes, 4 sacks of onions, 2 sacks of 25 kilograms of salt and 4 packs of bouillon cubes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the great market in Bougouni and retails from her home and at the market, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. She will use part of it to reinvest in her business and the remaining amount to repay the loan and pay for healthcare services.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Luís Armando

texts.es:
Luís Armando P. A. tiene 36 años, vive en  Unión Libre vive  con la cónyuge en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar a los hijos y comprar una casa.

Le gusta salir por la tarde con la familia hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Armando P. A. is 36 years old and lives with his common law wife in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. They have three children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Luís is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Luís enjoys going out in the afternoons to play sports with his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una joven madre de 25 años, vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, junto a su familia cultivan principalmente papa y otros productos más como el maíz, avena, trigo, alfalfa entre otros y  constantemente cuidan el crecimiento de sus plantas   y  extraer las malezas que pueden perjudicar la buena cosecha. Asimismo se apoyan económicamente de la crianza de animales como ovejas, chanchos y cuyes que vende ocasionalmente de acuerdo a su necesidad. De esta manera ha logrado mejorar con el paso del tiempo la producción de sus cosechas  que lleva a vender directamente a los mercados mas cercanos de su localidad, considera que la actividad agrícola es muy beneficiosa para su familia ya que  tiene disponible el alimento para su propio consumo aunque tiene deseos de incursionar en otro tipo de negocio como el de abarrotes al por mayor aprovechando que  parte de sus cultivos será su mercadería disponible. Es su  segunda vez  que solicita un crédito con MFP  de manera individual y ha  tenido una buena experiencia  de  su anterior crédito ya que supo darle una buena inversión y mejorar su producción. Ahora invertirá su crédito en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
María is a young woman of 25 who lives with her husband and son in her own home.  She has been farming with her family since she was a child, mainly growing potatoes and crops such as corn, oats, wheat, alfalfa, etc.  She constantly cares for her growing crops and gets rid of the weeds that can damage a good harvest.  María also supports herself financially by raising animals such as sheep, pigs and guinea pigs which she sells occasionally as the need arises

Over time, María has managed to improve her crop production.  She takes her harvested crops and sells them directly in the markets nearest her town.  She considers farming to be very beneficial to her family since they have food available for their own consumption.  However, she would also like to break into another type of business.  María would like to sell groceries wholesale, taking advantage of the fact that some of her crops would count as available merchandise.

This is the second time that María has requested a loan from MFP as an individual.  She had a good experience with her previous loan since she was able to make a good investment and improve her production.  She will invest this loan in buying sacks of manure for her next growing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Ely Vanessa

texts.es:
Ely, reside en el departamento Usulután, tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad, administra un negocio el cual comenzó con la ayuda de una cuñada, su horario de atención es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, en el negocio ofrece productos de la canasta básica necesarios en todo hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio, comprando mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes. Esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, y satisfacer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es incrementar la clientela, logrando este objetivo con el ofrecimiento de más productos que llamen la atención a nuevos clientes, en lo familiar pues espera ir creciendo económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
27-year-old Ely lives with her mother and her siblings in the department of Usultan. She is a single mother of a two-year-old girl, and she manages a business that she started with the help of a sister-in-law. Her shop, offering essential home products, is open from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.
She is applying for this loan to invest it in her business, buying merchandise to offer to customers. This purchase will help her strengthen the business and satisfy her customers.
Ely's goal is to increase her clientele, and she hopes to achieve this goal by offering more products that will get the attention of new customers. Ely hopes that she can grow economically along with her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete  hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, vende  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija que vive en su casa le  ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en Montecristi y algunos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su negocio y que gracias a Dios le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" holds its meetings in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of Manabí.  This is a small place surrounded by plush vegetation whose inhabitants are involved in all types of businesses, such as retail sales or factory jobs.

Here we meet Mrs. María, age 43, who is married and has seven children, two of whom passed away.  Her children are all adults although two still live at home.  Her husband is a farmer.

She runs a small grocery store out of her home and sells basic needs items such as rice, sugr, oil and detergent, among other things.  She works every day of the week from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and sometimes even later.  A daughter still living at home helps her in the store.  Some of the grocery products are purchased in Montecristi while others are delivered.  She has been in business for three years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to add more inventory to the store, buying rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage and other basic needs articles.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and enjoys it because of all the friends she has made.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and see her store expanding on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, detergent sausage and other basic needs products

loans.name: Unidas Para Siempre Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "UNIDAS PARA SIEMPRE" porque como su nombre lo indica, para el grupo es importante mantenerse unido por mucho tiempo, lo cual se vea reflejado en cada prestamo que termine y se renueve sin problema alguno. Estan ubicados en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 12 integrantes. La señora Telma M.. Tiene 34 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos 1 mujer y 2 varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas desde hace 2 años, teniendo a su cargo un club nutricional que ella misma inicio. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia (productos nutricionales), y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base a esta oportunidad piensa hacer mayores inversiones, y de esta forma comenzar a tener más ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y para su familia, debido a la gran demanda que tiene, piensa aperturar otro club de nutricion, además de que por sus altos indices de venta ya esta por obtener el 50% de descuento en sus compras por ser mayorista. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para darles una carrera profesional a sus hijos para que logren sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “UNIDAS PARA SIEMPRE” (Forever United) because, like the name indicates, for the group it’s important to stay together for a long time which will be reflected in each loan that is completed and renewed problem free.  They are located in the state of Hidalgo, México.  It has 12 members.

Mrs. Telma Martínez, 34, finished middle school, is a merchant and has three children, one girl and two boys.  She has sold natural products for two years.  She has a nutritional club that she herself started.  She is asking for a loan to invest in merchandise (nutritional products) in order to help her business grow.

She feels enthusiastic while requesting the loan because based on this opportunity she will make larger investments and begin to have profits that will allow her and her family to have a better quality of life. 

Because of the great demand she has she’s thought about starting another nutritional club.  In addition, because of the high sales she’s had she’s about to get a 50% discount on her purchases for being a wholesaler.  She wants to save her profits to provide her children with professional careers so that they will reach their dreams.

loans.use: to invest in nutritional products.

loans.name: Donmaz

texts.en:
Donmaz lives in Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Donmaz has a business selling oil for cars. He has been in this business for 7 years. He buys goods from a wholesale supplier and sells them at the market. His average income is 300 USD per month. 

Donmaz would like to get a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase building materials and household goods to sell. He thanks all lenders who support him, which allows him to expand his business and improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify number of products

loans.name: Reina Teresa

texts.es:
Reyna es comerciante de ropa, el cual vende en su centro de trabajo ya que hoy en día, tiene cinco meses de estar laborando en zona franca, siendo su negocio por varios años la venta de carne. 
Pero la carne cada día esta ah altos costos lo que las ventas se pusieron bajas y no le estaba resultando. Lo que decide buscar otra alternativa ya que, solo con el trabajo de su esposo no alcanza, ya que sus tres niños estudian,  así como el objetivo la construcción de su casa, el cual mediante financiamiento en Afodenic ha comprado parte de los materiales de construcción, y que con este nuevo préstamo terminara de comprar: arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar el arranque completo de concreto de su casa. Y así poder estar en mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Reyna is a clothes merchant; she sells them at her workplace because she’s been employed in the tax free zone for the last five months; her business for many years had been meat sales.

However, meat is more expensive every day so sales dropped and it wasn’t working out for her any more.  She decided to find a different alternative because her husband’s earnings weren’t enough because her three children are in school.

With the goal of building her house, she will use this new loan from Afodenic to finish buying building materials and supplies like: cement and iron rods to begin the start up of her building the house completely out of concrete thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sam Soom Group

texts.es: Es  Banco nuevo pero con dos socias antiguas esta conformado por ocho personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona Tembladerani por se dedican a la venta de cd venta de artículos para celulares   otros que se dedican a la venta de ropa en el alto cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo,  también están dos varones que viven en la misma zona, La presidenta se llama Shirley ella tiene la actividad de venta de cds y su puesto en una avenida céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  ella es antigua muy responsable, trabaja con esta actividad hace 2 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería Cds de música y películas infantiles ya que empieza las vacaciones escolares y tiene mucha demanda las este tipo de películas infantiles, la Sra. Shirley es una persona joven trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: This is a new community bank, but with two senior members, it is comprised of eight people. The majority of the women live in the Tembladerani zone. They sell CDs and cellular accessories. Others sell high end clothes that are well known in the group.  There are also two men who live in the same area. The president's name is Shirley. She sells CDs, and her locale is on a central avenue that goes through the city of La Paz. She is established and very responsible. She has been working in this business for two years. The money from the loan will be used to CDs with music and children's movies since the school holiday has started and there is a lot of demand for these children's movies. Shirley is a young, hardworking person. She is grateful to this organization for the help it provides.

loans.use: to purchase children's movies

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 28-year-old hardworking man renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a shop for two years which he started with 1,000,000 KES; he now has 4,000,000 KES. His challenge is the fluctuation in prices.

Julius needs a loan of 1,500,000 to buy maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts to sell. His vision is to have a wholesale business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El Sr Felipe es casado, posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar, tiene 61 años de edad, el mismo es maestro civil de obras cuenta con 15 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
El se considera una persona responsable y trabajadora, toda su vida ha trabajado y no tiene temor a seguir haciéndolo. Todo lo que hace es por tratar de ganar mas ingresos, para de esa forma poder tener una vida decorosa y sin privaciones, ya que es una persona ya mayor.
El solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas que le va a servir en el ejercicio de su profesión.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe is married and has his own residence with all the comforts of home. He is 61 years old and a master builder with 15 years of experience in his field. This allows him to have a good customer base and an income. He considers himself to be a responsible and a hardworking person. Felipe has worked his entire life and is not afraid of continuing forward. All of his efforts are channeled into earning more income so that he can have a decent life and be free from want since he is an older individual.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools that he needs to perform his job.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Rachelle Ann

texts.en:
Rachelle is 24 years old and is married.  She operates a "sari sari store" (which is the common name for a variety store) in their village where she sells canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other spices.  She has had this business for five months already. 

Rachelle earns PHP 2,000 in the business each week and this income put back into the operation of her business so it will be maintained and eventually grow for her family needs.  She is asking a loan amount of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of goods like coffee, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks for the store to attract more costumers to their place to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods like coffee, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks for the store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman having two children, located in the village of Victoria San Mateo. She is 42 years old and engaged in a spare parts business.

She sells spare parts for motorcycles and other spare parts for vehicles while her husband serves as a mechanic. She has been managing her business for  five years and she is thankful because she earns about P21,380 monthly.

Teresita is requesting a loan in the amount of P30,000 to buy chains, sprockets, interiors for wheels and tyre tubes for her spare parts business. She hopes that she will be able to maintain her business through continuing support of her financial needs.

loans.use: to buy chains, sprockets, interiors for wheels and tyre tubes for her spare parts business.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем, у нее двое детей. Оксана живет и работает в Дрогобыче, Западная Украина. У нее есть две торговые точки, где Оксана продает овощи и фрукты. Ее товар всегда свежий и по хорошей цене, поэтому многие постоянные клиенты едут к ней за покупками даже из других частей города. Оксана начала свое дело, когда осталась без работы 14 лет тому назад. Начинала с того, что вместе с мужем на стареньком авто они вывозили овощи и фрукты во дворы жилых домов и продавали их прямо с машины. Со временем приобрели киоск, а потом и еще один.  На данный момент у Оксаны товара на сумму в 20 000 гривен.  

Оксана планирует использовать кредит КИВА на сумму 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы достроить свой торговый киоск. У Оксаны есть желание работать и умение вести свой бизнес. Она – тот предприниматель, который может работать, расширять свой бизнес собственными усилиями и усердным трудом. В своем деле ей помогает вся семья. В ближайшем будущем Оксана хотела бы расширять свой бизнес и открывать дополнительные торговые точки. За счет прибыли Оксана планирует обеспечить детей возможностью получить достойное образование. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oksana is married and has two children. Oksana lives and works in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. She has two shops where she sells fruit and vegetables. Her products are always fresh and sold for a good price, so many regular customers shop with her, even coming from other parts of the city. Oksana began her business when she was left without a job fourteen years ago. She started when she and her husband brought vegetables and fruit in an old car directly to houses and sold them from their car.  After a while, she bought one kiosk and then another. At present, Oksana's goods are valued at 20,000 hryvnia. 

Oksana plans to use a Kiva loan for 12,000 hryvnia to finish building another kiosk. Oksana has the desire to work and the ability to conduct business. She is an entrepreneur who can work to expand her business through her own effort and hard work. In her case, it helps the whole family. In the near future Oksana would like to expand her business and open additional shops. With her profit, Oksana plans to provide her children with the opportunity to get a decent education.

loans.use: to finish building a sales kiosk

loans.name: Shalon

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Shalon; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de autos, la socia también trabaja en una empresa de distribuidora de productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite, la socia por medio de estos trabajos saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de venta de autos y venta de productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de los carros y para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y leche al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to Qorimancacha communal bank. It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.
The member is Shalon, who's 23 years old and married with one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling cars. The member also works with a company that distributes goods such as rice, sugar and olive oil. Through her work in both businesses, she is able to get her son ahead. She wants to expand and improve the car selling business and the foodstuff selling business. The member requests the loan to do maintenance on the cars and to purchase wholesale goods such as rice, sugar and milk.
She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on the cars and to purchase wholesale goods such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es:
Carmen mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, sus hijos estudian, trabaja desde hace tiempo como operaria. Su esposo le ayuda económicamente.
Sus planes es cambiar su nivel de vida para que sus hijos obtengan mejores oportunidades. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, piedrín, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, alambre de amarre, golosas entre otros materiales. Para construir muro perimetral. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  Her children go to school.  She has worked for a long time as a operator.  Her husband helps her financially.
Her plan is to change her standard of living so that her children can have better opportunities.  With the loan, Carmen will purchase construction materials: cement, gravel, sand, blocks, quarried rock, iron, tie wire and screws, among other materials.  She needs the materials to build a perimeter wall.  Carmen is grateful to the finance company for their support in improving the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, all of whom go to school, and has one additional family member. Hadjah operates a retail shop which she rents. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. Hadjah has requested a loan of USh800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, flour, soap and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Hadjah's goals and aspirations are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and to educate her children to the university level. She lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Malofie Matagi

texts.en:
Malofie is 30 years of age and married with five children.

Malofie owns & operates a business venture, selling pork products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Malofie needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 220 talas or US $92 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Malofie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Malofie's 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano se conformó con mucho esfuerzo de las integrantes. Ellas se encuentran en el 2 ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Señora Amada quien se dedica a la venta de verduras. Nos comenta que mediante el crédito anterior pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico . Además de eso nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella mantiene a su padre anciano y a sus 3 hijos.
Solicita de nuevo la ayuda de Fundación Paraguaya para al compra de verduras, para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” women’s committee was formed with much effort from the members.  They are in the second cycle working together and in a mutually supportive way in the program.  Besides the individual work of each one of them, they also carry out joint activities to raise funds to have group capital; they also help each other reach their objective which is to work to help their families economically.

A moving story is Amada’s who sells vegetables.  She comments that the previous loan made it possible for her to improve her business, her standard of living and her income quite a bit.  She also comments that through this business the family’s economy improved quite a bit since she also supports her elderly father and her three children.

She is once again asking help from Fundación Paraguaya to buy vegetables to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Buyanyi Youth Group

texts.en:
Annah is the facilitator of Buyanyi youth group. Annah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Annah takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Annah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 3/4 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Annah was only able to harvest 3  bags of maize on 3/4  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Annah will educate her children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Buyanyi youth group will each plant maize plots on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bricelda

texts.en:
Bricelda is 31 years old and is a married woman. She has 2 children. She has been a seaweed farmer for 3 years. Bricelda earns 6000 PHP per month from seaweed farming. Bricelda also makes food items like "pilipit" (crunchy, sweet bread) to sell to her community.

Bricelda has requested a loan to purchase straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming. Bricelda hopes for her business to improve. She also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Adlah

texts.en:
Adlah is a 30-year-old young woman who is married with three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Adlah wants to complete two rooms in her house by installing tiles, installing windows and doors, painting, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs a loan of $3,000 from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). When Adlah gets the loan, she will pay the expenses to finish the two rooms and live with her family in better home conditions. 

Adlah is a conservative woman, so her husband Khaled is photographed instead.

loans.use: To complete two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Robert has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells groundnuts, millet and sorghum. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet to sell, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and eventually purchase more groundnuts. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build a permanent house for his family. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more millet to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in expanding her fish business.

loans.name: Unidos Progresamos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Unidos Progresamos” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de joyas, venta de confites, repostería, tejidos, confección, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Mabel presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, ubicada en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usa una blusa estampada de color oscuro, manga ¾, su cabello es largo y de color castaño claro, con chasquilla, además usa sus gafas sobre la cabeza.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa para casa, entre cortinas, visillos, cenefas, paños para secar platos, entre otros artículos. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 5 años.
Ofrece sus productos en diferentes ferias libres, 4 días a la semana, miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos. 
Su mercadería la compra por fardo semanalmente (3 fardos), en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará 6 fardos de ropa de casa para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de navidad.
Una de sus metas son instalarse con una distribuidora de fardos de ropa usada, ya que en la ciudad de Rancagua no existen éste tipo de negocios y muchos comerciantes deben realizar las compras de mercadería en la ciudad de Santiago, por lo que sería un gran negocio para obtener buenas utilidades.
Mabel vive junto a su padre y sus cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 8 y 6 años de edad. Su padre es quien la ayuda con el negocio, ya que se distrae apoyándola. Uno de sus sueños es estudiar la carrera de Trabajo Social.
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que es la única fuente de ingreso en su familia. 
Mabel está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitió contar con un capital, para invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que existe una muy buena relación entre sus miembros, por lo que se siente muy cómoda de compartir diferentes actividades e intereses. 
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agro frutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Unidos Progresamos” (United Progress). It is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different businesses, among which are jewelry sales, the sale of sweets, a pastry shop, the sale of fabrics, and handicrafts, among other businesses. All the members live in the city of Rancagua.

Mabel, the president of the communal bank, can be found in the photo in the first row, second from the right wearing a dark print, ¾ sleeve blouse. Her hair is long and light brown with bangs. In addition, she is wearing her glasses atop on top of her head. She works selling household goods, specifically, drapes, lace curtains, flounces, and dish towels, among other articles. She has been in this business for 5 years. She offers her products at different street markets 4 days a week: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. She purchases three bales of merchandise weekly from a distributor in the city of Santiago.

With the loan she will buy 6 bales of household goods in order to stock her business during the Christmas season. One of her goals is to establish herself as a distributor of used clothing since this type of business does not exist in the city of Rancagua. Many merchants have to carry out the purchase of such merchandise in Santiago, and it would be a great business for obtaining good profits.

Mabel lives with her father and her four children, ages 17, 13, 8, and 6. Her father helps her with the business since he enjoys supporting her. One of her dreams is to study for a career in social work. Her motivation for continuing with the business is that it is her sole source of her family’s income. Mabel is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to have capital for investing in her business.

With regard to the communal bank of which she is a part, she says that there is a very good relationship among the members. This is why they feel very comfortable sharing their different activities and interests. Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins region. It is a modern city that is Chile’s principal center for the production and export of fruit and grapevines. It is also a mining city due to the , nearby mountain range in which one finds the largest underground mine in the world, “El Teniente” , with 4,500 km. of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase household goods such as drapes and lace curtains to stock her business during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with two children both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and charcoal for cooking. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Srey is aged 25 years and married with three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 11 years, she manages to earn about 50,000KHR per day and can save about 30,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is group loan for Srey’s group of two who are female and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en:
Kasimu is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Kasimu has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Kasimu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Kasimu to generate greater profits and increase profits. Kasimu hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more land. 

Kasimu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kasimu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Parascovia

texts.en: Parascovia is a talented seamstress with a love of elegant clothing and ornate handicrafts. Just over a year ago, she decided to make a business out of her passion and began making wedding dresses and accessories. She sells her products from a small booth in her town’s shopping area to brides-to-be from all the surrounding locations. Parascovia’s dresses sell quickly, and she would now like to expand the production capacity of her business. To do so she needs a loan to fund the purchase of more material and other assorted supplies.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Heperona

texts.en: Heperona has been working on plantations at her small village of Siuniu in her whole life. She and her and husband, Apineru, are raising 2 children, 1 in primary school and another 2 1/2 years old. Heperona hopes to invest her money in their land towards improving her family's income. She is eager to make improvements to her house by using wood, which is cheaper and affordable to buy. On her plantation, she also has livestock like chickens and pigs, which are being looked after by her husband’s brother, but she is mainly concentrating on planting taro, because she believes that the business that she started will always provide her family's financial needs.

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Aneriuneta

texts.en: Aneriuneta believes fishing is not just a male duty. She is a strong and motivated 35-year-old woman.  She earns a daily income of more than ST $250 (approximately USD$100) from fishing to support her six children.  She sells fish to the people of her village. She is so thankful to SPBD for their financial support in upgrading her fishing tools for her small business. Aneriuneta has applied for another loan to upgrade her fishing gears and also to improve her home.

loans.use: Buy fishing tools

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: After finishing school, Svetlana was not able to find a good paying job so she decided to open her own business at the Central market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, selling a selection of women’s clothing. She has been in business now for two years and is doing really well. She has built up about $2000 worth of inventory on hand and she makes around $900 a month income. Svetlana is a lively, hard working young lady. She has gained a good reputation among other market vendors who attest to her skills in business. She has requested a loan for $700 that will allow her to purchase new inventory to update her product selection. In the future she hopes to be able to open an additional sales location. With her success in business thus far, she should have no problem fulfilling this goal and accomplishing much more.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has 20 years of experience selling vegetables because she started working with her mom since she was very young at the markets. Little by little, she was able to open her own business, which helps her make ends meet and provide a good education for her children. Teresa and her husband, who has been a great support, open the business everyday from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.

Teresa would like to have her second loan so that she can continue to invest in her business. She has previously bought grains and more vegetables, and these products have been welcomed by her clients. She will use this loan to buy larger amount of goods from farmers in the rural sectors.

Teresa is 47 years old. She has 2 sons who are already adults and help her as much as they can. Her husband works as a construction worker and helps her with the business whenever he has free time. They hope they can finish building their house, which is currently made out of cane.

loans.use: Invest in new more vegetables and grains

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is single with 3 children of her own and she cares for 3 orphans.  She has operated the Racheal Restaurant in Kayunga for the past 10 years. She serves typical Ugandan food: posho, cassava, matooke, sweet potatoes and rice. She is very innovative and business oriented. Her prices are quite reasonable and her food is very good, so she has a good repeat clientele.
She dreams of buying a small plot of land in town to establish her business in her own building. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more foodstuff for her restaurant and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more posho, matooke, rice, and sweet potatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu A. is a 41-year-old married woman who runs her small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Imishli region. Arzu lives with her husband and two sons in a small house. She breeds animals and sells them for meat to the local bazaar traders. She has thirteen years of experience in this field.

This business has always brought her a good income, but prices for everything rise every year. To keep two sons is getting harder and harder. Her husband got ill three years ago and is a disabled person. Arzu must cover all of the family's needs. Her sons are high school students, and Arzu's dream is to give them a good education. Arzu works from early morning to late at night. She decided to apply for a 700 USD loan with a repayment term of 15 months to expand her business and increase her income. With the loan, she is going to purchase two calves for 300 USD each and fodder for 100 USD.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Ms. Leyla is 53 year-old woman. She is married and lives in the village of Saatli town in the Azerbaijan Republic. 
She is a teacher in the local school. Her salary  is insufficient to support the family, and that's why Leyla has to run a business at home. She goes to the local bazaar, purchases calves, breeds them, and sells them to butchers. To increase her monthly turnover, Leyla applied for 800 USD from Norwegian Microcredit LLC, a KIVA partner.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes G. S. has four school-age children. This woman´s business is the sale of carbonated soft drinks, natural soft drinks and bread. Since she was a young girl she has had experience in this business. This woman tells us that the business began when her husband abandoned her and she realized that the family´s money was not enough for the expenses of her humble home. For that reason she began selling carbonated drinks, soft drinks and bread along the streets of Chichigalpa, which she continues today.

CEPRODEL has been her helping hand, and she has benefited from the acquisition of products by means of loans. She has also known how to get ahead, since she has improved her income in order to maintain her home.

The problem that Mercedes faces is that, despite not having her own stand, she sells out in the open, exposing her drinks to the sun and in the winter, to rain.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Mercedes G. S., tiene cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, ella desde jovencita tiene experiencia en este negocio. Según cuenta esta señora que el negocio lo comienza cuando su marido la abandona y se da cuenta que el dinero en el núcleo familiar era insuficiente para los gastos de su humilde hogar. Por tal motivo inicia vendiendo las gaseosas, refrescos y pan ambulantemente en las calles de Chichigalpa hasta hoy en día.

CEPRODEL ha sido su mano ayuda ya que la ha beneficiado con la adquisición de sus productos por medio de los créditos. Además ha sabido salir adelante ya que ha mejorado sus ingresos para la manutención de su hogar.

La problemática que atraviesa la señora Mercedes es que a pesar de no contar con un local propio, ella vende a la intemperie exponiendo sus bebidas al sol y en tiempos de invierno a la lluvia.

loans.use: Investment in business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Céspedes has been married for 18 years to her husband, who repairs car radiators. Together, they have two children who are in high school.

Her husband's income helped Maria to open her own small business eight years ago. She sells beauty products, like shampoo, conditioner, perfumes, and facial creams. She began as a traveling saleswoman, but now has her own place in a nearby market. Maria began working with her children’s education in mind.

Maria will use the loan to invest in new products. More variety will make for a better income, because her store will be more competitive.

loans.use: To buy perfume, face creams, hydrating soaps, shampoo, and conditioner

loans.name: Mosula Satupaitea Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 8 women of Mosula Satupaitea on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The loans disbursed to the women will be used for the following purposes:

Asoleaga I. (39, married, 6 children): purchase fishing equipment to catch and sell fish and sea cucumbers. Atafasia G. (45, married, 8 children): purchase flour, sugar, butter and yeast to bake and sell pork cake (lumps of dough with pork in the center), donuts and snacks. Liga S. (43, married, 5 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, fertilizer, knife, filing (sharpener) and chemicals to harvest and sell cabbages, taro and tomatoes. Matuu Iuli (37, married, 6 children): purchase a box of noodles, a sack of sugar, a lantern, boots and a fishing spear to sell snacks, donuts and ice cakes (ice cream) and fish. Nuanona Lautaf (29, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, fabric, pesticides and fertilizer to make T-shirts and to grow vegetables. Seilagi L. (53, married, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, 4 bush knives, pesticides and fertilizer to grow and sell taro. Sita S. (51, married, 7 children): purchase a box of noodles, candy, sugar, a dozen eggs and pork cakes to make and sell snacks, ice cakes and eggs. Sivake O. (42, married, 4 children): purchase a fishing net, a weed-killing sprayer and fishing line to both grow taro and to fish.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
E. Robert is a drinking bar operator. He is married and has 10 children. He is running out of stock.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra kosar, wife of Mr. A. G., is the mother of four children. Besides her first son, the rest of them are getting an education. Bushra B. and her husband are willing to give their children education till they want. She is a successful client of Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan. She invested that loan amount in her husband’s vegetable business. Now she applies for a loan again for her husband so that he is able to expand his vegetable business and earn a lot more profit.

Anayat bibi wants a loan for his cold drinks business. Naik Parveen B. wants a loan for a meat business. Shamim B. wants a loan for a vegetable business. Rehana B. wants a loan for a fruit business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng O., 51, is a widow living in Russey Keo where she sells vegetables, pork, and beef. She typically makes $4.50 at the food market and is supported by her three children who work in garment factories and in construction. Seng O. has seen an opportunity to expand her business through the purchase of a stall in the market for her goods. She believes that this stall will give her better access to customers and the ability to increase her daily profits. She has asked for a loan of $1000 to purchase this stall in the market. She does not want to stop there, though, and in the future, she hopes to expand her business even further. She would like to own her own shop some day, selling rice as well as her other foods.

loans.use: Purchase a stall in the market

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita began her business in order to bring extra income into her household and provide a better standard of living for her family. It has also helped the family during times when her husband might find himself out of work. She started her business in June 1997 after taking a course in tailoring and dressmaking where she met another student who she became friends with and with whom she opened her business. They now take on large projects they would not have been able to accomplish alone, such as skirts for a school dance. Because of their ability to work together they have had success in their business.

Margarita is asking for a loan of US $800, which she will repay in six months, in order to purchase material and supplies that will allow her to finish her customers order during school graduation season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ofrecerle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y que le sirviera para cuando su esposo se quedara sin trabajo. Comenzó en Junio de 1997, primero tomo un curso de corte y confección, ahí conocío a otra persona con la cual hizo amistad, y posteriormente se asocio con ella, ya que les encargaron un pedido muy grande de faldas para un baile escolar y por separado no se hubiera dado a vasto, y hasta la fecha han continuado de manera exitosa con el neogocio..

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene para esta temporada de graduaciones escolares.

loans.use: Purchase material and supplies

loans.name: Senija

texts.en:
Senija is a 37 year old housewife who works in agriculture and crop husbandry. This is Senija’s second loan, and she is requesting 1 000 KM.

Senija plans to use her loan money to buy more vegetable seeds for her greenhouse. She would also like to purchase pesticide and compost to prepare her land for the winter. Thus far, her business selling vegetables during the winter has been successful, and she can earn up to 200 KM per month. She hopes to increase her income through this loan, and thinks that these purchases will help her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Shyam Kumari

texts.en: Shyam Kumari M. is from a small village in Khokhana, Latipur, where most of her neighbours are farmers.  Shyam  is married and has one son and one day, who both study in lower secondary school.  She opened a grocery store five years ago with her husband to sell products like rice, maize, noodles, and snacks.  Demand for their products has increased as their village has grown and they experience a particularly high level of demand from their customers during Nepalese holidays.  Because the important holidays of Dashain and Tihar are soon, Shyam is requesting a loan of $425 to purchase a large stock of grocery items.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Pamphile

texts.fr: Né en 1969 à Abomey dans le Bénin, Monsieur Pamphile L. vit actuellement à Afagnan avec sa femme et ses enfants. Il compte à sa charge un total de 10 personnes. La soudure à l'arc est son activité de tous les jours. Maître de 2 ateliers, il exerce cette activité depuis près de 20 ans. Son ambition est d'avoir un crédit pour renforcer ses 2 ateliers en achetant les barres de fer et les transformer en portail, en sceau métallique, moule et autres sur lesquels il gagne plus de bénéfices. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Abomey in Bénin, Mr. Pamphile L. presently lives in Afagnan with his wife and his children. He is responsible for 10 people in all. Arc welding is his daily business. The owner of two workshops, he has been doing this work for almost 20 years. His ambition is to have a loan to bolster his two workshops by buying bars of iron to transform into gates, metal pails, molds and such items on which he earns a good profit. This will allow him to better provide for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for his welding workshops

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.fr: Dame K. Eugenie est née en 1967 à Zinvié. Elle est mariée à AÏHOUNDA Georges , soudeur de formation. Elle a un seul enfant qui est aujourd'hui âgé de 04 ans. Elle abandonna les classes en Troisième au Cours Secondaire faute de soutien familial. Ensuite elle alla en apprentissage en couture pendant 05 ans et reçu son diplôme de fin d'apprentisage. Parallèlement à l'exercice de son métier, elle faisait de la distribution de pagnes. Mais, aujourd'hui, elle revend divers articles de consommation courante à savoir riz, maïs, condiments. Ce troisième prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eugenie K. was born in 1967 in Zivié. She's married to Georges AÏHOUNDA, a trained welder. She has only one child, who is now four years old. She dropped out of secondary school after the third year, lacking support from her family. She then learned sewing for 5 years and got her diploma. In parallel to this job, she used to sell pagnes (colorful African cloth). But today, she resells various staples such as rice, corn and condiments. This third loan will enable to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of corn, one sack of rice and one basket of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose B. tengo 30 años de edad y tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de confites los cuales distribuyo en pulperias y mercaditos, tambien los vendo de forma ambulante cuando termino de hacer el recorrido en las pulperias y mercaditos, en estos momentos necesito un credito para fortalecer mi negocio ya que tengo mayor demanda porque estoy empezando a vender en colegios y escuelas, de mi dependen mis hijos, estoy casado y gracias a Dios con mi esposa salimos adelante con los gastos de nuestro hogar.
texts.en:
Hi there! My name is Jose B.. I am 30 years old and I have a small business selling sweets which I distribute to grocery stores and small markets. I also sell the sweets in the street when I am finished delivering to the grocery stores and small markets. Right now I need a loan to bolster my business as I have more demand for my product as I am starting to sell in high schools and elementary schools. My children are depending on me: I am married and, thanks to God, my wife and I are able to pay our household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es: Fiorela tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos que la ayudan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida (salchipollos: pollo frito con papas) por las noches desde hace ya un año, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quienes intercambia ideas y hace nuevas amistades, además le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona, por donde transitan muchas personas. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere implementarse con sillas y mesas para dar una mejor acogida y comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fiorela is 21 years old, is single, and lives with her parents and brothers who help her a lot. She works in food sales (salchipollos: fried chicken with potatoes) in the evenings for the past year. She likes her work because she meets many people with whom she exchanges ideas and forms new friendships. Moreover, it is very profitable because she is located in a good zone where many people circulate. It is the first time that she is applying for a loan with MFP and she is committed to be punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting she will use it for chairs and tables to make it more attractive and comfortable for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her food sales business

loans.name: Eva Josefina

texts.es: Doña Eva Josefina P. T. cuenta con 31 años de edad, del Caserío Xetinimit, Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, casada, con dos hijos, se dedica a la Artesanía como confeccionista de ropa típica para mujeres, debido a que no cuenta con las maquinas de coser suficientes, se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial para poder mejorar su trabajo y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes teniendo la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos y como también ampliar su capital, dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eva Josefina Perez T., 31, lives in the Guatemalan "departamento" of Totonicapan. She's married and has two children. She operates a business making and selling traditional clothing for women. Because she can't rely on the sewing machines that she has, she's approached Asociacion ASDIR to apply for a loan that she will use to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can improve her work and meet the demand of her customers. This is her chance to increase both her income and her capital so that her family will ultimately have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Shazada

texts.en:
Shazada A. is a dynamic and ambitious 42-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. For 6 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown.  This has allowed Shazada to contribute significantly to the household. Now Shazada requests a loan of $550 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling them. Shazada hopes that she will continue providing for her children so they will be able to get an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots for processing and selling.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza A. operates a vegetable-vending business in the village of Barangay Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She roams around the village to sell different kinds of vegetables. She also displays some of her unsold products in front of her house every afternoon. Jonaliza is able to generate a net income of PHP350 weekly. She is very thankful that she is able to help her husband with their financial and basic needs. She is hoping to develop her vending business into a more organized and stable source of income by perseverance.

Jonaliza is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 to be used in her vending business. She is a person who is willing to extend her help to others and, if given the luck, Jonaliza is hoping for her business to improve and her income to increase while sustaining her customers’ daily needs.

Jonaliza is just 27 years old. She is married to Marcial A., who assists her in the business. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Kyla Mae, 7, a grade one student. The second is Marc Daniel, who is 2 years old. She is hoping to improve her small business in their community.

“To plan is to do good, to achieve is to work more and fulfillment is an ultimate goal,” is a simple passage that Jonaliza uses for motivation in doing good things in favor to others.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is 32 years old and married with a child. He sells planks. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is thirty-nine-years-old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one daughter and two sons. She says one of her children is in the junior high school while the others are in primary school. She says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Esther works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Esther is a trader. She runs a provision shop in the market square and sells footwear as well. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Esther has been in business for over ten years and desires to expand her business.

Esther is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure more provisions for her store

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
La señora Gudelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el J. Tomas Aguirre   Cuadra 04 –, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 02 hijos varones y  01 mujer, que aun están en etapa escolar por lo tanto depende de ella, pero también son el motor que le impulsan a seguir adelante.  Deseosa de aportar económicamente al ingreso familiar, con un pequeño capital que tenia inicia su negocio de venta diaria de jugos de frutas, refrigerios a los que agregó la venta de discos musicales, instalándose en un puesto de venta en los interiores del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Juanjui  en la que atiende con mucho gusto a sus clientes que son los moradores que acuden a hacer sus compras en dicho mercado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelara en un plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, ampliando e implementando su negocio con frutas que los compra en cajones como papayas, naranjas, manzanas, taperibas, guineos para la preparación de los jugos así como harina, azúcar, mantequilla, huevos y esencias para la preparación de kekes y empanadas  y así satisfacer el paladar de su clientela, también comprará discos compactos de música variada para vender a sus clientes continuos.
Su permanencia a este grupo le ha permitido desarrollar su seguridad e independencia.  Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como persona y como empresaria.
texts.en:
Gudelia belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras" community bank. She lives at J. Tomas Aguirre Cuadra 04 –,Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 46, in a common law marriage, and has two sons and a daughter who are still school age. They depend upon her, but they are also the motor that pushes her to keep going. Wishing to add to the family income, she used a small amount of money that she had to start her business. Every day she sells fruit juice and snacks, and she has started selling musical records. She put up a stand in the food market in the city of Juanjui. She waits on her customers, local residents who shop at the market, with pleasure. With a loan of 1,500 PEN, which she will repay in six months, she will amplify her business with boxes of fruit like papayas, oranges, apples, golden apples, and green bananas to make juices. She will also buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs and extracts to prepare kekes (traditional Peruvian pastry) and empanadas. This will satisfy her customers’ palates. She will also buy various music compact discs to sell to her non stop customers. Her membership in this group has permitted her to develop her security and independence. She is greatly appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a person and as a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits (papayas, oranges, apples), flour, eggs, compact discs

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es:
El Señor Leoncio M. tiene 39 años de edad, su propiedad situada en Lomas de Memorial Sandino, casado su esposa trabaja de conserje en otro país, si recibe ayuda de su esposa con remesas ya que tiene tres hijos de matrimonio todo estudiando. Como proyecto inicial es mejorar su vivienda. Ya que tiene algunos descompuestos y   mas en este tiempo que viene de lluvia el zinc esta viejo y se pasa el agua.
Don Leoncio se gana el pan de cada día como vendedor ambulantemente de calcomanía, juguetes, llaveros y otros productos. Tiene 25 años que se desempeña como vendedor ya que no sea encontrado un mejor trabajo, siendo unos de los motivos que su esposa se fue a trabajar lejos.Las dificultades que ha pasado son: la salud de su hijo que fue operado y de la que sigue teniendo que es la falta efectivo para invertir. Inicio su pequeño negocio con dinero propio vendiendo pequeñas cantidades de productos.Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar material para la mejora de su vivienda como: zinc, reglones para cambiar el zinc de su casa.
texts.en:
Leoncio M. is 39. His property is located in Lomas de Memorial Sandion. He is married, and his wife works as a caretaker in another country. He does receive help from her, in the form of remittances, since they have three children who are in school. His first project is to improve his house. There are some things that are broken, and the zinc (on the roof), which is old, leaks in this rainy season. Leoncio earns his daily living as a street vendor. He sells stickers, toys, key rings, and other products. He has been a salesman for twenty five years, and he has not found better work. The difficulty he has had is with his son’s health; the son had an operation. The difficulty he still has is the lack of money to invest. He started his small business with his own money, and he sold small quantities of products. Thanks to a loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy materials like zinc to change the zinc on his house

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to fix his house

loans.name: Silimanio

texts.en:
Silimano S. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and bread. She is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste to sell. Silimano is 30 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to make paste

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. Since 1997 he has owned a car repair shop where he services the neighboring villages.

Today, Hicham is requesting $1,200 to purchase equipment for his shop so as to be able to meet the demands of the market.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his repair shop

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy D. sells provisions and drinks. She is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: La señora Maria Leonor de 59 años de edad, reside en Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, procreo cuatro hijos en su matrimonio, todos casados, doña Maria viuda es una mujer que desde joven trabaja para ayudar a su familia su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno y tiene treinta y cinco años de hacer pues de desde joven comenzó. Sus mayor anhelo es poder terminar su casa, ya que esta en malas condiciones y necesita hacer las paredes de nuevo es por eso, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a construir su casa. Da las gracias a ala institución por el apoyo a través de los prestamos se ha beneficiado en su vida ya que ha logrado invertir en la venta como mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Leonor, 59 years old, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of the capital city Managua. She has four children who are all married. Maria, a widow, is a woman who has worked to help her family since a young age. Her business is selling baked goods, which she has been doing for 35 years since she began as a young woman. Her greatest desire is to be able to finish her house since it is in bad condition and needs new walls. For this reason, with this loan she is going to buy construction materials to begin to work on her house. She is grateful to the institution for its support through loans. She has benefitted because she has been able to invest in purchases like home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to work on her house

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es socio del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Mario es casado, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Mario vende cebiche (plato preparado con pescado y limón) de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Mario por las noches trabaja como vigilante.
Mario necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un triciclo y mesas.
Los sueños de Mario es tener un restaurante marisquería.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of Banco Comunal Las Goldrinas. Mario is married. He is 58 years old. He has one son. Mario sells ceviche (a dish which is prepared with fish and lemon) in a mobile manner. He does this activity everyday. In addition, Mario works at night as a guard. Mario needs a loan of $225 (600 soles), money which will be invested in the purchase of a cart and tables. Mario dreams of having a seafood restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy a cart and tables

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
G. Chu V. (20209040013) is a 25 year old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. G. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.
