While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyệt Cầu 1 (3).

G. is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To making a living, G. owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members. G. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, G. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. G. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND for the same purpose. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20209040014) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 2. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20209040015) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (20209040016) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business. 4. Nguyễn Thị Huề (20209040017) is a 63 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Original version:

G. Chu V. (20209040013) là 25 tuổi Nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. G. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nguyệt Cầu 1 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhôm cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. G. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, G. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, G. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. G. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20209040014) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20209040015) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (20209040016) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị Huề (20209040017) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth S. Ramírez tiene la edad de 74 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella es una mujer muy trabajador y luchadora además disfruta mucho su trabajo pues la mayoría del tiempo recibe halagos de parte de sus clientes por su deliciosa comida. La actividad económica es la  elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de  28 años que se dedica a este negocio humilde pero beneficioso, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia y se da por los estudiantes que fueron los que propusieron la idea para encargar la elaboración de la comida y es así como se hace cargo de este negocio es una de las experiencias que más le ha gustado. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ingredientes, verduras, frutas y lo más importante granos básicos. Su deseo es mantener este negocio que es su medio de vida.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jerónima Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Jerónima Francisca L. de 63 años ha trabajado en diferentes rubros, hace diez años que se dedica a la compra y exportación artesanías nicaragüenses a los países centro americanos. 
L. tiene ocho años de trabajar con Adim lo que le ha permitido mejorar su negocio y meta inmediata es poder seguir trabajando.

loans.use: compra de artesanias

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en:
37-year-old Greziel L. is the mother of four children. Her eldest child is 11 years old. She sustains her family through her business. She runs a sari-sari store and barbecue. She wants her business to grow and become successful.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital for her business. She's now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor U. is from the village of Ibabao. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Leonor and her husband own and operate a furniture-making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Leonor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leonor is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be her 17th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Pharng

texts.en: Pharng S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Takeo province.  She is a professional weaver who makes a $1 profit every day.  Her husband makes and sells ice-cream.  On average, he earns $10 in revenue a day.  This couple is helped by one of their children who works in a garment factory.  Pharng is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase silk so that she can weave silk clothes to sell at the local market.

loans.use: Buy silk for weaving.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una socia muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 49 años, es casada, es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes y su esposo es empleado del sector salud.
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, negocio que funciona en su casa y paralelamente vende se dedica a la venta de menùs al mediodìa. 
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las Rosas” desde hace cuatro años y està contenta de ser parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le diò la oportunidad de comenzar con el negocio propio.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra de gaseosas y néctares.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos para su bodega. 
La meta de Bertha es tener una tienda grande bien implementada y seguir apoyando a su esposo en el hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha, 49, is a hard-working, married, mother of three adult children. Her husband is employed in the health sector. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She is a retail grocery merchant; she has a small store set up in her house. She also sells prepared meals at noon. She has been a member of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the last 4 years and she's happy to be part of the Manuela Ramos Movement because it gave her the opportunity to start her own business. With the first, 300 new sol, loan she bought soft-drinks and fruit nectars. Currently, she is requesting financing of 500 new soles to buy stock items for her store. Bertha's goal is to have a big, well-stocked, store and to continue to be a support to her husband at home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stock items for her store.

loans.name: Faustian

texts.en:
Faustian A. is a single woman with two children. She notes that she received a junior high school education.

To earn a living, Faustian sells soft drinks at a fish port near Elmina. In fact, she has been in this line of business since 2007. By doing so, she is able to pay for her children's school fees and her utility bills. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $500, which would be used to buy more soft drinks and bags of water for sale. She hopes to use any additional profits from her business as a result of this loan to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional soft drinks and water

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  El vive en el poblado de Racchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Racchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
 
Antonio tiene 42 años y trabaja como albañil. Actualmente esta trabajando en la construcción del Centro Educativo de Racchí. 
El socio requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar. El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja como albañil y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.   
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonio is a member of the Ascended Virgin of Racchí communal bank (Arariwa Association). He lives in Racchí (Urubamba province, department of Cuzco). Racchí is 45 minutes from Cuzco. Antonio is 42 years old and works as a bricklayer, currently engaged in building the Racchí Educational Center. He needs the loan for family expenses. He is a devoted father who has worked a number of years in masonry. He has done well thanks to his hard work on the job. This association member is grateful for the opportunity offered here, and commits to repaying the loan per the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Saidodkhom

texts.en:
Saidodkhom has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of foodstuff in his grocery store. He is married with three children. In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more foodstuff. For this purpose he needs a loan of $3,000 USD. Saidodkhom has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur, and with your help this could be possible. Saidodkhom and his family are sincerely grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila Rosa S. L. tiene 63 años, es viuda, y vive sola.  Tiene 9 hijos, 5 de los cuales viven en España trabajando en hoteles y 4 están viviendo en Quito.  Uno es policía, otro es gerente de pizza.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas. La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura.  Siembra maiz, frejol, habas, lechuga, zuccini, acelga, broculi, y espinaca.  Tiene 5 cuadras de terreno y su casita propia.  Se dedica a esta actividad toda la vida.  Viaja a la ciudad de San Pablo para hacer las ventas de sus productos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para invertir en trabajo y sembrar el maiz.  Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos estudien para que sean profesionales de algo bonito como ingeniero o artista.  Cuenta que trabajar en el campo es muy duro y la mano de obra y maquinaria son muy caros.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa S. L. is 63 years old, widowed, and lives by herself. She has nine children, five of whom live in Spain and work at hotels. The other four live in Quito. One is a police officer while another manages a pizzeria.

Zoila is a member of the Communal Bank “San Jose de las Orquideas”, which meets in the community of San Jose de Palmas and is located fifteen minutes away from the city of San Miguel. The majority of the residents of this community are farmers who grow potatoes and corn as their main crops.

Zoila owns her home and has five plots of land in which she grows corn, beans, lima beans, lettuce, zucchini, chard, broccoli, and spinach. She has been farming all of her life and travels to the city of San Pablo to sell her products.

Zoila is requesting a loan to purchase compost for her crop of corn. Her dream for the future is for her children to pursue an education and become a professional such as an engineer or an artist. The work in the fields is very difficult and requires a lot of manual labor. She is not able to acquire machinery because it is too expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost for her crops

loans.name: Yanina Marieli

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos menores hijos en casa de su madre, donde también viven sus hermanos, algunos de ellos con su propia familia. Esta vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el segundo distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, y el primero más pobre.

Desde hace más de 02 años se dedica a la venta de mazamorra y arroz con leche (dulces tipicos del país) recorriendo las calles del distrito José Leonardo Ortiz. La venta se realiza en las tardes,y además cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, su madre (que vende en un parque del distrito  ubicándose allí con su mesita y una vitrina), y una amiga. 

Los postres son preparados y colocados en vasitos, diariamente preparan 450 vasitos, los cuales los venden a S/. 0.50 céntimos. Debido a que ya son conocidas en la zona, casi siempre venden lo que preparan diariamente. Yanina desea ampliar su negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para los postres, compra de vasitos y cucharas plásticas, y para invertir en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y bodoques, para lo cual necesita reparar su refrigeradora.

Yanina es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. En la fotografía aparece preparando sus vasitos de postre, antes de salir a venderlos.
texts.en:
Yanina, 36, is a single mother. She lives with her two minor children in her mother’s house where her siblings, some with families of their own, also live. The home is located in the José Leonardo Ortiz neighborhood, which is the second-most populated in Lambayeque region, but also the poorest. For over 2 years she has sold “mazamorra” and “arroz con leche” (typical desserts of the country) along the various streets of José Leonardo Ortiz neighborhood. She makes her sales in the afternoons. She can count on help selling from her sister, her mother (who sets up her little table and display case in a local park), and a friend. The desserts are prepared and served in little glasses. They make 450 portions daily and sell them for 50 cents each. Because they are well-known in the area, they almost always sell everything they prepare daily. Yanina wants to enlarge her business so is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol loan. The funds will be used to buy ingredients for the desserts, to buy the little serving glasses and plastic spoons, and to invest in the sale of soft-drinks and bodoques (frozen treats served in plastic bags). To do this, she needs to repair her refrigerator. Yanina is a hard-working, responsible woman. In the photo she is shown preparing the glasses of dessert prior to going out to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her desserts.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Mrs. C. is a domestic trader, 48-years-old, who lives with her own medium family in Kompong Tom Province. Her husband is 49-year-old Teang. He assists her in the business. This couple has six children: four are married and the other two are single. All of the children are no longer in school; they work in different jobs. To look for daily revenue, C. buys products such as potatoes, rice, and salt in bulk to sell. She also stores her items for a while at her home and will resell them to buyers when the prices come to the highest. C. is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle so she can buy the items more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndelle T. est âgée de 31ans, elle est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 16 fois de suite et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Ses activités sont multiples: elle fait un commerce de bétail (bœuf), de mil et fait un élevage de poulets. Les bénéfices générés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndelle T. is 31 years old, is married, and cares for eight children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 8 years and has enjoyed 16 consecutive loans that she has never had a problem repaying. She does many things: she sells beef cattle, millet and chickens. The money she earns through her work allows her to contribute to improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry W. O. is a businessman in Nambale, Busia District. He deals in farming as a business and also runs a construction one. He says he has been doing both since the year 1957 and it has put some of his children through school. Henry is 71 years old, married, and is the guardian of 3 children who are dependents. Henry plants and harvests twice a year.

He would like a loan of KShs. 10,000 that will go into expanding his farm area, buy seeds, and prepare the land. He would like to venture into a retail shop business in the near future.

loans.use: Expand farming area

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya S. est une femme de 40 ans elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 5 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU depuis 3 ans. Elle développe un commerce de tissu, de vêtement et de chaussures. Et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux approvisionner sa boutique en marchandises telles que des tissus, des vêtements et des chaussures. Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa progéniture et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Rokhaya S. is 40 years old, divorced and living with her five children of whom she is the sole provider. She has been a member of the KAMBENG DOUMASSOU « Banc Villageois » loan group for three years. She is developing a business selling clothing fabric, clothes and shoes. This loan will allow her to stock her boutique better with fabrics, clothing and shoes. Her objective is to ensure her children are well provided for and meet her own personal needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her ability for self-financing

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly S. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 44 years old. Shirly is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shirly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Shirly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en:
Betty T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Blessed. She is 44 years old, married and has one child who is 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade. For two years, she has been selling rice, beans, sugar and flour at the VOA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner.

She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, beans, sugar and flour. She describes herself as a quiet person. Her goal is to expand her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, sugar and flour

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi W. T. is 40 years old, and she is a member of the Super Njunu group in Faulu Kenya. Naomi is married, and her husband is also a businessman. They have six children, all of whom go to school. Together with her husband, they work hard to educate her children. To earn a living, she sells fruits and vegetables. She is well-known for her participation in the group because she consistently attends their weekly meetings. She also promptly pays her weekly dues.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES ($625) to buy more fruits and vegetables. She believes that she will generate additional profits if she could increase her stock.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enkhtuvshin C. is a 34 year old woman who lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Enkhtuvshin began her watch repair business in 2006 with her husband. She divorced from her husband and continued her business herself.

Now she has two sales areas; she operates her watch repair business and also sells cosmetics. After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital and living conditions. Enkhtuvshin is a modest, hard-working person and is very committed to improving the quality of her life. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro P. D.    es un señor de 57 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Durante toda su vida  Don Leandro  se  ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito. Una de sus especialidades es la producción  de queso. De la cual asegura que la calidad que el produce es la mejor alrededor de la zona. 

En estos momentos el desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢623.000 (seiscientos veintitrés mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. El dice que la calidad de la leche que producen sus  vaquitas depende de la calidad del pasto.

Don Leandro  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y mantener  su negocio.
texts.en:
Leandro P. D. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and their three sons in a community called Santa Fe. Santa Fe is located in the Los Chiles area, in the province of Alajuela; this community is in a mountainous area and is very close to the country’s northern border. His main economic activities are ranching and farming, specifically, growing staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges. For all of his life Leandro has made a living raising cattle for milk and for meat. One of his specialties is producing cheese, and Leandro guarantees that his cheese is the best produced in the area. At this time Leandro wants to obtain a micro-loan for ¢623,000 (six hundred and twenty three thousand colones) so that he can purchase grass seed and improve the conditions of the corral where he keeps his cattle. He says that the quality of the milk his cows produce depends on the quality of the grass they eat. Leandro is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be Leandro’s first loan, and he hopes it will help him to grow more on a personal level and maintain his business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining his business and purchasing grass seed.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been operating her mixed farm for the last three years in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. Her main products are maize, millet, beans, and milk, which she sells to schools in the area. She also earns income from her rental houses.

Hellen is 46 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children aged 10 to 22. All the children attend school.

Hellen has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit. She says that the extra income from this project will enable her to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have a big poultry farm and be able to supply eggs and chickens to other farmers in her group.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Elsie Bienes Group

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Elsie is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elsie B. Group.

Elsie is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores M. is from the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 58 years old and is married with three adult children. Dolores owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items, rubber containers and suitcases in large quantities.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Por un lado posee algunas vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para poder venderla al público en general y adicionalmente cría animales menores como pavos, patos y gallinas para comercializarlos a los negociantes de la zona. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Elvia desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales, se modo que se pueda asegurar una buena producción y por ende pueda percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elvia es una mujer hacendosa y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y consideración.
texts.en:
Elvia is the 52-year-old mother of a family who lives with her husband and their children in the district of Chepén, an agricultural zone with average commercial traffic located in the province of the same name and in the region of La Libertad, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her work is raising and selling animals. On the one hand, she has some cows that she milks to sell the milk to the public in general, and in addition, she raises small animals such as turkeys, ducks, and chickens to sell to the businesses in the area. With these activities she helps her husband in the economic support of their family.

Elvia wants to acquire balanced food for her animals so that she can be assured of a good production and therefore receive better income. To do this, she believed it would be advantageous to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

Elvia is a diligent woman who very much likes the work that she does. People who know her have much esteem and consideration for her.

loans.use: Acquire balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie P. is from the town of Banga. He is 60 years old. Ramie is married. To make a living, Ramie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramie is working hard to improve his family's living conditions. He also wishes to have good relationships among his family members.

Ramie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ramie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica Abena Atta

texts.en: Veronica Abena Atta A. is into the sale of foodstuffs at Abura. She is married and lives together with her eight dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has been trading in foodstuffs for four years. She assists her husband in educating, feeding, and clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy more varieties of foodstuffs to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional profit.

loans.use: buy more varieties of foodstuffs

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn L. is from the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer. Growing rice is her cup of tea. In addition to rice farming, she also sells fish in their village. She is doing the best she can to earn enough money for the needs of her family.

She would like to apply for a loan at CEVI. She will use the loan in buying farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. The loan would help her expand her business and increase her harvest and income. 

She said she likes the CEVI program because she is covered with a micro-insurance program in CEVI.

loans.use: farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: Kalimutma F. est  entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Tous ses enfants étudient sauf le cadet. Son mari est  cultivateur.  Elle vend des cannes à sucre.  Elle  commença son business  avec  le crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits  à son domicile(vente en  gros et détail). Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec 2 tonnes de canne à sucre en provenance du territoire de Rutshuru. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle pour sa famille et voir ses enfants finir les études. La cliente Kalimutma F. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe lumière est constitué de 23 membres.
texts.en: Kalimutma F. is an entrepreneur.  She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children.  All of her children are in school except the youngest.  Her husband is a farmer.  She sells cane sugar.  She began her business with a loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima.  She sets up her products in her home (selling in bulk and at retail).  This new loan will allow her to stock up with two tons of cane sugar from the territory of Rutshuru.  Moreover, she hopes to buy a parcel for her family and to see her children finish their studies.  The client Kalimutma F. thanks Hekima for its work to help the impoverished who are excluded by classic banks.  The Lumière group is made up of 23 members.

loans.use: acheter 2 tonnes de canne à sucre

loans.name: Nissondia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nissondia, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font la fabrication et vente de vans.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Nissondia sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter uniquement de la matière première  pour la fabrication de vans(grand panier plat en feuille de rônier ).                                                                
KOROTIMI S. s’approvisionne en matière première avec les cueilleurs de feuilles du rônier au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue sa vente sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle exclusivement féminine.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Nissondia group, all married,  are on the average 39 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Klacouma, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family ties. They manufacture and sell “vans” (big flat baskets made of fan palm leaves).
Korotimi S. buys her materials at the Massigui from sellers who pick fan palm leaves. She sells out of her home, at the nearby market, in cash and on credit, to an exclusively female customer base. She plans to achieve an average monthly income  of 20,000 West African Franks, which will be used to repay the loan, cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for making "vans" baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer con un pequeño negocio, iniciando hace un año con una pequeña pulpería que ha venido mejorando con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado.
Hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como asesor administrativo, y que junto se han esforzado para dar lo mejor a sus dos hijos.
Con este nuevo  préstamo, comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, caja de jabón, bidón de aceite, golosinas, carne, pollo, queso, así como ropa interior para comenzar a tener mejores resultados de ventas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a small business owner.  She started out a year ago with a small grocery store that she’s been gradually improving with the loans Afodenic has given her.

Today she relies on her husband’s support who works as an Administrative Advisor; together they have striven to provide the best for their two children.

With this new loan she will buy: rice, beans, sugar, a case of soap, a large jug of oil, snacks, meat, chicken, cheese as well as underwear to start having better sales results.

loans.use: She will buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, corn, soap and snacks thus achieving sales increases and growth of her small business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells kenkey (a staple in Ghana made of fermented maize and usually dipped in a spicy tomato-based sauce) and doughnuts at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She is divorced and has three children. Aba has been selling kenkey and doughnuts for 30 years. She sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 39, resides with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. S. sells vegetables at a local market in the province, earning U.S. $7 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, and earns U.S. $3.50 per day.

Each month, the family has to spend U.S. $42 on food and U.S. $78 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of U.S. $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for use as a taxi

loans.name: Senia Margarita

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

Aquí conocimos a Senia ella tiene 37 años de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para salir adelante y poder ser más productivos.
 
Ella trabaja como maestra en una escuela cerca de la localidad donde ella vive, en la actualidad está estudiando una maestría en Gerencia Educativa, es para esto justamente que solicito el crédito para poder seguir con sus estudios ya que cada día debe mejorar sus conocimientos para poder dar una mejor educación a sus alumnos y además porque se les exige en el Ministerio de Educación, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta la 13h00 y los sabados y domingos se dedica a sus estudios, nos dice que le encanta aprender para después dar lo mejor a sus estudiantes.

Este crédito es para pagar una parte de su maestría. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia Institución Educativa.
texts.en:
The members of La Mocora Communal Bank meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and ranching. 

Here we meet Senia. She is 37 years old and lives in her parents' house. She has already been a member of the communal bank for four loan cycles, and she likes it for the help that they give to people like herself to advance and become more productive.

She works as a teacher in a school near where she lives. She is now studying for a master's degree in Education Administration. It is exactly for this purpose that she is applying for a loan, so that she can continue her studies. Every day she must improve her knowledge so that she can give a better education to her students, and furthermore, because it is required by the Ministry of Education. She works from Monday to Friday from 7 am to 1 pm. On Saturdays and Sundays she studies. She tells us that she loves to learn so that she can give the best to her students.

This loan will pay for part of her master's coursework. Her dreams are to finish her studies and have her own educational institution.

loans.use: to study for a master's degree

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 52 años, vive con el menor de sus 5 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años decidió tener su tienda de abarrotes en su casa, aprovechando la ubicación estratégica  donde vive, ya que hay muy afluencia de gente. Desde entonces, todos los días atiende su establecimiento con ayuda de su madre  y su hijo. Ella esta siempre atenta y prevé que mercadería le hace falta para realizar el pedido a sus proveedores. Por otro lado, también posee dentro de su tienda, el servicio de locutorio, negocio que atrae a más clientela. Eso le ha favorecido mucho en las ganancias, sin embrago una de sus mayores dificultades  es el alza constante de los productos, por eso trata de abastecerse de variados productos que sean del alcanza de la economía de sus clientes. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, tiene gratas experiencias de haber solicitado un crédito anteriormente ya que le ayudó a mejorar su negocio de la cual se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería  para su tienda.
texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old and lives with the youngest of her 5 children and her husband in her own home.  Ten years ago, Nancy decided to set up a grocery store in her home, taking advantage of the strategic location of her home which is in a very busy area.  Since then, she has worked in her store every day, with the help of her mother and her son.  Nancy is always attentive and keeps an eye on what merchandise she needs so that she can place orders with her suppliers.  Inside her store, Nancy also has a 'locutorio' (public telephone service) which attracts more customers.  This has really helped her profits.  However, one of the biggest difficulties she faces is the constant increase in the price of her products.  For this reason, she tries to stock up with a variety of products that are within financial reach of her customers.

This is Nancy's third loan with MFP.  She had a good experience with her previous loan since it helped her to improve her business.  She is very grateful for that.  Nancy will invest this loan in buying merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, natural del distrito de Anco, tiene 26 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y esta a cargo del cuidado de su hijo Joseph de 01 año. Cumpliendo el rol de padre y madre; juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad seis de agosto anexo del distrito de Anco. Armando, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras en donde viene trabajando 06 años de manera independiente; y hasta el momento cultiva plantas de cacao y café obteniendo un total de 05 hectáreas de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta el ver que los frutos de sus plantas le brindan una buena producción, generándole ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando también sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Armando is 26 years old and a native of the Anco district.  He cares for his 10 year old son, Joseph, and is a hard worker.  He fills the role of mother and father and he and his son live together in their own home in the “6 de Agosto” section of Anco.  Armanto began his adventure as a farmer on his parents’ land when he was a boy.  His passion for agriculture took him to acquiring his own land, where he has been working independently for the six years.  He raises cacao, and coffee on 5 hectares.  During the harvest season he hires farm hands who pick the crops with great speed and he is able to get his work done efficiently.  He is very committed to his work because he sees that his efforts pay off when his plants produce a good crop, which generates income for every kilogram he sells.  He says that he does not really like the winters because there are many insects during that time and the rains impede his work and damage his plants.

He is asking for this loan of 2,000 PEN so he can buy cacao plants to plant and harvest their bounty in a short time.  He also wants to buy some more land so that he can increase his production.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is prepared to make all of his payment on time.  He wants to apply for more loans in the future.  He is grateful to the institution for helping him get this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cacao plants

loans.name: Delcy Roxana

texts.es:
Delcy  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Tiene estudios de educación superior.
Desde hace tres años viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales y útiles escolares, también cuenta que confecciona banderas, escarapelas, adornos, cintillas, de acuerdo a las campañas del año.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma  de S/3000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar seis cientos de cuadernos.  Ella trabaja sola en su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja como transportista (es chofer).
Su sueño es ser empresaria y tener una librería bien surtida que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el préstamo de la cuenta interna y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Delcy is a member of the Victor Echave Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno district and province.  She is 23 years old, has a life partner, and has two school age children.  She has a post-secondary education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  She used her initial loan for 300 soles to invest in her business.  She sells school supplies and materials.  

She tells us that she also makes flags, rosettes, decorations, and ribbons according to the time of year.

She will request a new loan for 3,000 soles, which she will use to buy six hundred notebooks.  She works alone in her business because her husband works in transportation as a driver.

Her dream is to be a businesswoman and to have a well-stocked book store.  This will allow her to improve her earnings.  What she likes about the communal bank is the loan from the internal account and the earnings on the savings.

loans.use: to buy six hundred notebooks.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Justina, ella tiene 34 años la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 2 años; la socia se dedica  a la artesanía en el poblado de Pisac, la socia a su vez tiene una óptica en la ciudad del Cusco y está bajo la administración de su hermana, la socia vende artesanía en el mercado artesanal y le va muy bien ella requiere el crédito para comprar artesanía porque la temporada alta subió y falta mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”.  It is located in the village of Ccorao-Pisac, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Justina is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged 16, 14 and 12.  Her business is selling handicrafts in the village of Pisac.  She also owns an optician's in the city of Cusco which her sister runs.  Justina sells handicrafts in the craft market and her business is doing very well.  She needs this loan to buy more handicrafts because demand rose during the high season and she is lacking merchandise.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise.

Justina is grateful for this loan and would like to make it known that she will make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise

loans.name: La Lucha Sigue Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Lucha sigue lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Fátima de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de productos AVON. Ella inicio vendiendo el mínimo y poco fue creciendo ahora es asesora. 
Fátima es casada tiene dos niños de 8 y 4 años y su meta es mejor su hogar.
Las otras integrantes son la señora Rosalba de 32 años quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 2 años y desea poner una venta de comida, y la señora Ángela de 62 años se dedica al comercio de productos varios.
texts.en:
The 'La Lucha' group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated and entrepreneurial women.  The group's coordinator is 31 year-old Fátima who sells Avon products.  She started selling the minimum and gradually grew in the business.  She is now a consultant.

Fátima is married and has two children aged 8 and 4.  Her goal is to improve her household.

The other members of the group are 32 year-old Rosalba, who has owned a tortilla bakery for two years and would like to set up a business selling meals, and 62 year-old Ángela who sells a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Estrella de luz" está ubicado en el estado de México. Está conformado por nueve integrantes, entre ellas esta la señora María nos platica que inicio la venta de dulces aproximadamente desde hace un año ya que los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ella tiene dos hijas la mayor esta cursando la educación superior y la otra cursa la primaria, nos platica que su puesto era muy pequeño y con el tiempo ha crecido, principio solo vendía dulces y ahora vende botanas y refrescos, el puesto lo tiene frente a su casa. Quiere este prestamo para invertir en mercancia como botanas, dulces y refrescos para tener más ganancias y así poder ahorrar ya que ambiciona tener una tienda de abarrotes con local propio pues quiere que sus hijas no tengan tantas carencias, una vida mejor y poder brindarles una carrera profesional para un mejor futuro. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Marisol.
texts.en:
This group is called “Estrella de Luz” (Star of Light) and is located in the State of México.  It has nine members.  Among them is María who told us that she started selling sweets about a year ago since her husband’s income was insufficient to cover household expenses.

She has two daughters.  The oldest is in higher education and the other one is in elementary school.  She relates that her stand was very small but, in time, it’s grown.  At the beginning she only sold candy but now she sells snacks and soft drinks.  The stand is located in her front yard.

She wants the loan to buy merchandise like snacks, sweets and soft drinks in order to have more profits so that she can save up because she wants to have a grocery store in a locale of her own because she’d like it if her daughters didn’t have so many unmet needs, a better life and to be able to provide them with professional careers for a better future.

Observation: the woman’s name who isn’t clearly visible in the photo is Marisol.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise like snacks, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El señor Gumercindo tiene 45 años de edad, está casado y con 3 hijos, una está cursando la carrera de sicología y dos en edad escolar.
Se dedica al macate (venta ambulante), como también en el ramo de plomería, es una persona muy trabajadora, su actividad principal es el de macate ya que es una profesión que aprendió de cuna, pues, todas las personas de la zona se dedican en el ramo y es prácticamente hereditario. 
Su esposa y sus hijos son artesanos y le apoyan en el sustento diario y los créditos que ha obtenido lo ha venido invirtiendo en la compra de colchas al por mayor por lo que adquiere a menor precio y le da la posibilidad de obtener más ingreso.
Tiene como sueño mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Solicita nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar colchas, hamacas e hilos a fin de poder comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  One of his children is studying for a degree in psychology and the other two are in school.  Gumercindo is a traveling salesman and he also works as a plumber.  He is a very hard-working person.  His main business is working as a traveling salesman.  This is a profession that he learned from the cradle as everybody in his area works in this business.  It is practically a hereditary business.

Gumercindo's wife and children are craftspeople and they help to support their family.  Gumercindo has invested the loans that he has obtained in buying bedspreads wholesale, as he acquires them for a lower price which allows him to make more profits.

Gumercindo's dream is to improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

Gumercindo is requesting a new loan to buy bedspreads, hammocks and threads to sell.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, hammocks and threads for resale

loans.name: Mudzimai Manhasi Group

texts.en:
Joyce (holding the sweater) is 43 years of age. She is from the city of Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with five children aged 4, 13, 19, 23 and 26. Four of her children attend school. Her husband is in the army.

Joyce runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are market problems. Joyce has requested a loan of $400 to boost her business stock by buying more clothes such as blouses and sweaters for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have an improved lifestyle. In the future, Joyce plans to take her business to the next level.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Carla Jannina

texts.es:
Carla Jannina tiene 23 años, es soltera vive con los padres, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C DIVINO NIÑO, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, está constituida por 10 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maíz y plátano, además se dedican a la comercialización de granos secos.


Carla se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, además se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es culminar los estidios.

Le gusta ser alegre y disfrutar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Carla Jannina is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She lives in the Recinto El Progreso, which belongs to the canton of Chillanes.

The members of the rural communal bank "Divino Nino" are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The group has 10 members and this is the third loan that they have requested.  The members of this communal bank work in agriculture cultivating cocoa, corn and bananas.  In addition, they also sell dried grains.

Carla works in agriculture farming cocoa, corn, bananas, soybeans and cassava.  In addition, she raises poultry.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo, and she sells her products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help her to buy supplies such as fertilizers.  The loans have helped her to increase the productivity of her croplands.  She has confronted challenges such as pests and diseases that affect her crops and illnesses that have affected her workers.  Her dream is to complete her education.

She likes to be happy and enjoy the festivities in the community.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has three children.

Hussein has had a store since 2009 selling household items. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and a ceiling and to add more inventory to his store. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and a ceiling and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 34 years old and single. For five years she has had a food shop where she sells homemade sausage and longganisa.

Lily is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients to make more sausage to sell. In the future, Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make more sausage to sell.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never went without daily bread. Ilham is married and has two children. He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of detergents and perfumes. He began this enterprise 5 years ago with startup capital from his first loan with AqroInvest CU. He has expanded his business and today his family helps him with it.

Ilham is requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to buy additional items to increase the variety of his products. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luciana; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de regalos, ella vende peluches, perfumes, collares y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de regalos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar regalos como peluches, adornos y perfumes al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "QORIMANCACHA" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Luciana, 57, is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling gift items such as stuffed animals, perfumes, necklaces and ornaments.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and through her business has been able to provice for her children.  She wants to expand and improve her gift business so is requesting a loan to buy wholesale gifts including stuffed animals, ornaments and perfumes.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale gift items such as stuffed animals and ornaments.

loans.name: Ichinsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ichinsuren, 46, is a widow and lives with her 6 children in the slum district of Choibalsan, a town of Dornod province. She runs a stall with the vegetables that she grown with one of her daughters, in the food bazaar. Ichinsuren reared her children well and they all try to support their mother by doing what they can do individually. 

Now she has plan to expand her business accordingly, by purchasing the other stall close the her current one. It is a good way to raise her earnings as she can sell more vegetables. Also it will be an important step to improving her living condition. Therefore she is requesting a loan to cover the new stall cost.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stall and expand her vegetable sales.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 38 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. She has been engaged in her restaurant for three years. 

At first, she struggled to promote her restaurant because she was new in the business. But as time passed, she learned more about the business and how to attract customers. She earns PHP 3,000 every day and usually uses it for the education of her two children. 

To increase sales, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 (Philippine peso) to buy meat and vegetables to cook, and to buy dishes, glasses, and pottery to use in her restaurant. She hopes it will contribute to a better income in order to save for emergency and educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, dishes, glasses and pottery

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a guitar-making business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her guitar-making business.

Cristina has been in this business for 30 years now, and earns additional income from crafting shells.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her guitar-making business

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 31 años de edad, que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al trabajo de la tierra en el municipio de Santuario del departamento de Antioquia. Sin embargo, debido a la temporada invernal que ha presenciado el país, estas actividades se han visto gravemente afectadas porque se les inundan los cultivos.

Actualmente debido a las dificultades, Gustavo Adolfo con sus ganas de Salir adelante y progresar, desea generar nuevos ingresos mediante una iniciativa de emprendimiento que se trata del montaje de una caseta rodante, donde anhela vender gran variedad de surtido, como chicles, mecato, cigarrillos, juguitos entre otros, para lograr esto, solicita un préstamo que le permitirá preparar su caseta y comprar el surtido inicial, para lograr mejorar sus ingresos y adicional mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 31, has dedicated much of his life to working in the fields of Santuario, Antioquia department.  Nevertheless due to the damaging summer weather that has hit the countryside, his work has been severely affected because the crops have flooded.

Now because of the problems, but with a desire to get ahead, Gustavo Adolfo wants to generate income by starting a business by outfitting a  cart where he wants to sell a great variety of products such as: gum, box lunches, cigarettes, juices, etc.  For this, he is requesting a loan that will help him set up the cart and buy the initial supplies so that he can improve his earnings, and also improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to set up a cart and buy the initial supplies to start his business

loans.name: Milembe Wg A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Milembe W G A in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Milembe W G A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela  takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Milembe WG A will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kumba Gbandara

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva.org partner based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Madam Kumba. Kumba  is thirty-six years old, a native of Lean, married and has three children. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Kumba  has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells ready-to-wear clothes, cotton cloths, baby clothes/cloths, gara cloths, etc.  Kumba  is going to use this loan to expand her business by buying more clothes/cloths to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes/cloths to add to her business.

loans.name: Kelumu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kelumu Group in Western Kenya! Dorece is the facilitator of the Kelumu group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dorece takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dorece had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Dorece was only able to harvest one bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorece and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Dorece will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kelumu group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her second-hand clothes store, which sells various kinds of clothes and bedcovers. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bundles of clothes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up clothes shops in other areas. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en: Mrs. Rit, age 49, has been a widow for many years, living with her two single children in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She is a responsible mother who has tried hard to support her children’s education. Recently her older child passed the examination to be a primary school teacher. She’s very proud of her child. Mrs. Rit is in the business of selling Khmer noodle (a kind of breakfast), a business located in her house. She typically earns an average of $2.00 per day. Mrs. Rit would like to ask for some funds from HKL to buy a stock of rice, from which she can make Khmer noodle. In the future, Mrs. Rit hopes to provide her last-born child with a further education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim, 50 years old, sells various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc. Her business is well organized. She works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and has two years of experience.

Halim has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc. to sell. Halim will use any profit from this loan to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as juice, eggs, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Remedios has a shop that sells fish such as trout and sardines. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fish to sell.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is the chairlady of Osotua women group. She is 33years old, married with 4 children. Her children are still young and all are in primary school. She operates a retail shop in Kipiro trading centre and mainly she sells house hold items which include among others: Sugar, Maize flour, vegetables, salt, and milk jugs. Her business is progressing and it’s helping her in providing all the necessities at home including medical care. She would like to stock her shop such that clients are not disappointed when they come to buy various household items. This will create customer loyalty a major contributor to business growth.

loans.use: She would like to restock her shop with Maize flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, wheat flour and soap.

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba is a 24-year old dairy woman, single, living in Khaladj village in the Salyan region .
She has run her dairy business for 10 years. With this business she provides income and provides milk for her family.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Visitasia

texts.en: Visitasia uses seashells from the shore for her jewelry business. With the help of SPBD, she was able to buy tools to carve and design different sizes of earrings. Other ladies in the program taught her how to make this jewelry. This was her first loan and her first time to do this kind of business. She is a good learner and she was able to earn more money from this craft. Everyday is a learning experience for her as she gathers more ideas from the other ladies of the program in how to be successful in her business. She chose this type of business is because she likes the creativity and it is profitable. She is requesting a second loan so she can increase her stock and income.

loans.use: To purchase more hooks, varnish, brushes, paint

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 58 years old and has one of the busiest grocery stores in downtown Carapeguá. He has 3 children of which two are in college.
