Francisco had opened a small store 25 years ago, but because it was hard for him to expand the business and his wife and him started to have children, Francisco decided to leave his family to work at the construction of Yacyretá dam. Ten years went by and everything that Don Kiko (as he is known in the neighborhood) earned, he invested in his children's education and his store, which was left in his wife's care. When Francisco came back, he once again focused in his business. Today, he wishes to get a loan to buy a new freezer to increase his beverages and ice cream sales, especially since his business is located in a busy area of the city and the store is very popular. With the loan, Francisco will be able to continue to support his children's education so that they learn to become professionals and thus have a comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Don Francisco de 58 años cuenta con una de las despensas más concurridas en el centro de Carapeguá. Cuenta con tres hijos dos de ellos estudiando en la universidad. Empezaron con una pequeña despensa ya hace 25 años pero como le costaba crecer y vinieron los hijos tomó la decisión de dejar a su familia e ir a trabajar en las obras de construcción de la represa de Yacyretá. Pasaron 10 años y todo lo que Don Kiko, como es conocido en el Barrio, ganaba, invertía en la educación de sus hijos y en la despensa donde su esposa quedó encargada. Luego volvió y se concentró nuevamente en dicha actividad. Hoy día piensa en un crédito para la compra de una nueva heladera freezer para aumentar su venta de gaseosas, helados y refrescos ya que está en un barrio céntrico de la Ciudad y su almacén es muy concurrido, de esta forma poder seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales y desarrollarse de manera estable en la vida.

loans.use: Para la compra de un heladera freezer

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara R. S. belongs to the “Perlas de Pucallpa” Communal Bank of Jr. Pachitea from the town of Ollada, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali department.

Sara is 44 years old and is a single mother with 5 children. When her husband abandoned the family, he left them with a lot of debt and she and her children had to work. The first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 (approximately $94.00). They decided to buy snack foods and sodas with that money. Over time they decided to incorporate food sales, for which they requested a loan of S/. 1,500.00 (approximately $475.00), also from Manuela Ramos.

Now the family works together to tend the business. They wake up at 4:00am and each has their obligations, from cleaning the store to the preparation of the food to serving the customers. However, they don’t neglect their studies. At 6:00pm they all meet to go over what went wrong and what went wrong in the business that day. In this way, the continue with more enthusiasm the following day.

The requested loan will be used to improve the store, which is build of wood. They need to paint the exterior so that it will be more visible. Additionally, the kitchen requires maintenance and they need to buy 3 large cooking pots and some tables. Sara is very happy to have paid off her debts. Above all, she and her family are united and they are getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara R. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal "Perlas de Pucallpa" del Jr. Pachitea del sector de la Ollada en el Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Sara tiene 44 años, madre soltera con 5 hijos, desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó dejándoles muchas deudas, ella y sus hijos tuvieron que trabajar, solicitó un primer préstamo S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) a Manuela Ramos, con ese dinero deciden vender golosinas y gaseosas, pero con el transcurrir del tiempo deciden incorporar la venta de comida, para lo cual solicitaron a Manuela Ramos un préstamo de S/. 1,500 (US$ 475.00 Aprox.). Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio, se levantan a las 4.00 am. y cada uno ya tienen sus obligaciones, desde la limpieza del local hasta la preparación del alimento y atención al cliente. Por cierto, no descuidan sus estudios. A las 6.00 pm se reúnen para ver los errores o aciertos del negocio y así seguir con mas animo el día siguiente. El préstamo solicitado será para mejorar su local que es de madera y necesita pintar la parte de afuera para tener mejor visión, además su cocina necesita mantenimiento y requiere comprar 3 ollas y un juego de mesas. Ella esta muy contenta de haber cancelado las deudas pendientes y sobre todo tiene a sus hijos unidos y están saliendo adelante.

loans.use: For maintenance of kitchen equipment and the building. To buy tables and kitchen items.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul J. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He is a pharmacist in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  He started his business in 2002 on a very small scale.  Abdul sells basic medicines and is providing services to the community.  With his previous loans, he increased his stock. Health workers from village health centers buy their medicines from Abdul’s pharmacy.  At times, he cannot supply some of the health centers when needed due to lack of inventory to meet the demand.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To increase his pharmacy stock to meet community demand.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
H. Nargiz is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan republic. She is 35 years old. She is single but she lives with her parents. Her parents are elderly. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She began her business with $200 in 1995. She keeps busy with retail trade. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.

Nargiz needs $500 to expand her business. She wants to increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: “I live in a four-room house with my three children and husband. We live in a relatively rural area in the agricultural heartland of Pakistan. I run a small store right next to my house and want to add a few items to it. Since we have electricity in our town, I would like to purchase a fridge to store soft drinks and ice creams, etc. I would also like to add a telephone call office so that people from the neighbourhood can come and place phone calls (they would pay to call). I think the call office will bring in good business. With the remaining money, I will purchase some stock for my store. These are the reasons I require a loan."

loans.use: Install a call office at the general store and purchase a freezer for ice cream

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a 22 year old man who lives with his parents and two younger brothers. It has been two years since he opened a tire store where he also sells new and used tires.

He hopes that in this business he is able to save and have enough to have a family in the future. Carlos is asking for a loan so that he may buy bigger quantities of used tires in order to fix them to sell. With a greater amount of tires he will increase his sales and better his income.

loans.use: To buy more tires.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
This committee of women has been formed for four months. It still is composed mostly of the first members. but some new women who have come on board. All of the women work in their own businesses. Many sell fruits, like oranges, pineapples, mangos, and lemons. Some make clothing, and others have their own small convenience stores, where they sell a little bit of everything.

These women are asking for a loan together so that they will have the support, both financially and socially. All of the women are working to insure that their children attend school.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients to make Paraguayan delicacies. Other women will use the funds to buy fruits, cosmetics, crafting, sewing material and refreshments.

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru:
Mahmadi A. lives in the town of Quargan-Tube. He is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He has secondary eduction. He works as a taxi driver. He owns a car, on which he plans to install natural gas system with help of a loan. This will help Mahmadi to avoid paying for gas, which became more expensive lately and made taxi business unprofitable. Moreover, he has to raise his rates. In case Mahmadi will be able to install gas system, he will decrease his rates and give residents of the region an opportunity to use taxi at affordable prices. He is planning to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Алиханов Махмади Давлятолиевич проживает в городе Курган- тюбе. Ему 37 лет, он женат и имеет 1 ребенка.Образование среднее. Работает водителем такси. Имеет автомобиль , на который хочет установить газовое оборудование , путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту , так как бензин подоражал и предоставлять услуги такси заправляясь бензином не выгодно. Кроме того цены на предоставляемые услуги поднимаются. Если клиент установит газовое оборудование , в этом случае цены на услугу снизятся, что поможет населению пользоваться такси по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To install natural gas system (instead of oil)

loans.name: Saida's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Saida is 42 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 4-19 years old. Saida is a charcoal seller; she started in 2007. Every day she works from 10am to 18pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zulfa, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
After spending a number of years teaching sewing to young women, Ramatoulaye has now decided to set herself up and work out of her home. With her sewing machine, she makes clothing that she sells to tourists. Her earnings permit her to contribute to household living expenses along with her husband who is a teacher.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ramatoulaye apres plusieurs années passées pour former les jeunes filles en couture a aujourdhui decidé de s' installer chez elle .Avec sa machine à coudre,elle confectionne des habilles qu'elle vend aux touristes.ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses de la maison à coté de son mari enseignant.

loans.use:
business capital

fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin S., age 48, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2003 she has worked planting vegetables and selling them to the market. On average, she makes $3 per day. Her husband, S. Manch, is a farmer, too. One of their children is a garment worker and receives $75 each a month. This couple would like to loan from Kiva to purchase vegetable seed to grow for the next season. (Mrs. Chin is pictured at the farm.)

loans.use: To raise animals.

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en:
Zarofat S. is 36 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to help her husband support the family, Zarofat has been running her own business for 10 years. She sells clothes and shoes for kids and women. She rents a store that is located in her home town. At the same time, she sells her goods each Friday at the large market in a neighboring city. Those days she works from 5 a.m. till late evening. Zarofat's husband helps her on Fridays.

Now Zarofat is planning to increase her working capital by purchasing goods for the summer season. She hopes to raise her income in order to pay her children’s school fees. With this purpose in mind, she requests US$ 600 for a term of 6 months. Having proved herself to be an honest, reliable client, Zarofat promises to repay the current loan promptly. Zarofat expresses her gratitude to everyone who supports her, thus allowing her to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes and shoes for kids for the summer season

loans.name: Beth's Imani Group

texts.en:
Beth is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children, between 12 and 4 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Beth is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothing & shoes sales, decorations sales, and handbag sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Janji

texts.id: Usia yang sudah melebihi setengah abad tidak membuat Ibu Ni Ketut Janji kehilangan semangat hidup. Pengalamannya dalam membesarkan anak-anaknya dengan kehidupan yang sederhana membuatnya selalu optimis dalam setiap keadaan baik senang maupun susah termasuk juga dalam hal membantu suami dalam memenuhi semua kebutuhan keluarga. Usaha yang sudah digelutinya selama bertahun-tahun yang juga sanggup menopang kehidupan keluarganya adalah beternak babi. Ibu Ketut Janji terbiasa memelihara babi penggemukan yang selalu dipeliharanya dalam kandang yang ada dibelakang rumahnya dan jumlah babi yang dipeliharanya biasanya dua sampai tiga ekor saja karena Ibu Ketut Janji tidak memiliki modal yang cukup besar untuk bisa memelihara lebih banyak lagi. Bibit dari babi penggemukan tersebut dibelinya dari kenalannya yang memelihara penginduk sehingga harganyapun tidak terlalu mahal sekitar Rp 270.000 per ekor. Babi tersebut biasanya dipelihara sekitar lima sampai enam bulan dan mampu terjual sekitar Rp 1.000.000 per ekor sehingga Ibu Ketut Janji memperoleh keuntungan sejumlah Rp 400.000 per ekornya. Walaupun keuntungannya tidak terlalu banyak namun hal ini cukup membanggakan bagi Ibu Ketut Janji karena dari hasil usahanya inilah kebutuhan hidup keluarganya bias terpenuhi. Saat ini Ibu Ketut Janiji mengikuti program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan diakhir periode pinjaman yaitu pada bulan ke enam. Dari pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari Dinari Jbu Ketut Janji berharap bias lebih baik lagi dalam menjalakan usahanya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Janji is having an optimistic view about life even though she is more than 50 years old. She has been in the business of raising pig for years. With this business she has been able to help her family's economy.

She usually raises 2-3 piglets in one time. She cannot afford to raise more than that. She can buy the piglets from her friend for IDR 270 thousand (around USD 30) per piglets. She then raises them for 5-6 months and re-sell them again for IDR 1 million (around USD 107) per pig. She can earn a profit of IDR 400 thousand (around USD 43) / pig from this.

She is now in the 6 month pig farming program from DINARI. She hopes she can earn more money from this.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi K.  est née en 1968 à Vogan  dans la Préfecture de Vo  au sud .Est du Togo. Elle est veuve  avec  cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite  un financement pour acheter de l’engrais. Ce financement lui permettra  d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi K. was born in 1968 in Vogan in Vo Prefecture, southeast of Togo. She is a widow with five children. To discharge her family responsibilities, she went into agriculture, specifically into raising corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her yield, Afi is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This funding will enable her to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and additives

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: Mirna, de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y su conviviente quien la apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 8 años, gracias a este negocio está sacando adelante a sus hijos, quienes la apoyan mucho también. Este negocio le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela que lo consumen sus productos diariamente. Además cuenta también con las ganancias de otros negocios que se encuentran a cargo su pareja, uno; y el otro su hijo. Este es al tercer préstamo con MFP, es una persona responsable en sus pagos.  Con el dinero quiere comprar más productos de pan llevar, y también mandar a construir un kiosco para dar una buena atención a su clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna is 31 years old and lives with her 4 children and her partner who supports her, especially in her business. She has sold groceries and essential goods for 8 years. Thanks to this business she is able to support her children. This business is profitable because she has a clientele that consumes her products daily. Additionally, she counts on the profits of other businesses that her partner and son are in charge of. This is her third loan with MFP. She is a responsible person with her payments. With the money she wants to buy more bread products to carry and to build a kiosk to give good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products in her grocery store.

loans.name: Veronica J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Veronica Millinga from Kyela. She is married with 2 children, aged 11 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents cannot take care of them.

Veronica has been running a crops selling business since 2004. She buys crops from farmers and bring them to town where she can sell them at higher price. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members.

Veronica currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Veronica thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Rubi Maribel

texts.es:
Rubí es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría. Rubí es de Chiclayana es conviviente tiene 37 años,  tiene cinco hijos de 16, 12, 9, 4 años y el último de 1 mes, vive hace 8 años  en Villa Maria están en el colegio estatal Estela Daris.
Rubí empezó en los negocios, hace seis años  en las reuniones familiares y las reuniones  con sus vecinos le decían que cocinaban  muy rico, que por que no cocinaba  para vender, entonces  empezó hacer polladas cada quince días preparaba 100 polladas  y también empezó hacer cevichadas  cada quince días por un buen tiempo ahora hace un año ha empezado a  repartir menú  en el grifo Guesa de Villa Maria que es donde trabaja su esposo, diario reparte 20 menús. 

Rubí solicita un préstamo de S/ 600.00 que lo va invertir en comprar víveres para su negocio de comida menú. Rubí le gusta las reuniones del Banquito ella ve que todo es legal, transparente,  que son unidas, les enseñan que deben a ahorrar y siempre les dan recomendaciones   
Rubí  nos cuenta que antes tenía que prestarse dinero de otras personas que le cobraban altos intereses ahora que esta en Finca esta mejor y más tranquila 
Rubí tiene un sueño que es ser prosperada y tener un pequeño restaurante y ayudar a su familia
texts.en:
Ruby is a partner of Communal Bank called Perlas de la Sabiduria. Ruby is from Chiclayana, and she lives with her partner. She is 37 years old and she has five children who are 16, 12, 9, and 4 years old and the youngest who is 1 month old. She has lived in Villa Maria for 8 years, and her children are in the state school Estela Daris. Ruby started her business six years ago when in family meetings and parties with her neighbors, people were telling her that she was a really good cook and that she should cook to sell. For a while she started to sell grilled chicken every two weeks and she was making 100 chikens and also she began to do Ceviche every two weeks as well. A year ago she started distributing prepared meals at the gas station Guesa de Villa Maria where her husband works. She sells 20 meals every day. Ruby is requesting a loan of 600.00 soles ($200) that she will invest in buying food supplies for her business of prepared meals. Ruby likes her bank meetings, where she can see everything is legal and transparent. They are taught they have to save and they always give them recommendations. Ruby tells us that before she had to borrow money from other people who were asking her for high interests; now that Finca (Kiva's field partner) is here she is doing better. Her dream is to prosper and have a small restaurant and to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food supplies for her meals business

loans.name: Jiguiya  (L’Espérance). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jiguiya est constitué de quatre femmes (trois mariées et une célibataire)vivant dans des foyers en majorité polygames dans le quartier koko de la ville de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente de pains,  de la  viande, des jus de fabrication locales et en plus, du bois de chauffe. Elles ont de l’expérience dans la vente de bois de chauffe et de nouriture.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis bientôt six ans.  Après avoir correctement remboursé tous les dix premiers prêts, le groupe Jiguiya est à son onzième prêt solidaire(prêt de groupe).
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour achéter du bois de chauffe dans les villages environnants de Belesso Sirakélé Tiesso et sera  revendu à la    maison. Le pain et la viande grillée ne peuvent être stockés, sont achétés et vendus quotidiennement pendant la récréation devant les écoles. Elles vendent généralement au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 75 000 CFA de bénéfice chacune au cours de ce cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
 Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir  un prêt élévé pour pouvoir diversifier les marchandises.
texts.en:
The Jiguiya group is made up of four women (three married and one single) who live in mostly polygamous households in the Koko neighborhood in the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on average 37 years old with 5 kids. Their principal business is selling bread, meat, locally-produced juice, and firewood. They have experience selling firewood and food. With the idea of increasing the size of their business, the members decided to use Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program, which they have been doing for six years. After having repaid each of their ten first loans, the Jiguiya group is on its eleventh group loan. The current loan will be used to buy firewood in the surrounding villages of Belesso, Sirakélé, and Tiesso and will be resold at home. The bread and grilled meat, which can’t be stocked, are bought and sold daily during recess in front of schools. They generally sell for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of all social groups. With this new loan, they intend to earn on average 75,000 CFA francs each in profit during the loan term. This profit will be used to repay the loan and meet the needs of their families. In the future, the group intends to take a bigger loan to be able to diversify their goods.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, and firewood

loans.name: Asikolaye

texts.en:
O. sells food. She travels to Edo State to buy her goods, a journey of about 5 hours by bus, and she travels to the market twice a month. O. sells palm oil. O. is 40 years of age and she has 3 children. O. has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year and she lives in Igbo-leren, Lagos. 

O. needs a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Siloe Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Siloe tiene como coordinadora a la Sra Guillermina P. Cerrrato de 39 años de edad quien se dedicaba a la elaboracion de zapatos, debido a que su esposo es quien le ayudaba a la elaboracion de los zapatos y quien actualmente se dedica al rubro del transporte no pudo seguir fabricando los zapatos y ella se dedica a la compra de zapatos en fabricas y se los venden a precio de mayorista y asi puede tener una mejor ganancia al vender el producto y de esa manera ella esta colaborando con los gastos del hogar.
La Sra. Dunia Y. de 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella se levanta bien temprano 4:00am para empezar a hacer la masa para las tortillas y asi poder tenerlas listas a las 7:00am para salir a venderlas ya que las tortillas se venden en la mañana porque son acompañantes del desayuno y del almuerzo en su mayoria todos los hondureños comen muchas tortillas ya que es un alimento por asi decirlo indispensable en los tres tiempos de comida.
La Sra. Lidia M. de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de jabon, papel higienico y sandalias, estos productos los vende en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas su producto lo vende al credito y tiene mucha demanda ya que lo vende a un muy precio, tambien viaja a la zona sur para vender este producto pero ahi lo vende al contado.
todas ellas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Siloe Group is coordinated by Guillermina P. Cerrrato who is 39 years old. Previously Guillermina dedicated herself to shoe making, however, because her husband who previously helped her make these shoes is currently working in the area of transportation, she was not able to continue fabricating shoes. She now purchases shoes in factories and sells them at a wholesale price; this way she can earn more when she sells the product and in that way help with household expenses. Dunia Y. is 32 years old and dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas. Dunia wakes up very early at 4:00 am to begin making the dough for the tortillas to be able to have them ready by 7:00 am when she heads out and sells them given that tortillas are sold in the morning because they are consumed with breakfast and lunch. For the most part all Hondurans eat a lot of tortillas as it is said to be an indispensable part of the 3 meals of the day. Lidia M. is 58 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of soap, toilet paper, and sandals. She sells these products to different state and private companies on credit, and has a lot demand given that she sells at a good price. She also travels to the south region to sells her product but sells it there for cash. All the women need this loan to able to succeed in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de zapatos, leña, harina de maiz, agua, cal, papel higienico, sandalias

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Хакбердиева Мавлюда проживает в районе Варзоб. Домохозяйка , но имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 8 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы купить бычка. Этим она сможет увеличить поголовье скота и после того, как бычок подрастет сможет его выгодно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavluda H. lives in the Varzob area. She is a homemaker and has a small farm where she raises large livestock. She has been in this business for 8 years. Mavluda is married and has four children. She would like to take out a loan in order to purchase a calf. This will allow her to increase her livestock count and after the calf grows up she will be able to sell it at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jesús A. labora para una empresa que se dedica a la venta de colchones, en el área de repartidor. El cuenta con una familia unida y responsable, su hija la mayor esta estudiando un nivel de bachillerato en la cual le están solicitando el pago de las colegiaturas; y como Don Jesús Antonio le quiere brindar un buen estudio esta solicitando este crédito para la realización de este pago y asi no detener la preparación del nivel académico de su hija.
texts.en:
Jesús A. works for a company that sells mattresses as a delivery man. He has a very tight, responsible family. Her oldest daughter is attending high school, for which she needs to pay large fees. As Jesús Antonio wants to give her a good education, he is requesting for this loan to make school payments, so she can continue with her studies and she can get ready for college.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es: La señora Francisca Salome P.
texts.en: Mrs. Francisca Salome P.

loans.use: Buy beauty products, cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María Basilia es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Dos Mil.
Flor de María es conviviente tiene 32 años tres hijos de 2 meses de nacido y otros de  12, 7 y años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Flor de María trabajo en ventas, pero hace tres años atrás decidió de trabajar para otros  e invertir su dinero en el negocio de su mamá tiene una bodega la cual ella se hace cargo.
Flor de María necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de cerveza, arroz, azúcar.
 Desde que Flor de María esta en Finca, aprendió hacer responsables con los prestamos, ha esforzarse, le gusta compartir con las socias sus experiencias de negocio  y aprende mucho. 
El sueño de Flor de María  es  tener un negocio de minimarket
texts.en:
Flor de Maria Basilia is a member of the Mujeres del Dos Mil community bank. She is partnered, 32 years old and has three children, a 2-month old baby and two school-aged children, 12- and 7-years old, respectively. Flor de Maria worked in sales, but three years ago she decided to work at something elseon another path. She invested her money in her mother's small general store of which she now has charge. Flor de Maria needs a 800-soles loan to buy beer, rice and sugar. Since joining Finca, Flor de Maria has learned to be a responsible borrower and become a stronger person. She likes sharing experiences about business with her fellow members and she's learned a lot. Her greatest hope is to own a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.fr: Ce jeune a abandonné les études en 2001, très tôt il s’est lancé dans le commerce de mèches. Il  s’approvisionne au GHANA et au NIGERIA pour pouvoir réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. Il vend aux coiffeuses et aux revendeuses de produits cosmétiques. Une partie de son stock étant épuisée, il veut se réapprovisionner et acheter de nouveaux modèles de mèches pour  attirer plus de clients. Il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 1 carton de mèches « pression funlay », 1 carton de mèches « lovinia AFRO-B » et 1 carton de mèches « NOBLES HONEY MOON ».
texts.en:
This young man dropped out of school in 2001 and soon got started in the commerce of hair extensions. He supplies himself from Ghana and from Nigeria to be able to realize a larger profit margin on his sales. He sells to hairdressers and to cosmetics retailers. A portion of his inventory is out of stock. He wants to stock up again and to buy new styles of hair extensions to attract more customers. He’s therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions: a box each of Pression Funlay, Lovinia AFRO-B, and NOBLES HONEY MOON.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 45-year-old single man. Four months ago he opened a mobile phone shop to expand his career. Mohamad is hoping to borrow $1,200 to purchase goods for his shop and be able to attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his shop

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор Зоитов проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Абдукаххор более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. За счет прибыли клиент хочет построить дом сыну. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Abdukahhor Z. lives in the Shahrituza district. He is 50 years old, married and has two children. His son is working in Russia. For more than 15 years, Abdukahhor has been engaged in raising livestock. He raises and sells cattle. With the accumulated profit, the client hopes to build his son a home. He is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bighorn cattle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Barco”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil Casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive Chucuito Sector Barco.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 11 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles,  para la compra y venta de pescado. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado para venderlo en el mercado de Puno.

Su deseo es poder formar una empresa de producción de truchas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Barco” communal bank, which is located in the Chucuito Sector Barco district, in Chucuito province in the Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed secondary school, and lives with her family in Chucuito Sector Barco. Elsa has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 11 years. Her first loan from them was for 300.00 soles, which she used to purchase and sell fish. At this time she is requesting a loan of 300.00 soles so that she can purchase fish to sell in the market in Puno. Elsa’s goal is to set up a trout farming business. She likes her communal bank because of the meetings and the savings opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fish

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Rosa es viuda, tiene 61 años y 4 hijos, Rosa venD. cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, además Rosa venD. comida típica los días sábados y domingos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cosméticos.
Los sueños D. Rosa son tener una farmacia y un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella (which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quecha). She is 61 years old, widowed, and has 4 children.

Rosa sells cosmetics by catalog and offers her products to her friends and relatives. She also sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy cosmetics. She dreams of opening a pharmacy and a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn Q. is from the village of Lagundi, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 38 years old. Marlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO II; están situados en la ciudad del Cusco, teniendo su cede de reunión en el distrito de huanchac.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio y servicios diversos, entre los socios hay taxistas, mecánicos, socias que tienen tiendas de abarrotes, librería, docente, venta de productos de belleza, venta de leña, venta de anticuchos (carnes a la parrilla); y otra socia que vende golosinas. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios y así ver mayor ganancia en menor tiempo.


Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Patron de San Jeronimo II" are located in the city of Cusco, having their meeting headquarters in the Huanchac district. Our members alternate their various activities between different business and services. Among the members there are taxi drivers, mechanics, members that have grocery stores, a bookstore, a teacher, and members who sell beauty products, wood, anticuchos (grilled meats) and another member who sells candy. Our members are requesting the loan to reinvest in their different businesses and in this way see greater earnings in a smaller amount of time. Our members are thankful and value the loan granted in this manner and at the same time promise to make their repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es: El banco “Divino Niño” esta representado por la señora Luminada y conformado por 14 miembros de los cuales son muy dinámicas y trabajadoras. Una mayoría de las socias se dedican a las venta de empanada en mercado central, las demás socias también tienen negocio del mismo tipo pero varían de masitas, saltañas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio  y la competencia es entre ellas porque no hay muchas persona que se dedican ha esto, casi todas viven por el barrio del hospital por lo que solo les hace falta capital para hacer crecer mas sus negocios es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para capitalizarse y principalmente mara la compra de insumos y materiales para expandir y afianzar mas sus negocios. Este grupo ya va cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas de sacar adelante sus negocios para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luminada represents the Divino Niño Bank. The bank is comprised of 14 very dynamic and hard-working members. Most of the members sell empanadas in the central market. The rest of the members also have the same type of businesses; but they sell baked goods, “saltañas” (Bolivian stuffed pastries), and groceries in neighborhood stores. Their only competition is among themselves because there are not a lot of people doing the same work. Almost all live in the hospital neighborhood. The only thing lacking is the capital to make their businesses grow. That is why they need a loan to buy supplies and materials to expand and finance their businesses more. This group is in their third cycle. They demonstrate punctuality and the desire to get ahead in their businesses. They want this to be able to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth R. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Bernadeth is single. To make a living, Bernadeth operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2005, Bernadeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Bernadeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Twegate Bugonja Rose Group

texts.en: B. Rose is a hardworking business lady, aged twenty-five years, married and blessed with one child. B. Rose owns a grocery store selling bananas, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, and so forth since 2007. She is using this loan to purchase grocery items; for instance, she will be able to purchase over thirty bags of charcoal, where previously she could purchase only ten bags of charcoal. She is working very hard to improve upon her business so that she can raise her standard of living and build a house for her son, too.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia L. is 37 years old and married to Amador L. Jr.  They live in Morong, a fine-looking place in the province of Rizal. She runs a sari-sari store (sells different goods) with the support of her loving husband. 

They have two children, the eldest is seven, a grade one student and a five year old in nursery school. 

Rodelia plans to use the loan to buy and resell different kinds of goods to support her family.  Her husband does not earn enough to cover their family expense.  She hopes to see herself enjoying the profits of her business and to have a good life.  Now, she is proposing a loan of Php 25,000.  Her previous loan was Php 20,000.  She has maintained a 100% credit rating with ASHI.  She has payed loans in full and on time.

She enjoys the benefits of having loans from ASHI because she progressively achieves her goals in life.  For almost five years Rodelia has shown industrious, discipline and given full time to her family and business to fulfillment her dreams.  She wants to build a strong concrete house and provide the best education for their children.

loans.use: Purchase food and merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Make The Difference Group

texts.en:
Korto G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Make the Difference'. She is single with 4 children aged 1-20 years old, and their educational levels are kindergarten to 8th grade.

Lorpu is an 1st grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga.

Korto has been running this business for 4 years, and is hoping to improve her business to a real shop. She faces problems with the bad road conditions from where she buys goods to her business site.

Korto needs this loan to purchase new goods to serve her customers. She dreams of giving her family a better education.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to serve customers

loans.name: Gladis Del Rosario

texts.es: Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 17 y 14 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. comida típica, tiene una tienda D. productos perecederos y también cría y venD. pollos. Gladis es una persona muy admirada y querida en su colonia ya que es alguien que trabaja mucho por sacar adelante a su familia, y para poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos perecederos, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. comida para aves.
texts.en:
Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. is 41 years old. She lives in Colón in the region of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her two children, 17 and 14 years old. She has a stall where she sells typical local foods, a shop of perishable goods, and she also raises and sells chickens. Gladis is a person who is much admired and loved by her neighbours, as she is someone who works hard to raise her family and to be able to offer her husband the help he needs with the household. She is requesting a loan with which she would be able to purchase more perishable goods; she would also like to be able to purchase a larger quantity of bird food.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bird food and perishable goods.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad K. is 54 years old and the father of three daughters and four sons. He owns and runs a supermarket in Ramallah as a source of living. Two of his sons who work with him at the supermarket are married and responsible for their own families.

Mohammad's wife and sons work with him to help and support the three families. Therefore, he applied for his first loan from FATEN to expand the business and buy more goods which will, he hopes, increase the families' income and improve their situation.

Mohammad and his son Tamer appear in the photo.

loans.use: To make store improvements and to buy more goods

loans.name: Jaritza Group

texts.es:
Rosa Merchán de 42 años. Su esposo vende legumbres en el mercado de mayoristas con el tiene 6 hijos de 18, 13, 12, 10, 9, 8 años.

Rosa es dueña de una tienda, en la que vende huevos, bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. Ella se levanta en la madrugada para comprar en el mercado de mayoristas la mercadería para la tienda.

Con el préstamo espera surtir mas su negocio con aceite, arroz, verde y otros víveres, y así mejorar su tienda.

Rosa es coordinadora del grupo ella esta vestida con una blusa de rallas rojas y una falda jeans, el grupo Jaritza  es integrado por 4 personas en total. Ellos viven en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Rosa compartirá este préstamo con el grupo. Ellos trabajan en la venta de verdes y naranjas, decoraciones de autos, venta de carnes. Los miembros del grupo mutuamente se comprometen a ser responsables en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 42 years old. Her husband sells vegetables in the wholesale market and has 6 children with Rosa: they are 18, 13, 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old. Rosa is the owner of a small store where she sells eggs, drinks, rice, sugar, etc. She wakes up at dawn to buy her store's inventory in the wholesale market. With the loan, she will better supply her store with oil, rice, and other goods, and thus improve her business. Rosa is the group coordinator; in the picture, she is in the blouse with red stripes and the jean skirt. The Jaritza group consists of 4 people who live in the semi-urban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. Rosa will share the loan with the group. They sell bananas and oranges, car decorations, and meats. The group members commit to each other to jointly be responsible for repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Tiang

texts.en:
In order to earn a daily revenue, Mrs. Tiang C., age 60, sells both used and new cloth at the local busy market. With this business, she is able to feed her family. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local rice farmer. This couple has been married for several years and has been blessed with  eleven children. Three of them are married and the remaining eight are single. Two of her daughters are employed at the garment factory. 

Tiang C. has a single daughter who is jobless and she wants to have a suitable occupation but doesn’t have capital to start a business. Because of this, Tiang C. is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of groceries as inventory so that her daughter can begin selling in the village. (Tiang C. was not available at that time so her daughter is pictured in her place.)

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries for inventory.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Тошбоев Равшан проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мяса. В этой области более 5 лет. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Ravshan T. lives in the Yavan district. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle to be resold for meat. Ravshan has been involved in this field for over 5 years. Besides, the development of this business sector allows to provide fresh meat to the markets. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen tiene 53 años de edad. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este es su mayor fuente de ingresos por lo que sale, todos los días para mostrar cada uno de sus productos. ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es pinturas de labios, bases, cremas perfumes y colonias pues son muy importantes para aumentar su clientela. Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Tomasa del Carmen is 53 years old and has been a client of the Foundation for a long time. She sells general merchandise and has been dedicated to this business for more than 17 years. With great effort she has managed to maintain her business. This is her only source of income, so she goes out every day to demonstrate each of her products. She is requesting this loan to purchase products like lipstick, foundation, perfume and other products that are important to growing her clientele. Her greatest dream is to move forward with her business and remain active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan N. S. is a farmer in Busia district, Nambale. He is 84 years old and married. He plants and harvests twice a year. He says he has been in farming for 30 years and that life is defined by food and the determination of the farmer.

He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to buy seeds, prepare land for farming, and buy fertilizer. His main plan is to keep increasing his farm's produce.

loans.use: Expand farming area

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fuerza inicia su segundo ciclo con 17 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comidas, abarrotes en general, gelatinas, lácteos, artesanía, frutas y quesos.
Como es el caso de la Señora Alicia que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Alicia es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, anteriormente Alicia vendía artesanía y por problemas familiares dejo de realizar este negocio, hace 3 años implemento una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco fue agregando mas productos en su negocio ahora vende verduras, frutas. Además los días domingos vende frutas y bebidas en la feria de animales de la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Alicia invertirá su negocio en la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar. Los sueños de Alicia son tener una tienda grande y construir su casa de material noble. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 6,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Fuerza Community Bank is starting its second loan cycle with 17 members. The members have different businesses like selling food, groceries, jellies, milk products, crafts, fruit or cheeses. Alicia is the president of the community bank. She is a 29-year-old single mother of two children. Previously she sold craftwork but because of family problems she had to give up the business. Three years ago she set up a grocery stO. in her home and little by little she added mO. products to the business. Now she sells fruits and vegetables. FurthermO., on Sundays she sells fruits and beverages at the city's animal trade fair, which she does with the help of her eldest daughter. Alicia plans to invest in her business by purchasing rice, milk and sugar. Her dreams are to have a big stO. and to build a home out of quality material. The members require different loan amounts, such as 300, 500 and 600 soles, for a grand total of 6,600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and milk along with other products

loans.name: Ermalie

texts.en:
Ermalie L. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Ermalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ermalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Too Faitful Group

texts.en:
Felecia L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Too Faithful.  She is 29 years old, engaged and has three children who range from seven months to 8 years old. She was only able to attend school to 12th grade due to poverty. Two of her children are in school and she also cares for two siblings.

For 10 years she has been selling items such as rice, creme, pots and onions on the Roberts Field Highway on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.
 
Her hope is to make sufficient profit to take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Mabinuligon, Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and standing cane businesses.  Her husband Crispin, who is 74 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and he also helps his wife.  They have seven children who are 28 to 50 years old. 

Amparo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amparo has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000.  

This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy standing cane and stocks for her general store so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and to expand her standing cane business.  Amparo is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie T. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Ronie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Ronie operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicab services to local community members. Ronie has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home enlargement.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La joven María Elena L. M., es casada tiene un hijos menor de edad vive junto a su familia en el municipio el viejo, iglesia esquípala 80vras abajo, es una joven profesional con deseos de superación y desarrollarse en el campo laboral, actualmente trabaja para la Alcaldía municipal de Chinandega laborando como asistente de finanza desde hace más de nueve años
 La joven María Elena L. M. ha obtenido cinco créditos de los cuales ha cancelado cuatro, dice sentirse agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado ya que con estos créditos a mejorado su vivienda y le han ayudado a resolver algunos problemas de índole familiares.
texts.en:
María Elena L. M. is married and has one young son. She and her family live in “Iglesia Esquípala” part of the town of El Viejo. She is a young professional with a desire to succeed in the workforce and has been working as a finance assistant for the Chinandega city hall for more than nine years. This young lady has had five previous loans and has repaid four of them. She tells us that she is grateful for the trust that we have placed in her, especially because these loans have helped to improve her home and have helped her to resolve some family insolvency issues.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phon H., who was B. 1951, was selected as the bank president of this village loan, located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Members of this village will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes.
                 
Mr. Phon H. and his wife, Mrs. Sim Loa, are farmers who own two hectares of land, which they use to cultivate rice, peanuts and corn for a living. In order to support this farm, Phon decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, peanut seed and fertilizer to grow crops. They are also farmers who work very hard to support a child who is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice and peanut seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en: Patrocenia N. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Patrocenia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Patrocenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Patrocenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne M. aged 58, is the manager of a Community Bank named “Lisungi Plus” which means “Assistance” in English. It is composed of 19 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Anne has been a part of the micro-enterprise world since 1991. She started selling shikwanges (Congolese food)beginning with a capital of $100. She has been with Hope since October 2008. Progressively, her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. 

The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges and sell them with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $50 per week. Anne’s ambition is to open a general store. She is a widow and a mother of nine children between the ages 18 and 34. One of them attends school.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges (Congolese food) and sell them at profit.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of Bungad. She is 35 years old. Teresita is married and has three young children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling "dirty ice cream" or sorbetes for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. is a 47-year-old clothing seller in Phnom Penh City. She currently sells clothing for both men and women from her house and in the busy market. She is married with three children who are enrolled in school. The other one is married. Usually Ly S. generates around $2.50 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. Her life partner is her husband (pictured) who is a motor taxi driver around Phnom Penh city of Cambodia. She is concerned that her house is getting old, and some parts of it are cracked. Ly S. thinks that it is not comfortable for her family to live there. Therefore, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to mend her broken house.

loans.use: To mend her broken house.

loans.name: Bayarbold

texts.en:
Bayarbold Y. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Harhorin, the ancient Mongolian empire's capital.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their two daughters.  

Bayarbold owns and operates his own wood product business in his home.  He started his business in 2000 based on his childhood talents and interest in crafts.  All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture maker.  

Bayarbold is a modest and hardworking man and plans to have his own work place in the near future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood materials for his furniture making business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wood materials.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old, is married and has with adult children. To make a living, Rogelio plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). Gertrude has a business selling milk. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products door-to-door. Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more jerry cans of milk. She also generates additional income through hiring of motorcycles. The main business challenges for Gertrude are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only. Gertrude lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of milk

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, es empleado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos, está soltero, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, él trabaja en MOTO STORE desde hace cinco años, donde se encargan de todo lo relacionado a motocicletas.
El además tiene un pequeño taller es propio y quiere adquirir un compresor por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar este compresor que le será de mucha ayuda en el taller, esta inversión le servirá para impulsarse y mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es lograr un taller amplio para dedicarse solo a él, sin tener que trabajar para otro taller y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
Carlos is employed, he is 22 years old, and he lives with his parents and siblings. He is single and he lives in Jiquilisco in the region of Usulutan. He has been employed with Moto Store for the past five years, where he is in charge of anything related to motorcycles.

In addition, he also has his own shop and he wants to purchase a compressor. He requests a loan in order to purchase a compressor which will be of great help in his shop. This investment will motivate him and it will improve the service he provides to his clients.

His goal is to have a large shop and to work there full time, without having to work elsewhere. He wants to support his parents and his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Nimpha

texts.en:
"Nimpha is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures - a pig fattening business and a fish vending business. Her husband Allan, who is 37 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 5 to 12 years old.

Nimpha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nimpha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to as additional working capital for her business ventures so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children and support the family's household expenses. Nimpha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Dinorak Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Dinorak de 40 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la colonia los angeles desde hace 3 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria impartinado el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comarca , su mamà la apoya con el cuido de sus hijos,  su esposo se dedica  a comercializar ganado, ambos se ayudan con los gastos familiares,                                                                                                   Solicita su 3er credito para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda, asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones en el hogar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida e ir mejorando poco a poco su condiciones de vida para su mayor comodidad en el Hogar.
texts.en:
Dinorak is 40 years old and works as a teacher in the los angeles neighborhood, she has taught elementary school for three years to the rural kids of that area, her mom supports her by taking care of her children, her husband sells cattle and they help each other with the family expenses.  She requests her third credit to fix the kitchen in her home and provide her family with better living conditions. 

Her biggest dream in life is to keep her family united and improve little by little their life conditions for more comfort in their home.

loans.use: Fix kitchen

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S., 44, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband sells palm products, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $69 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so it can improve the standard of living of their families.

Mrs. SaR. is the village bank president and has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she can grow both rice and watermelon to sell to support her family. She has some problems in the crop fields because her fields have infertile soil, so, to improve production, Mrs. SaR. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.  With the rest of the loan she is going to buy two piglets and plow a field for growing watermelon.

Her husband, Mr. Sin, owns a horse cart. This couple supports seV. children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, while the other three are studying in local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 30 años, vive en concubinato con José. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jair y Ángel; a los que cuida y alimenta en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Hace  8 años comenzó a dedicarse a la “agricultura, desde entonces alquila los terrenos agrícolas anualmente, donde siembra con la ayuda de sus esposo; arveja y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en el campo “me siento tranquila”, afirma. Además cuenta que ella “nunca pierde”, pues cuando el precio de la arveja está bajo en el mercado, hace secar el grano; vendiendo después como semilla; donde obtiene un poco más del dinero invertido, ya que cada saco de semilla seca oscila entre los S/. 500 soles como mínimo. Su principal dificultad es no contar con terrenos propios, además que debe cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Por ello está pensando en ahorrar cada vez que pueda, para poder comenzar a comprar más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de arrendamiento.
