She sells all kinds of products such as food, candy, cookies etc. She would like a loan to buy more of these products for her store as soon as possible so she can continue providing them to her customers who visit the store daily.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from Barangay Faustino, Cauayan City, Isabela Province. She is 48 years old. Rosita is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosita is married. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Rosita's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bum-Ayush

texts.en: Bum-Ayush B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife operates a sewing business and makes traditional Mongolian clothing. During the day, Bum-Ayush operates a taxi service in his home province. He has been operating a taxi service since 2008, and has steadily grown the business. Originally, he had been a herder in the countryside with a few heads of livestock. Currently, Bum-Ayush has a loyal customer base due to his good service and communication skills.  His average monthly sales revenue is 450,000 tugrugs (~ 316 USD) and profit is 250,000 tugrugs (~ 175 USD). Besides his business, Bum-Ayush also helps his wife's sewing business. His wife, Tserenhand, makes traditional Mongolian clothing and earns 80,000 tugrugs (~ 56 USD) per month. She has been operating this business since 2000, and has become an experienced sewer. Bum-Ayush and his wife work hard to improve their quality of life. He is requesting a 600,000-tugrug loan to purchase spare parts for his car for his taxi service business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena D. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Filomena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Filomena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Filomena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Filomena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 060126-Hoằng Hoá- Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Sáu Lê Thị is a 35 year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She leads a loan group with eight members, each of whom will receive a portion of the loan but all of whom are responsible for paying it back. This group is officially known as 060126-Hoằng Hoá-Thanh Hoá (06.01.26).

Sáu is married and makes a living selling livestock, primarily pigs. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Sáu joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for this loan, her first, for 3,079,800 VND to buy piglets to raise and sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

The other borrowers in this group are:
1.  Lê Thị Thanh, a 27-year-old woman who has applied for money to expand her fishing business.
2.  Lê Thị Luận, who is 51 years old and needs money to raise livestock.
3..  Vũ Thị Lân is a 50-year-old woman who needs funding to expand her fishing business.
4.  N. Thị Nhung is 37 years old and has applied for money to expand her livestock-raising business
5.  Vũ Thị Tình is 44 years old and needs money to expand her fishing business.
6.  C. Thị Dinh is 55 years old and needs money to raise more livestock
7.  N. Thị Dung is a 26 year-old woman who needs funding for her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sáu Lê Thị (134) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố  Thanh Hoá.  Sáu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 060126-Hoằng Hoá-Thanh Hoá (06.01.26).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Sáu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sáu kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2010, Sáu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sáu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Thanh (135) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Lê Thị Luận (136) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Vũ Thị Lân (137) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. Thị Nhung (138) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Vũ Thị Tình (139) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  C. Thị Dinh (140) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  N. Thị Dung (32) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to expand various small businesses

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya (2 veuves et 2 mariées) vivent dans des  familles monogames avec en moyenne 48 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent  le quartier Darsalam, Commune Urbaine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali)  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de mariage.
 Les membres du groupe achètent et revendent des habits notamment des pagnes wax, fancy, des tissus brodés, des tissus légers, des draps de lit, des rideaux et  des sacs à main. 
Le besoin  d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce  et le désir de diversifier leurs marchandises les motivèrent à continuer à entretenir de bonnes relations avec l’institution. Elles en sont  à leur 7ème   prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les précédents. 
Madame Kadiatou Djiré mène l’achat et la vente d’habits depuis sept ans. Elle utilisera son montant pour acheter : 8 pièces de pagnes wax et 4 pièces de tissus légers en coton beaucoup utilisés pendant la période de chaleur. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ségou  et  revend ses habits, à domicile et en ambulant à travers les quartiers de Darsalam, Hamdallaye et Médine au comptant et à  crédit  à une  clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Kadiatou Djiré espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser son prêt, contribuer à la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Badenya group (two widows and two married women) live in monogamous families and are, on average, 48 years old and have three children. They all live in the Darsalem district in the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors, as friends and through marriage ties. The members of the group buy and sell clothing, pagnes (lengths of brightly colored cloth used for clothing) of the Wax and Fancy brands, embroidered fabric, lightweight fabric, bed sheets, curtains and handbags. The need to increase their working capital and the desire to diversify their merchandise has motivated them to maintain their good relationship with the institution. They are on their seventh joint loan, having properly repaid the preceding ones. Mrs. Kadiatou Djiré has been managing the purchase and sale of clothing for seven years. She will use her funds to buy eight Wax pagnes and four lengths of light cotton cloth which is very often used during the hot season. She gets her supplies at the main market in Ségou and sells her clothing from her home and traveling around the districts of Darsalam, Hamdallaye and Médine. She deals in cash and credit to a clientele of men and women. Mrs. Kadiatou Djiré hopes to clear a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to repay her loan and to contribute to meeting certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. R. is from the village of Agusan Canyon,Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Victoria is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, que  vive en su casa propia, en compañía de  su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores.La actividad cotidiana a la que se dedica Rosa, es la venta la comida. Su especialidad es la preparación de papas rellenas (plato típico cuyo relleno es de carne), que vende en un puesto cercano a un colegio. Sus compradores potenciales son los estudiantes y las madres de familia. Hace algunos años atrás vendía en la puerta de su casa, y no le era muy rentable, pero desde que se ubicó en la puerta de este colegio, siempre termina de vender lo que ha preparado. Se siente muy feliz con lo que hace, ya que el apoyo de sus hijos alivia su cansancio y lo más difícil para ella, es pelar las papas calientes, que no le permiten avanzar muy rápido. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su puesto y educar a sus hijos.Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas con puntualidad, ya que sabe que este dinero le será  muy útil para el progreso de su negocio. En su grupo es una socia  comprometida en las actividades de su grupo. Rosa tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos y mercaderías en comestibles, para surtir  su negocio, y así quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is a hard-working, cheerful mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two minor children. Her daily work consists in selling prepared meals. Her specialty is stuffed potatoes (a typical dish stuffed with meat) that she sells in a stand located near a high school. Her potential customers are students and mothers. A few years ago she sold at her doorstep and didn’t earn much but, since moving to the school’s entrance, she always sells out all she prepares. She is very happy with her work because her children help her thereby easing her fatigue. The most difficult chore for her is peeling the hot potatoes, which slows her down. For the future, she plans to enlarge her stand and educate her children. This is her 10th loan from MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she knows this money will be very useful for the progress of her business. She is a committed participant in her communal group’s activities. Rosa plans to use the requested funds to buy raw materials and food ingredients to stock her business because she wants to offer her customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Macelita

texts.en:
Marcelita M. is a 35-year old woman who lives with her husband in Brgy Bahigan, Dalaguete, Cebu City.  She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish and vegetable. They have one four year old child.  

Marcelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 to help her family.  With her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,600.

Marcelita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to buy and sell fish.

Now she is borrowing for her 6th cycle loan, Php 17,000, to support her business.  Marcelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

----------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chhong

texts.en: Mrs. Chhong T. is 44 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She is married to Mr. Korng Sron, age 46, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has four children, all are working as laborers outside of country. Due to the coming rainy season, which is when conditions are good for planting rice, Chhong T. has requested a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on her own farmland

loans.name: Luis Estalin

texts.es:
Luis Estalin S. R. tiene 27 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 ninos de 7 meses hasta 8 anos.
  
Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura y al cultivo de cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao 2 veces por mes. 

Solicita el préstamo para criar los pollos y chancos. Su sueño es sacar adelante una casa y los estudios de los niños.  

Le gusta jugar el deporte del indor futbol.
texts.en:
Luis Estalin S. R. is 27. He is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 4 children from 7 months to 8 years. He is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Luis is a farmer who cultivates cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao twice a month. He is requesting this loan for raising chickens and pigs. His dream is to get ahead with a home and his children's studies. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chickens and pigs

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
la sra. Marta Gloria C. tiene 31 años de edad,  vive con su esposo en su casa ubicada en la aldea
el Pedrerito La Montaña,  dependen de ese hogar 4 hijos que estan estudiando en la escuela y colegio de la comunidad. 
Marta se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser: azucar, manteca, arroz, jabon, aceite, jugos, refrescos, tambien tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo en una escuela.
el esposo trabaja en una finca y le ayuda economicamente.
Marta utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para su pulperia ya que desea surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
 
tiene un proyecto con su familia de construir su nueva casa ya que la desean hacer de bloque material mas resistente, actualmente viven en una que es de tierra y es muy frajil y cuando llueve es muy peligroso que se pueda caer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta Gloria C. is 31 years old. She lives with her husband in their house located in the town of el Pedrerito La Montaña. There are 4 dependent children in the home who are in the community primary and high schools. Marta sells products of popular consumption such as: sugar, lard, rice, soap, oil, juice, and soda. She aslo has a part time job at the elementary school. Her husband works at a farm and he helps her financially. Marta will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store since she wants to diversify her business little by little and thus obtain more earnings. She has a project with her family building a new house, since they want to make it of more durable blocks. Presently they live in an earthen house which is very fragile and when it rains there is danger that it could cave in.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, toilet paper, corn meal, flour, eggs, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, pasta, sauces, churros,  soda, candles, matches, light bulbs, batteries.

loans.name: Mary Lane

texts.en:
Mary Lane B. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 43 years old. Mary Lane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Lane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Lane has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Mary Lane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Lane is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Lane from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farming supplies

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline V. is from the village of District II. She is 49 years old. Jacqueline is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacqueline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jacqueline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta S. is from the town of Panglao. She is 54 years old. Norberta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norberta owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Norberta works hard to sustain her children's education. She dreams to see them graduate from college and have bright futures.

Norberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norberta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Norberta is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es: Ana Yanira P. T. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, así mismo junto a cuatro hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar, con los cuales vive en Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad. Ana posee una venta de  productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, debido a que se encuentra frente a la calle principal lo que la hace muy visible para muchas personas, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno de muchas personas. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucho valor para ella ya que es una fuente de ingresos muy importante para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Yanira P. T. is 42 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a farmer, and their four young children, who attend school.  They all live in Tacachico, in the Libertad department.

Ana has a food and primary needs products store and sells things such as bread, eggs, milk, basic grains, and other items.  The business is in a good location, on the main street, making it visible to many people.  This is of great benefit to her because it’s in a place where many people gather and she has steady customers that she can count on.

Ana is asking for this loan so that she can increase her inventory and be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  This business is very valuable to her because it’s an important source of income with which she supports her family.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Yobesh

texts.en:
Yobesh is 33 years old. He is married with four children who are between the ages of 3 and 14. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been farming for the last 15 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His products are maize, milk and tea, which are all sold locally. He says that his major challenge in farming has been lack of enough finances to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides to spray farm crops and animals.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase the income of the family through the sale of milk. He will therefore be able to pay school fees for his children with ease. He hopes to expand his farming in the future and hopes to get enough income to invest in another business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Harbiya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 63 years old and a married women. She has four children and four relatives live with her family.

She started her business in 1980 and she works at her own house. She is a seamstress and she is well known where she lives and has an excellent reputation. 

She is requesting a loan of US$ 2700 to buy new sewing and embroidery machines in addition to a small generator. She is aiming that her business will grow bigger and be more advanced. This way she will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buying new sewing and embroidery machines in addition to a small generator

loans.name: Sil

texts.en:
Sil L., age 45, is a married woman who has been living in Phnom Penh. Sil L. is a housewife who always works in and around her house. Her daily activities are cooking meals, cleaning the house, and caring for her children. She is married to Mr. Mat Heurn, age 51, who shares responsibility for her family by working as internal staff in the local district. He earns a proper salary every month. This couple has five children, three of whom are single, and two of whom are married. All of the children still live in the family home even though two of them are employed in different jobs. 

Sil L. is concerned that her family is facing difficulty with their living conditions because their house needs to be repaired. To solve the problem, Sil L. would like a loan to repair a broken part of her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay school fees of his kids

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, des boissons et  de la restauration.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des boissons en sucrerie (BRAMALI), des condiments pour la restauration et des  habillements.                                   
FATOUMATA M., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des boissons non alcoolisées avec les grossistes de la place. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au poste de contrôle à la sortie de la ville de Fana en partance pour Bamako, au comptant, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de passagers.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi Group, all married, have an average age of 39 years and an average of three children each. They all live together in a traditional extended family in the town of Fana in the Banankabougou area of the Dioïla district in Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They know each other through family ties and the clothing, drinks and restaurant businesses they run.

The women of the Benkadi group are on their eighth group loan which will be used to purchase soft drinks (called BRAMALI), condiments for the restaurant and clothes.

FATOUMATA M., the president of the group, plans on using her part of the loan to buy non-alcoholic drinks from wholesalers. She sells her produce for cash every day at the checkpoint at the Bamako exit of the town of Fana, to a customer base made up largely of passengers.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA which will be used to pay back the loan, contribute to healthcare costs, food bills, school fees and the rest she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: The purchase of non-alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Nancy Kaptuiya

texts.en:
Nancy Kaptuiya C. is a 43 years old and married to Dickson C. a primary school teacher. They have been blessed with five children age between 14 years and 5 years. Nancy supports a family of 10 with the help of her husband.

Nancy runs a retail shop in Seretunin trading centre a few kilometers from Kabarnet town in Baringo County. She started this business 12 years ago as a food kiosk and her business grew so that now she operates a retail shop. This business gives her an average profit of Kshs 10,000 a month.  

Nancy has borrowed a loan of Kshs 40000 from KADET LTD being her fourth loan after successfully paying her previous loans. She intends to use the whole amount of loan to purchase stock for her retail shop. She anticipates using her profits to expand her business and save some for future. 

Her future dreams are to expand her business to a wholesale shop and be able to build rental houses and she also hopes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her retail shop

loans.name: La Manzana Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Santiago Oxtempan, Municipio del  Oro, México,  el grupo se llama “La Manzana” está integrado por doce personas, son 11 mujeres y 1 hombre,  la comunidad es pequeña y esta sobre carretera, son pocas gentes las que habitan y es una localidad muy boscosa hay muchos árboles, el clima es un poco frio a pesar D. que el sol es fuerte, por lo mismo como es boscosa es más fuerte el frio que el sol, la gente D. la comunidad vive sobre la loma D. un cerro,  la gente es sencilla  amable y muy trabajadora, la mayoría son comerciantes y otros más se dedican a la agricultura, en este grupo están los dos tipos D. fuentes económicas, el comercio y la agricultura, los nombres D. los integrantes del grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Ubaldo C. Gonzales
2,.Rosa C. Ramírez
3.-Susana D. J. M.
4.-Elizabeth M. R.
5.-Alicia C. G. 
6.-Graciela R. M.
7.-Adriana R. T.
8.-Anastacia L. C.
9.-Julia M. G.
10.-Eulalia M. A.
11.-Sara R. S.
12.-Rebeca M. R..
Los integrantes del grupo desidieron llamarse D. esta manera porqué en donD. viven hay muchos arboles D. manzana, y la gente conoce ese lugar como barrio la manzana, por eso al grupo le pusieron la manzana,  la encargada del grupo y líder en su comunidad se llama doña Rosa, ella conoce a su gente desD. hace 10 años, doña Rosa es casada ya lleva 17 años viviendo con su esposo, su esposo trabaja como empleado en un negocio D. vidrios y espejos en el centro del Oro, tiene 4 hijos, sus 4 hijos estudian, el mayor estudia la preparatoria, 2 mas la secundaria y 1 en la primaria que es una niña, a doña Rosa se le hace difícil mantener los estudios D. sus hijos, mas sin embargo lo hace para que progresen y tengan una mejor calidad D. vida, para esto doña Rosa venD. colchas por catalogo las ganancias las ocupa en los pasajes D. sus cuatro hijos que son diarios, y su esposo se encarga D. la casa y demás, para doña Rosa lo complicado es que tiene que dar fiada la mercancía y cuando va a cobrar habeces no le pagan, pero uno D. sus sueños es que su negoció le D. ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos y puedan seguir estudiando. Por ahora solo pido eso ya que para aspirar a más se necesita más que solo vender colchas.
texts.en:
The following group is located in Santiago Oxtempan in Oro, Mexico.  The group is called "La Manzana" (The Apple) and is maD. up of 12 people, 11 women and one man.  The town is small and and very few people live there.  It is a very woody area with a lot of trees.  The climate is cold despite the bright sunshine and most people live high on the hill.  People here are kind and hard-working and live very simple lives.  Most of them are involved in retail sales and others are farmers.  This group has both types of income.  The members of the group are the following:

1.-Ubaldo C. Gonzales
2,.Rosa C. Ramírez
3.-Susana D. J. M.
4.-Elizabeth M. R.
5.-Alicia C. G. 
6.-Graciela R. M.
7.-Adriana R. T.
8.-Anastacia L. C.
9.-Julia M. G.
10.-Eulalia M. A.
11.-Sara R. S.
12.-Rebeca M. R..

The name of the group is for all the apple trees in the area.  It is known as the apple neighborhood.  The leader of the group and of the town is Doña Rosa.  She has known everyone for ten years.  She has been married for 17 years.  Her husband is in the glass and mirror business in downtown Oro.  She has 4 children.  The oldest son is in college preparatory, two more are in high school and the only girl is in elementary.  Doña Rosa has a hard time making ends meet and maintaining the level of education for her children.  But she does this so they will be successful and have a better lifestyle.  Rosa sells bedspreads by catalogue.  With her earnings she pays for transportation costs for her four children.  Her husband takes care of household expenses and other things.  Rosa's problem is that sometimes she has to wait for payment on orders she has already delivered and sometimes she doesn't get paid at all.  Her dream is to earn enough for her children to continue their studies.  For now that's all she wants since she can't aspire to more by only selling bedspreads.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads and sheets by catalogue

loans.name: Maura Elizabeth

texts.es:
La joven Maura Elizabeth de 27 años de años de edad labora como secretaria municipal del Ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 3 años, tiene un bebesito de 10 meses,  su esposo labora como director de un colegio ambos comparten con los gastos familiares ya que son una familia bien unida.                                                                                                        
Esta muy agradecida con Kiva por el apoyo brindado y a  la vez solicita su tercer credito para areglar una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones para que su hijo crezca en un ambiente agradable pero sobre todo lleno de amor. 
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su bebesito goce de salud y que su linda familia  permanezca en union con Dios, que no les falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Maura Elizabeth, 27, has worked as a Municipal Secretary for the Ministry of Education for the last three years.  She has a 10-month-old baby.  Her husband is a School Principal.  They both share family expenses because they are a very united family.

She is very grateful to Kiva for the help provided and is, the same time, asking for her third loan to fix up a bedroom with better conditions so that her son will grow up in a pleasant atmosphere but, above all, one filled with love.

Her greatest dream in life is that her baby is healthy and that her lovely family stays together with god; that they not lack their daily bread.

loans.use: To fix up a room.

loans.name: Distrito 8 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "Distrito 8" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de L. Institución, compuesto por 13 personas de los cuales dos son varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, fotógrafos y promotoras de cosméticos, son de L. zona del Plan 3000 El grupo se fundo por L. iniciativa de L. Sra. Mary quien es L. presidenta, que se dedica a L. venta de ropa al crédito, L. que distribuye entre sus amistades y vecinos, elL. realiza sus compra los miércoles y sábados ya que compra por docena en L. feria de Barrio Lindo, por este motivo solicito el crédito para comprar ropa por docenas.  L. Sra. Consuelo es L. tesorera tiene 24 años elL. es soltera aún no tiene hijos pero ya cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa y eventualmente también vende cosméticos, elL. es una persona muy carismática y sobre todo emprendedora  ya vende las cosas de temporada, cuando no esta vendiendo ropa busca electrodomésticos y materiales escolares para vender, elL. vive en L. casa de sus padres a los que ayuda, elL. sueña con poder juntar de a poco dinero para poder comprar su lote y luego poder independizarse, con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería en cosméticos que se encuentra en liquidación. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidos con L. institución  por el apoyo brindado, una de las socias no esta en L. foto ya que elL. esta sacando L. foto.
texts.en:
The "Distrito 8" community bank is in its first loan cycle with the institution.  The bank has 13 members, 2 of whom are men.  The members' business activities include selling clothes, sheets and comforters; photography and selling cosmetics.  They are all from Plan 3000 neighborhood.  The group was founded by Mary who is the group's president.  Her business is selling clothes on credit to her friends and neighbors.  She buys her products on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  She buys her products in bulk in Barrio Lindo market.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes in bulk.

Consuelo is the bank's treasurer.  She is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have any children yet.  However, she already owns her own business selling clothes and eventually she will also sell cosmetics.  She is a very charismatic person and, above all, enterprising.  She sells seasonal products.  When she is not selling clothes she looks for electrical appliances and school supplies to sell.  Consuelo lives in her parents' home and helps them.  She dreams of being able to put a little money aside so that she can buy a plot of land and become independent.  She will use her loan money to buy cosmetics that are on sale.  All the members of her community bank are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support they have offered them.  One of the bank's members is not in the photo as she is taking the photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Lydia is 43 years old. Lydia has three children who are in school.

Lydia has a wholesale and retail rice grains business in the Philippines.  Lydia requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more rice to resell.

For four years, Lydia has been in this business. In the future, Lydia would like her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to resell

loans.name: Enma Bezabeth

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

La señora Enma es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  44 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos de  los cuales  cuatro ya son mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 12 años que estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es guardián.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo. Además de productos de  Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Nos cuenta que lleva seis años en esta actividad y que fue una amiga que la incentivó  a entrar al mundo del comercio.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos de la marca Azalea.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que viven donde su esposo trabaja de guardián.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Growing for The Future meets every fifteen days in the area known as Forest Park in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for a beautiful park located within as well as for having an exuberant vegetation and beautiful landscapes.

Mrs. Enma is a founding member of the communal bank, is treasurer for payments, and likes it because the interest rates are lower than credit institutions. She is 44 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has 6 children 4 of which are elders the other two of 16 and 12 studying in college. Her husband is a guard.

She is a housewife and to make money she sells clothes and shoes by catalog. She also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works three days out of the week, takes credit and charges weekly or biweekly according to what her clients want. She tells us that she has been doing this for six years and it was a friend who convinced her to enter into the business world.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes, and Azalea brand shoes.

Her dream is to buy her own home since they currently live where her husband works as a guard.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothes, and shoes

loans.name: Tania Carolina

texts.es:
Tania, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en Puerto es Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con sus hijas de 12 y 10 años de edad, tiene casa propia; El negocio lo inicio hace 16 años en que ofrece mariscos y también verduras.
Por el momento  solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, tanto verduras como mariscos,  que le ayude a mejorar su cantidad de inventario y tener mejores oportunidades de venta.
En un futuro sueña tener su propio vehículo, para el transporte de mercadería.
texts.en:
Tania is 36 years old and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department, with her daughters who are 12 and 10.  She owns her own home.  Tania's business is selling seafood.  She started her business 16 years ago and she sells seafood and also vegetables.

Tania is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise (both vegetables and seafood).  This will help her to improve her stock levels and provide her with better sales opportunities.

In the future, Tania dreams of owning her own vehicle in which she can transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seafood and vegetables

loans.name: Blancanieve

texts.es:
La  Sra. Blancanieve C. B. es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Monte Alto, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, la sra. Valeriana B. de 65 años de edad.
Actualmente tiene 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad que trabajan independientemente.
Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela bien formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora y excelente cliente de nuestra institución y de otras entidades financieras.
La cliente solicita este crédito para comprar mercaderías (azucar, arroz, harina, yerba, fideos, etc.) para la venta en su almacén, ofreciendo las mejores calidades y obteniendo mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Blancanieve C. B. is from the Monte Alto neighborhood of San Estanislao.  She is 24 years old, single, and lives with her 65 year old mother, Mrs. Valeriana B..  [Valeriana] has two adult children and both work on their own.

[Blancaniev] runs a pantry store from her home has established clients, good income, and good personal and business references.  She is a hard working woman and an excellent client of ours and of other financial institutions.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise (sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles, etc.) to sell in her store.  By offering the best quality, she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer soltera de 39 años, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserio de Puntocuatro que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí  a unos 10 minutos  aproximadamente y a una distancia de 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura,  y ganadería .  

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de animales  (cabritos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo para poder en los diferentes mercados de las ciudades de Lambayeque y Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos, mejorando su nivel de vida. 

El crédito que ha solicitado Rosa es de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, el cual será destinado  al mejoramiento de su casa en especial en la colocación de piso ya que es de tierra.  Con la venta de sus animales  podra pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo ayudar  a sus padres en losgastos de casa.

Rosa es una mujer que siempre se encuentra dispuesta a trabajar para seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is single.  She owns her house.  It has both water and electricity and is located in the hamlet of Puntocuarto which belongs to Mochumí District and is about 10 minutes from it and 30 minutes from Lambayeque Department.  This area’s main activities are farming and raising livestock.

Rosa raises goats.  The corral where her animal live is in her yard.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grasses.  She then sells them, once they reach optimal development, in various markets in the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo to increase her income improving her standard of living.

The 3000 new sol loan Rosa has requested from Edpyme Alternativa will be used for home improvement, specifically to install flooring because it’s currently dirt.  She will be able to repay the loan with profits from her animal sales and also use them to help her parents with household expenses.

Rosa is a woman who is always willing to work to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Franklin Rolando

texts.es:
Franklin  Rolando tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Franklin se dedica comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa, tener terrenos para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas
texts.en:
Franklin Rolando is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. He has no children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Franklin Rolando sells vegetables. He gets his supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells his goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

He applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is to buy a house and own a few fields to sow. He likes to practice sports and dance at parties.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda es socia del banco comunal El Arenal del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Lleva 15 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la confección de sabanas, negocio que aprendió en los cursos que Manuela Ramos organiza durante el año, y también confecciona ropas de dormir  para niños.
Con su  nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles compara; 15 metro de tela para sabana, 1 cono de elástico, 30 metro de blondas, 1 kilo de fibra para almohada.
Aprender a coser las sabanas le ha venido muy bien, porque le está sacando provecho a su inversión y agradece a Manuela Ramos por realizar estos cursos que son muy buenos para las mujeres que quieran generarse un ingreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Águeda is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayli. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children.

Águeda has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for 15 years. She produces bed sheets and learned this business from the courses that Manuela Ramos offers throughout the year. Águeda also makes children’s sleepwear.

With her new loan of 1500 PEN, Águeda will buy 15 meters of fabric for bed sheets, one cone of elastic, 30 meters of lace, and one kilo of pillow fibers.

Learning to sew bed sheets turned out to be a very good decision and she has taken advantage of this investment. Águeda is grateful to Manuela Ramos for offering these courses because they are very good for women who want to generate an income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making bed sheets, elastic, lace, and pillow fibers.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 31-year-old mother from the village of Rameh in the north. After completing high school, Abir took cosmetology courses. In 2005 she began running a small hair salon and has gradually built up her business activity. After surveying her clients and potential clients from the area, Abir learned there is a real need for a cosmetics salon. Women from her area want the opportunity to have makeovers and cosmetic treatments.

Abir needed this loan to renovate an extra room for this expanded activity and to purchase supplies, furniture and equipment.

Abir wants to see her salon grow and expand, eventually serving clients from throughout the region.

loans.use: To renovate an extra room for cosmetic treatments and purchase supplies, furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 54-year-old married man with fourteen children and  he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce, specifically beans, for four years and he got his initial capital from poultry farming. His hardship is price fluctuations and  his vision is a stock of 100 bags plus improving his family's living conditions. Samuel needs the loan to buy beans for sale.

loans.use: To buy beans.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa vive en un barrio que se llama San Pedro, una comunidad alejada de lo que es el centro, cabe mencionar que no hay un transporte que llegue a esta comunidad ya que los caminos son muy dificiles de transitar para un automovil, la señora Teresa vive en union libre hace poco mas de dos años, su esposo si trabaja pero es muy poco lo que gana, el señor se dedica a la siembra de maiz y tambien es empleado en una miscelanea. Ellos tienen su casa propia y una niña pequeña de 2 años de edad que es el motivo que tienen para echarle ganas los dos, por ejemplo doña Teresa cria puercos para poderlos vender y de esta manera ayudar con los gastos que tienen dia a dia en su casa y con su hija. 
Nos comenta que sus dificultades son que los puercos lleguen a crecer ya que el clima puede afectar en que los puercos se enfermen; es por ello que la señora hace un gasto para comprar medicamentos y no se enfermen ya que esta dentro de sus metas poder tener muchos animales y mejorar su situacion economica, de esta forma le gustaria ir arreglando su casa, el lugar donde vive, para que sea un lugar bonito y tengan una mejor calidad de vida para su hija.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa lives in a neighborhood called San Pedro, a community that is a long way from town.  It is worth mentioning that there is no public transportation to reach this community and the roads are very difficult to drive by car.   Señora Teresa has been living with her partner for a little over two years.  Her partner works but earns little.  He works growing corn and is also employed in a general store. They have their own house and a little girl aged 2, which is why they both have the desire to do more.  For example, Doña Teresa raises pigs so that she can sell them and thus help with the daily expenses they incur with their home and daughter.

She tells us that her difficulties are because the pigs need to grow and the weather can affect the pigs, making them sick.  This is why the Señora spends money buying medicines so they will not get sick.  Her goals are to have many animals and improve their economic situation, in this way she would like to have her home, the place where she lives, be a nice place and to provide a better quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to raise pigs for sale.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 40-year-old single mother of six children, living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling charcoal for 10 years. She got her initial capital from the savings she had out of farming. 

Her hardship is high license fees and her vision is to own a charcoal store supplying the region, plus to educate her children.

Lillian needs the loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda was born in 1959. She is married with six children who are going to school. Her husband is a farmer. Mrs. Erlinda raises pigs. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about P 2,000. 

Erlinda would like to borrow P 5,000 to buy feed and pigs. She has learned how to manage her business. She hopes to have more pigs in her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
La Señorita Sandra es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería,  agricultura y muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita Sandra tiene 19 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres, su padre se dedica a laborar como albañil y su madre a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al cuidado de su hija y está estudiando turismo en una universidad de la ciudad. En su casa se dedica a la cría cuyes y pollos.
 
En el banco comunal es socia fundadora de este hermoso grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para ampliar el galpón de cuyes.
 
Su meta es ser una gran profesional.

En la fotografía de encuentra nuestra socia con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Mujeres de Chilcatotoras communal bank. She lives in the Turi parish. It has a cold climate and ots people work with cattle, and farming. Many of them work in the city of Cuenca. Its people keep their culture and tradition.  

Sandra is 19 years old. She is a single mother of a 4 year old girl. She lives in her parents' house. Her father is a bricklayer and her mother is a farmer. They own the house they live in. 
 
Sandra takes care of her daughter and she is studying tourism at the university in the city. She raises guinea pigs and chickens in her house. She is a founding member of this beautiful group. The money from the loan will be invested in expanding the guinea pig enclosure. 
 
Her goal is to be a great professional woman. In the photo, she is with her little daughter.

loans.use: to enlarge the guinea pig enclosure.

loans.name: Cecilia Rosa

texts.es: Cecilia vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y conforma una familia fundamentada en el amor y conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella vende mercancía mediante varias guías especializadas de productos y también responde a su clientela, con los pedidos que estos le hacen  de artículos que no aparecen en sus catálogos de exhibición. Cuando inició su aventura emprendedora, vendía los productos de familiares que estaban vinculados a las revistas, pero gradualmente cuando fue ganando espacio en el mercado, construyó un pequeño capital e inició su proseo de independencia y afiliación directa a varias empresas que vende mediante estas guías especializadas de productos y así empezó atendiendo directamente y de manera gradual,  con sus catálogos a la clientela. Poco a poco ha crecido y hoy su situación es otra, porque muchas veces no responde oportunamente a pedidos sobre promociones de productos que salen a buenos precios y sus clientes se pierden de adquirir lo que ellos necesitan y ella de ganar dinero. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual responderá oportunamente a mercancías solicitadas en sus revistas, que hoy aparecieron con descuentos, pues sus clientes así como ella, se preparan para responder con obsequios   el día del amor y de la amistad,  que ya se acerca y tienen  planeado hacer sus compras a Cecilia.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias and forms a family consisting of her husband and two children based on love.  She sells merchandise via specialized catalogues and also responds to customer orders for items not appearing in the catalogues.  

When she started her entrepreneurial adventure, she sold items that were tied to the catalogues but gradually, as she gained more market space, she amassed a small amount of capital and started the process of becoming independent and became directly associated with various firms that sell these products through specialized catalogues and thus started to sell directly and gradually to customers.  She’s grown gradually and now her situation is different because sometimes she’s unable to respond promptly to customer orders for products that are on special offer or on sale and so her customers lose out on getting what they want and she misses out on earning money.

This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan that will make it possible for her to respond in an opportune manner to requested merchandise from her catalogues that appear with discounts because both her customers and she, herself, are getting ready to respond with gifts for the Day of Love and Friendship that’s approaching and they are planning to buy from Cecilia.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, perfume, women's and home accessories.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 50 years old, married, has three children and lives in the Philippines. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living as a farmer, raising mostly rice. She is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizer to use when she plants her next crop. She has been a member of PMPC for two months, and hopes to earn enough money from her farm to educate her children through the college level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a jolly and optimistic person. Though her life is less fortunate, she still works hard and hopes for a better quality of life for her family someday. Instead of lazing at home, she established a business of raising hogs to fatten and sell in the future to the butchers who came into their village. Mercedes had been in this business for almost three years. She usually generates an income of P3,000 per each hog sold.

She is now 33 years old and has three children to educate. She is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy an additional hog to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins to ensure proper growth and nutrition. 

She wants to continuously provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog to raise and to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Luciana works hard to support her family. She has selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Luciana is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina de 32 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda su familia.

Martina observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general.  Al comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades le ayuda en bajar el precio que paga a su proveedor. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Martina es muy trabajadora, empeñosa y dedicado frente a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores opciones en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is 32 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her house only has electricity and is located in the rural district of Tambogrande, which is in the department of Piura.  This area is known for farming, ranching, and craftwork.

For several years now, she has had a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and customers from the area everyday products, from basic necessities to groceries in general.  She has an established clientele and no competition close to her business.  This business allows her to pay for her family's expenses.

Martina notes that her business has been growing well and she wants to keep expanding it by buying more merchandise, such as food products and groceries in general.  Buying her products in large quantities helps her lower the price she pays her supplier.  For that reason, she decided it would be a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles.  Martina is very hardworking, determined, and dedicated to her business.  She wants to earn more to be able to offer her family more options in life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as food products and groceries in general, to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new car engine

loans.name: Emma Delia

texts.es:
Emma Delia tiene 26 años de edad es soltera  tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la mamá y con los hijos de 7, 3, 5 y 1 año de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Emma se dedica a la agricultura y ha realizar quehaceres domésticos, Las compras de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar productos agrícolas,semillas, abonos, urea, insecticidas con el dinero del crédito le ayudará a obtener mejores beneficios.

El sueño es poder tener una casa, no se le han presentado ningún tipo de problemas, en los tiempos libres le gusta pasar el día con los hijos.
texts.en:
Emma Delia is 26 years old and is single.  She has four children, and lives with her mom and her children who are aged 7, 3, 5, and 1 year in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "LUCHANDO JUNTOS" ["Striving Together"], is located in the new Zapotal district in the Ventanas Canton.  The majority of its members work in in retail businesses.

Emma works doing domestic chores.  She makes her purchases and sales in Comisariato.

She is requesting the loan to be able to improve her business.  The money from the loan will help her to earn better profits.

Her dream is to have her own home.  She hasn't come across any types of problems in her business.  In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: para poder comprar productos agrícolas,semillas, abonos, urea, insecticidas

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor trabaja en una imprenta de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para invertir en compra de material (hojas, colores, tonner, etc.) y poder generar otros ingresos al convertirse en socio de la empresa. Héctor es soltero no tiene hijos .Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, y por sus ansias de superación creemos que es un buen candidato para los financiadores en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Héctor works at a print shop in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as paper, ink, toner, and other items. He will be able to generate additional income by becoming a partner in the business. Héctor is single and has no children. He lives at his parents’ house in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan. Due to his will to succeed, Héctor is a good candidate who can be presented before the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, toner, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosalie has a shop that sells snacks, food seasoning and spices, like onions & garlic. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, food seasoning and spices.

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, food seasoning and spices

loans.name: Arlen Martina

texts.es: Arlen está en el último año de su carrera de Derecho, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y poder obtener su título. Le inspiran a seguir adelante sus hijos y sus padres porque desea una mejor vida para ellos. Anhela una casa propia para su familia. Dentro de algunos años se ve trabajando en un bufete jurídico. Dentro sus planes está estudiar dos idiomas inglés y francés. A través de sus estudios espera también poder poner una empresa de taxis junto a su compañero de vida y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arlen is in the last year of her degree program in Law. She is applying for the loan to pay for her final course, and obtain her degree. 

Her children and her parents inspire her to keep moving forward, because she wishes a better life for them. 

Within a few years, she sees herself working in a law practice. Her plans include studying two languages: English and French. 

Through her studies, she also hopes to be able to set up a taxi company with her life companion, and so be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for the final course for her degree.

loans.name: Kinone Group

texts.en:
Monica, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running a grocery store for six years now. She works from 4.00 pm to 12 am daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase stock of the missing items in her grocery store and for household expenses, and paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the stock of the grocery inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to open a bar business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kinole" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eusebio Eraclio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 50 años, pero él tiene el espíritu de un joven de 20, el vive en la ciudad de Ica, tierra generosa caracterizada por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año; Eusebio está casado y junto a su esposa tienen 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 22, 24, 19, 15, todos ellos estudian y con mucho esfuerzo tanto de el cómo de su esposa los saca adelante y actualmente están estudiando en la universidad salvo el menor de todos que cursa el cuarto año de educación secundaria; como buen peruano ama nuestra comida sobre todo su patillo preferido es el “Tallarín Saltado”, Eusebio estudio Música y no solo por ser una carrera, sino también porque le apasiona.

Eusebio se dedica actualmente a tocar música en el cementerio de nuestra ciudad, su fiel aliado en su negocio es su acordeón , con el cual toca infinidad de melodías, el trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias, depende de la cantidad de personas que concurren el camposanto, y el motivo por el que lo hacen, el nos comenta que es muy conmovedor ver a las personas enterrando a sus familiares 	o recordando los años de su fallecimiento pero él siente que con su música puede aliviar en parte el dolor y la tristeza que ellos sienten, en ocasiones el ha llorado mientras tocaba su música, pero la vida continua y hay que seguir adelante, el cree que por la sensibilidad que él tiene le va bien en su negocio porque comprende la pena y el dolor por el que pasan los clientes y por ello tiene trabajo.

Eusebio está muy feliz y muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar los trámites para tener su título de profesor de Música, con esta mejora el podrá enseñar música y con ello obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, así como también ahorrar para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” que sus hijos sean profesionales y formar un negocio de Ganadería”
texts.en:
Eusebio is 50, but has the spirit of young man of 20. He lives in the city of Ica, a generous land noted for its warm climate at any time of year. Eusebio is married, and he and his wife have four children, ages 22, 24, 19, and 15.  All are in school, and with a lot of effort on the part of both he and his wife, he is helping them get ahead in life. Currently they are at university, except for the youngest, who is in fourth year of secondary education. 

As a good Peruvian, he loves our cooking, especially his favorite dish, "Tallarín Saltado" (noodles sauteed with tomatoes, onions, and soy sauce). 

Eusebio studied Music, not only as a career, but also because it is his passion.

At the present time, Eusebio plays music in our city's cemetery. His faithful ally in his business is his accordion, with which he plays countless melodies. He works around six hours daily, depending on the number of people who come to the cemetery. 

The reason he does it, he tells us, is that it is very moving to see people burying their family members, or remembering the year of their passing. But he feels that with his music he can aleviate in part, the pain and sadness that they feel. Sometimes he has cried while he was playing his music, but life goes on, and one has to move forward. 

He thinks that because of the sensitivity he has, it is going well for him in his business; he understands the pain and suffering that his customers are going through, and that is why he has work. 

Eusebio is very happy, and very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to undetake the paperwork necessary to obtain his certification as a music teacher. With this step forward, he will be able to teach music, and so earn greater income to improve his quality of life. As well, he will be able to save, so that he will be able to fulfill his great dream: "That his children become professionals, and to start a livestock business."

loans.use: To pay processing costs for his certification as a music teacher.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
G. Thary works for a cleaning company in the city. She earns a salary of $57.50 each month. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns about $3 a day. G. Thary and her husband have two grown sons, and she would like to help them get started as motor taxi drivers as well. She is requesting a loan for $900. She will use $700 of it to purchase two motor bikes for her sons to use.

G. Thary plans on using the other $200 to repair their home. In the future, G. Thary would like to expand their home so that they may rent out a room and gain additional income. The home repairs that they will use part of this loan for will help make the house ready for this expansion. G. Thary is excited about providing for her family by helping her sons earn an income, and also by making their home safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: Purchase two motor bikes for sons, and repair home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebbecca would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Srk Srey

texts.en:
Srk Srey S. is 26 years old and works in a garment factory earning $2.50/day. Her husband drives a mototaxi and earns $2/day. They have 1 child and are using this loan to build a more proper home.

In the future, the husband wants to become a tuk-tuk driver because the pay is better. They also hope to have enough money to build a gate around their home.

loans.use: To buy wood for building a home

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: A. Mahammad lives in Varkhankend village of Saatli region. He is 47 years old, is married and has 4 children.
