He began his small business in 1995, when he took out a loan and purchased calves for meat purposes. It brought good income and helped to cover his family’s needs. Now he is going to expand his business, and to reach his goal he has applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase three additional calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes business.

loans.name: Fabia Mena

texts.en: Fabia, 56, is a very diligent, hard working, and ambitious woman.  Her children (3 girls and 3 boys) are gown up and currently are professionals and university students. Her husband is a farmer.  For more than 10 years, Fabia had been selling sandwiches,’ churros’ (fried strips of dough), juice, coconuts, and pastry in general.  With the money earned from that activity, and with her husband’s help, she could buy a small locale where she is running a ‘colmaldo,’ a grocery store.  Soap, pasta, oil, candy, drinks, rice, and peas are just some of the goods that can be sold in her grocery.  Fabia thinks about increasing the income obtained from the business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more and new products in order to offer a wider variety of goods with to her clientele.  That way, she will better help her husband face the housing issues.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store with products such as soap, rice, beans, vegetable oil, and new goods in order to satisfy the customers' needs.

loans.name: Akayi

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1964, where she currently lives with her husband and her seven (7) children, Mrs. Akayi A. runs a small business and an animal farm. She earns her income from the sale of sheep. Currently, she would like to develop her farm. The construction of an animal pen, the setting up of a good feed mill, and the purchase of additional sheep - these are her dreams. To achieve this, she would like to use this opportunity to ask for a loan of $350. The income from this business will allow her to better meet the needs of her family, especially in the areas of health, education, and nutrition.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Tannou en 1964 où elle vit toujours avec son mari et ses sept (7) enfants, Madame A. Akayi exerce le petit commerce et l’élevage. Elle tire ses revenus de la vente de ses moutons. Aujourd’hui, elle espère développer cet élevage. Construire un enclos aux bêtes, disposer d’une bonne provenderie et acheter d’autres moutons, tel est son rêve. Pour cela, elle veut passer par ce canal pour solliciter $350. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille notamment en matière de santé, d’éducation scolaire et alimentaire.

loans.use: To buy a feed mill and additional sheep

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: Mussarat B. is from Lahore, a historical city in Pakistan. Her husband operates a fruit and vegetable sales business in the city's food market. Mussarat is a mother of two sons and two daughters. One of her sons is handicapped, while the others all study at a local school. She wishes her children a bright and healthy future. Curently, however, Mussarat needs a loan of US$200 to help her husband buy fruit in bulk for sale. With the help of the loan, she and her family hope to increase their income and later on be able to buy a house of their own.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit in bulk for sale

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Doña Gladiz is a lady who wants to improve and make progress, she is dedicated to the sale of cold beverages (ice, soft drinks, and beer), and in addition she is also dedicated to dressmaking but only on request. Mrs. Gladiz is 48 years old, mother of seven children, four of them independent, and three still living under her care. She wishes to implement and expand her business to offer better service to her customers and be more successful with her sales, and therefore she needs a loan to achieve her purpose and she turns to your generous heart in search for support.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Gladiz, mujer con muchos deseos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (hielo, gaseosas y cervezas), adicionalmente se dedica también al arte textil, pero sólo lo hace cuando se lo solicitan. La señora Gladiz de 48 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos siendo cuatro de ellos ya independientes, mientras que tres de sus hijos todavía se encuentran bajo su protección. Ella quiere implementar y ampliar su negocio de venta de bebidas heladas, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes con el propósito de obtener mayor acogida de los mismos; necesita un préstamo para realizar su propósito y acude a tu generoso corazón en su búsqueda.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand business and increase sales.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar N. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a High School education. He is in the business or raising and selling cattle. He purchases young calves on the market and raises them for 40-45 days. During this time period the calves grow bigger. Akbar sells the grown calves on the market at a profit. This cycle repeats every 50 days. Akbar's main clients are local butchers that purchase the animals for sale as meat. In this manner Akbar's business provides fresh and wholesome meat to the local population. He has about 5 years experience working in this business. The business is the main source of income for his family. He plans to use the money from the loan in order to be able to increase turnover by buying an additional calf. He plan's to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Назиров Акбар житель района Файзабад.Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается откормкой и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков на рынке , откармливает около 40-45 дней. За это время бычки подрастают .Затем клиент продает их на тех же рынках по выгодной ему цене. И так каждые 50 дней.Основными покупателями клиента являются мясники , которые скупают бычков на мясо, что позволяет обеспечить население свежим и полноценным мясом. Опыт работы в этой сфере у клиента около 5 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить свой оборот , путем покупки нового бычка.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Smilja

texts.en: Smilja was born in 1960 and lives in a small village called Opsine, which is near the larger town of Doboj. She farms a plot of land for a living and earns about 500 KM a month. She has applied for her first loan, and intends to use it to buy supplies to increase the output of her farm. Smilja will sell her produce at a local market and use the money she earns to support her family and buy additional supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To improve the output of her farm.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. and her husband married in 1979. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Her son is in school and her daughters are weaving silk at home. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Phalla has been in the business of selling grocery items for four years. She bought them from market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for eight years.

Mrs. Phalla is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase grocery items for resale and for buying silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and for buying silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Y. Ibrohim is 30 years old. He is married. He is the father of three wonderful children. Ibrohim’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. Ibrohim is a market vendor. He is selling brooms in the local market. As a rule he purchases the brooms from the neighboring country Uzbekistan and the city of Kokand.

Ibrohim has been in this business for 6 years. His wife and elder daughter, who is pictured in the photo, help him with painting the brooms. Usually they paint the brooms with a red color in order to give them a good look to attract clients. Therefore the goods that is he selling are in great demand. The business is stable and allows Ibrohim to use the generated income for improving the living conditions of the family. Today he requests $700 for the term of 9 months. The loan shall be used for increasing the stock of goods. Ibrohim thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of brooms to increase inventory

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, 32 years old, is married with no children. Her inability to have children has a medical reason. However, she takes care of 2 of her sister's kids. She is a trader who trades in garment clothes and polyesters, women's slippers, and dressing bags. She normally buys her supplies on credit and pays back when the goods are sold. She is however convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to purchase bulk amounts of garment clothes, slippers, and dressing bags to enable her to reduce her cost to raise a good income. She hopes to use part of her profit to get a decent shelter for her family in the future. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees loans through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount. Theresa's photograph was taken at her group meeting. She is the one with the red handkerchief.

loans.use: To purchase bulk amounts of garment clothes, slippers, and dressing bags

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
Furkat K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is single. For the past two years he has been working as a hairdresser. Furkat is planning to get married but he does not have enough money for the wedding. Therefore he turned to us for help. He would like to get a loan of 1000 dollars that he would repay within the next year.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Каримов Фуркат житель города Душанбе. Не женат. Работает парикмахером. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже два года. Планирует женится, но у него не хватает денег на проведение свадебных обрядов. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Хочет получить 1000 долларов США, сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: for the wedding

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married and lives with her husband Vasyl. All of her children are grown. Due to increasing inflation after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Mariya was forced to find ways to sustain herself and she wanted to help her family. That is how she started as a market vendor selling women's clothing in the central market of Uzhgorod. Mariya has been running a kiosk selling this type of merchandise for 7 years already. 

Mariya is always very affable and polite with her customers. Her good managerial skills help her to keep expenses to a minimum. The market where Mariya works is the only one in the neighborhood and there are few other entrepreneurs offering the same type of goods. This is another reason for Mariya's high sales and the success of her trade. Mariya is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase her inventory. She is planning to re-stock her kiosk with clothing items to boost her sales. Being a good steward of the money she receives, Mariya will manage this loan efficiently and repay it on time. Hopefully, one day she'll be able to fulfill her dream and open her own little store of clothing items. 

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is 36 years old. She is married with one child aged 15. She has run her own shop, a general store, since 2005, working from 8am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rahma is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities to increase her present stock in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her present stock.

loans.name: Prossy Kabejja's Group

texts.en:
Prossy is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 50-year-old divorced woman with 2 children, aged 17 and 15. Both her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house, where she is staying with 3 people. Prossy takes care of her old mother. They do have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets 3 meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Prossy sells secondhand clothes in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. On average she can sell to 10 people a day. Prossy has been in this business for 5 years and works 7 days a week. Formerly Prossy was operating a restaurant at her residence. Her major challenges are the rainy season, seasonality, and business taxes, and feeding the family is at times difficult.

Prossy has been with MCDT for 4 years and is servicing her seventh loan. She is aspiring to see her business expand so that she can start selling wholesale.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. S. L. habita en la comarca El Sinchal, Tecolostote, donde habita junto a su esposa y 1 hija menor de edad, como pequeño productor arrocero socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza a traves de la cual tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la instalacion de 1 trillo arrocero, lo que le permitira obtener mayores rendimiento economico, ya que en la actualidad por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 4 mzs de arroz, las que atiende personalemente, esto le permite obtener utilidades que le garantizan el bienestar familiar, su sueño es ser socio de este trillo que le permitira contar con el equipo de trillado en su comunidad y propio.
texts.en:
S. L. lives in the Sinchal, Tecolostote region alongside his wife and young daughter. He is a small producer of rice and a member of the Esperanza cooperative through which he has the opportunity to participate as a partner in the installation of one rice thresher, which will allow him to obtain greater economic performance. Currently, through his own efforts, he has established four rice fields, which he tends to personally. This allows him to obtain profits that will guarantee the wellbeing of his family. His dream is to be a member of this thresher cooperative that will allow him to rely on his community's threshing team and himself.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 30% contribution to the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Z. Inobat has been working tightly with our program since 2005. She is an active client of our program and she recommended herself as a serious client. Thanks to the previous loans, she has improved the business significantly and increased the business turnover. She lives in the B. Gafurov region and trades in the local bazaar called Farovon. She buys and sells children's clothing. She brings the goods from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic where she goes twice per month. She has a good assortment. Now Mrs. Z. is applying to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 2 months so she can import seasonal wear.

loans.use: To import seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Celestina es casada, tiene  61 años y tiene cuatro hijos entre 23 y 35 años todos sus hijos están casados y trabajan.  
Celestina  tiene un negocio D. una bodega que se llama ”Virgen del Pilar” desD. hace 33 años, venD. todos los días con  ayuda su esposo. 
DesD. que esta en Finca  se encuentra más estable, poco a poco ha ido surgiendo con la ayuda D. las charlas

Celestina solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes, gaseosas, dulces, todas las compras D. sus productos ella compra al por mayor.
Celestina sueña con surtir más su  bodega D. mercadería y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. She is 61 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 23 and 35. All of her children are married and work. Celestina has had a grocery store called "Virgen del Pilar" for 33 years. She opens her store every day with her husband. Since she joined FINCA her business has been more stable and she has been improving with the help of its talks. Celestina is asking for a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in purchasing groceries, soft drinks and candies. All of which she will purchase wholesale. Celestina's dream is to increase the stock in her grocery store and to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan V. L. vive en vivienda propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Exaltación Karguani y sus tres hijos.
El señor Juan trabaja como empleado en obras civiles de la alcaldía de La Paz y su esposa vende fruta en un puesto ambulante de su zona.
Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción de estructura, muros y techado de dos habitaciones.
El crédito es para la construcción en obra fina de las dos habitaciones que les permitirán mas espacio a su familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan V. L. lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone, on the west side of La Paz city. He lives with his wife, Exaltación Karguani, and their three children. Juan works for the public works departs of the city of La Paz and his wife sells fruit from a mobile cart in the neighborhood. With previous loans they built the foundation, walls and ceilings for two rooms. This loan is to finish off the two rooms which will give his family more space. This is the eight time he has applied for a loan and a socio-economic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon,, with his wife and their two children. Mohamad has owned a barber shop for a year and a half. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to change the décor of his salon. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is speciA. in his work because he does nice hair cuts and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family member, friends and neighbors. In the future, Mohamad plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to change the décor of his salon.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza E., 49 years old and married, lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 3 children. Her husband is a "tricycle" (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. In order to help her husband, she decided to open up a "sari-sari" store (mini grocery store) as additional source of income. She was able to manage the business successfully, in fact, she was able to expand it and do some minor renovation of their store.

Liza joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access their financial services as well as their insurance and other benefits given to members. Now she is applying for PHP 20,000 to purchase basic commodities for sale. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for sale

loans.name: Evarista

texts.en:
Evarista M. A. is 57 years old and lives with her common-law husband; they have seven children. Evarista sells clothing in Urubamba’s main market, a business she has been in for quite some time now. She works all day, six days per week. She is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of clothing for men, women, and children.

Evarista is a member of the Sayhua 2 Village Bank, an experienced group that has been taking out loans from Asociación Arariwa for years. Two of her adult daughters are also members of the Sayhua 2 Village Bank, though each has her own business and works independently. Evarista has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal for the future is to open up more branches of her business.

loans.use: Buy clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 59 años, es madre de 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad vive sólo con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos en el pequeño taller que acondicionó en su casa para esto. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes tienen confianza en su buena labor y la recomiendan, por ello que sus pedidos van aumentando. Con MFP ya y tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos los integrantes se entienden y tienen mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas, hilos y demás materiales para confeccionar ropa y llevarla a vender a los mercados.
texts.en:
Nelly is 59-year-old mother of 5 children who are now independent. She currently lives alone with her husband, who works in agriculture. For 18 months she has made clothing for children and adults in the little workshop that she has arranged in her house. What she would like from her job is that her clients have confidence in her labor and that they recommend her, so that requests for her work increase in the future. With MFP she has already held 8 loans, and she likes to work with her comunal bank because all of the associates understand one another and communicate a great deal. With the money that she is asking for she will by cloth and other materials to make more clohting, and to bring it for sale in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth B., 44 years of age, is married and the mother of five children in her hometown in Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her primary activity is backyard gardening, in a garden plot planted with corn. As a side business, she also engages in selling fish.

An active member in Paglaum for two years, Elizabeth requested her fourth loan in order to purchase construction materials so as to build more comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her family's home.

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro - Group 4

texts.en:
Juana E. is the group coordinator for these five entrepreneurs. She and her husband have one child living with them at home. Their other two children, ages 23 and 25, live independently.

Juana barely got to elementary school, so she has learned to use her own skills to generate income. Right now she sells various food items at her house for daily cooking. She plans on using this loan to buy more food to sell. She believes that being part of this group and repaying loans to Esperanza will help her grow as a businesswoman.

Juana and her friends live in a small community called Hoyo del Toro. This is a small "batey" (a sugar workers' town) on the outskirts of San Pedro D. Macoris. It is surrounded by large sugar cane fields belonging to a private company. Because of its isolated location, it is rather difficult for people in Hoyo del Toro to conduct business. Sometimes they travel elsewhere on market days to sell.

Please help us support Juana and her fellow borrowers with this Kiva loan.

Thank you!

loans.use: To restock her saleable food items inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her store

loans.name: Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Nevaditas” pertenece al centro focal Villa Exaltación, trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace tres años aproximadamente, a la fecha consta de diez integrantes, demostrando ser un grupo muy alegre y activo en el centro focal.
Diversos son los negocios en este grupo, Patricia por ejemplo se dedica a la repostería, ofrece variedad de tortas, galletas, empanadas y pizas; otras de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de  ropa, elaboración  y venta de productos lácteos, venta de víveres y otros. Ahora ellas necesitan comprar mercadería e insumos para ampliar sus ventas, con el único objetivo de mejorar la estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Nevaditas Group is a member of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center and has worked with the Pro Mujer family for approximately three years. As of now it consists of ten members and is proving to be a very lively and active group in the focal center. The businesses in the group are diverse-- Patricia, for example, sells pastries, offering a variety of cakes, cookies, empanadas and pizzas; other members produce and sell dairy products while others sell clothing, food, and other items. Now they need to buy merchandise and supplies to increase their sales, with the sole objective of improving the economic stability of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is twenty-three years old. She is married and has a daughter in primary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Cecilia is a trader. She sells phone cards by the road in her community. Cecilia buys the cards from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy snap cards in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her daughter a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy snap cards

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and married with three children.  Martha works together with her husband in timber sales.  The family lives in the city of Pucallpa.

Martha has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  Martha used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in a business selling cold drinks that she had at that time.  Martha will use this loan of 2000 soles to purchase timber.  Though she works together with her husband in timber sales, Martha is pleased that her loans provide her with some financial independence.  

Martha's goal is to construct a warehouse from which she can sell her wood.  She also wants to support her son through his studies at a technological institute, a three-year degree.

loans.use: To purchase wood for resale

loans.name: Rukia's Group

texts.en: L. Rukia leads a loan group in Kayunga. She is 28 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom are in primary school. Rukia runs a restaurant in Kayunga North that has been in operation for six months. Ever since she opened this restaurant, her profits have increased slowly and she is now generating a good income. Clients are few only during the rainy season, and her dream is both to enlarge her restaurant and build a house with her husband so that they do not have to pay rent. Rukia plans to use her portion of this loan to buy more seats for her restaurant and make it larger.

loans.use: To buy more seats for her restaurant and make it larger

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 55 years old. Nida is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a store known in the Philippines as a "ukay-ukay," where she sells used clothing and food products to the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nida is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie P. is a dedicated wife and hardworking mother who is also a businesswoman. She strives hard so that she is able to provide a good future for her two young children who are only 1 and 5 years old. Josie is 31 years old and lives in the village of Barangay Canjusa, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental, with her young family. Many of her friends look to her as a role model because of her determination to pursue her dreams and do her utmost to put up a small business and build it up so that she is able to help her husband in supporting and sustaining the needs of their family. Banking on her cooking skills, Josie decided to put a carinderia - a local eatery selling and serving a variety of cooked dishes. A carinderia is also sometimes called a "turo-turo" because the customers literally point to their choice from the array of pots containing the ready-to-eat viands. Josie joined NWTF-Project Dunganon in 2002 to access additional capital she needed to open the eatery she planned to set up adjacent to her house. From the start, she tapped the loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon to continually improve her business facilities and widen her food offerings. And because she proved to be an astute businesswoman, her business generates a good income that significantly helps provide for the support of her family, with enough left over for the savings she set up for her two children. The carinderia provides Josie with an average monthly income of PHP 9,000 which is enabling her to gradually fulfill her dreams, including saving enough to renovate and enlarge the space in her carinderia. This, so that she could have more space for the growing number of customers. In her previous loan, Josie borrowed PHP 17,000 to add to her capital and it was fully repaid without any delays. She is now borrowing PHP 17,500 for her 11th loan. She plans to use it again as revolving working capital so that she can purchase more meat and spices and expand the number and volume of her daily food offerings. She plans to save some of the profits so that she can invest in another productive asset that can contribute to the family income. The rest she plans to plow back into her carinderia business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and spices and expand her daily food offerings

loans.name: Los Ceibos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Ceibos” esta representado por el señor Mariano Casimiro y conformado por 12 miembros que tienen diferentes actividades y L. mayoría vive en L. zona D. ticti norte. Una mayoría se dedican a L. venta D. comida y refrescos,  bisutería, venta D. tarjetas, entre los varones se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros. Pese a existir competencia en el mercado los clientes tratan D. salir adelante y cumplir con sus obligaciones y con el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital D. trabajo, para hacerle frente a L. competencia con L. adquisición D. mercadería nueva, insumos y herramientas para hacerse más competitivos. L. mayoría D. este banco solo trabaja con Agrocapital por lo que van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando capacidad, responsabilidad, unidad y sobre todo ganas D. seguir creciendo
texts.en:
The group "Los Ceibos" is represented by Mr. Mariano Casimiro and is maD. up of 12 members that perform different activities, and the majority lives in the zone of Ticti Norte. Most of them make a living by selling food and drinks, imitation jewelry, or cards, and some work in public transportation. Despite the existence of competition in the market, our clients try to get ahead and fulfill their obligations, as well as support their families. The credit will be used to increase their working capital, in order to stand up to competition with the acquisition of new merchandise, materials, and tools. The majority of this group has worked with Agrocapital through four cycles, demonstrating capacity, responsibility, unity, and above all the desire to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francis Ndungu

texts.en:
Francis Ndung’u is 33 years old and married with two children. He rears chickens and keeps dairy cows. He has been in this business for a period of about nine years and has been earning a profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

He is one of the founders of his borrowers group. Francis wants to use this loan to buy more chickens and an extra dairy cow in order to increase his productivity and profits. He has never borrowed from another MFI. He hopes to have over a thousand chickens and more than ten cows in the future.

About KADET 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase chickens (those that lay eggs) and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
B. Tolib is 31 years old. He sells fabric for national dresses. His store is located in the local central market called “Safina”. Tolib has been in his business for 10 years already. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and wallet, Tolib travels almost every month to the neighboring town to purchase new goods. Tolib has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not fully able to meet the demand. That is why he needs a loan of $800 US.

Your generosity can change his family's life. Tolib wants to expand his business – success will bring a better quality of life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mr. Sin S., 41, pictured with his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Soun, 37, lives in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter.

Sin has been a farmer for 10 years, growing rice on his farmland in the village. His wife has been a silk weaver for 12 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sin is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed D. trades in different types of used clothing. He is married to a businesswoman who owns her own business at the same marketplace.

They have three children, a boy and two girls, and three other dependents. These people give help to the business and house activities when he goes out of town to get his goods.

Mohamed has been in business for about six years and hopes to buy more used clothing, cater to his family and start construction of a building.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing

loans.name: Griselda Anahi

texts.es: La señora Griselda es casada con el señor Iván Alejandro, y son una pareja joven pero muy emprendedora, aun no tienen hijos, pero están luchando y creando un mejor futuro para ellos, el labora como taxista del cual es el propietario, y ella es la dueña de un comedor industrial, donde elabora y vende platillo que ella misma cocina para su los empleados de la empresa; para tal proyecto ellos están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en compra de diferentes productos para su venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Griselda is married to Mr. Iván Alejandro, and they are a young but very enterprising couple. They do not yet have children, but they are striving to create a better future for them. He works as a taxi driver, and is the owner of his own taxi company, and she is the owner of the dining hall in a business, where she prepares and sells dishes that she herself cooks for the business' employees. They are asking for this loan to purchase different products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for food preparation and sales

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha C., age 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sothea Ret, age 25, have been married since 2005 and have a young son. They are living with their parents approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vutha and his wife have been selling fruit (mango) since they were married. They buy it from their villagers and transport it to sell in Phnom Penh market. The couple hopes to expand their business to become bigger and bigger, so Vutha is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruits (mango) under contract for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de oro.

Vilma nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar oro y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio e incrementar su capital. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma is a member of the “Las Calceteras” Communal Bank for some 3 years; she lives in the district of Jualiaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 45 years old, lives with her partner and has 5 children. She completed her primary school education and she now buys and sells gold.

Vilma tells us that that first loan that she received from Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles and it helped her increase her working capital.

She needs a loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles to buy gold so that she can have greater income.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and increase her profits.

What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and conversations with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: F. Célestine est née en 1965 à Agonlin.  Célestine vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 30 ans.  Mariée à AGOSSOU Bertin, un menuisier, elle est mère de sept enfants, dont six sont à sa charge.  Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés.  Célestine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Célestine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, et des divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons de lessive, haricots, papiers hygiénique) au marché d’Agla.  Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 30 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Pahou et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Célestine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Célestine F. was born in 1965 in Agonlin. She has lived in the Agla district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin for the past 30 years. She has seven children, six of whom are at home; not all the children attend school. Célestine lives with her children and her husband. She is married to Bertin Agossou, a carpenter. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. Célestine sells corn, cassava flour and diverse products (pasta, laundry soap, beans, tissue paper) at the Agla market. She started this business 30 years ago. She gets her supplies in Pahou and at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Célestine has repaid the two previous loans from ALIDé and is requesting a third loan to strengthen her business activities.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and develop her business
